original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛgveda

original: svādiṣṭhayā madiṣṭhayā pavasva soma dhārayā /
analyzed: svādiṣṭhayā madiṣṭhayā pavasva soma dhārayā
translated: Flow with the most delightful, most intoxicating stream, O Soma,

original: indrāya pātave sutaḥ //
analyzed: indrāya pātave sutaḥ
translated: Pressed for Indra to drink!

original: rakṣohā viśvacarṣaṇir abhi yonim ayohatam /
analyzed: rakṣaḥ hā viśvacarṣaṇiḥ abhi yonim ayaḥ hatam
translated: Slayer of demons, all-conquering, he has entered the womb of iron,

original: druṇā sadhastham āsadat //🔽varivodhātamo bhava maṃhiṣṭho vṛtrahantamaḥ /
analyzed: druṇā sadhastham āsadat  varivaḥ dhātamaḥ bhava maṃhiṣṭhaḥ vṛtra hantamaḥ
translated: With the tree he has sat down in his abode.🔽Be the most bountiful bestower of room, best Vṛtra-slayer,

original: parṣi rādho maghonām //
analyzed: parṣi rādhaḥ maghonām
translated: You carry the gift of the generous ones.

original: abhy arṣa mahānāṃ devānāṃ vītim andhasā /
analyzed: abhi arṣa mahānām devānām vītim andhasā
translated: Flow to the place of the great gods with your juice,

original: abhi vājam uta śravaḥ //🔽tvām acchā carāmasi tad id arthaṃ divedive /
analyzed: abhi vājam uta śravaḥ  tvām acchā carāmasi tat id artham dive dive
translated: To strength and fame.🔽We serve you for that purpose, O Indu, day by day,

original: indo tve na āśasaḥ //
analyzed: indo tve naḥ āśasaḥ
translated: For that hope of yours.

original: punāti te parisrutaṃ somaṃ sūryasya duhitā /
analyzed: punāti te parisrutam somam sūryasya duhitā
translated: The daughter of the sun purifies your flowing Soma,

original: vāreṇa śaśvatā tanā //
analyzed: vāreṇa śaśvatā tanā
translated: With the eternal sieve.

original: tam īm aṇvīḥ samarya ā gṛbhṇanti yoṣaṇo daśa /
analyzed: tam īm aṇvīḥ samarye ā gṛbhṇanti yoṣaṇaḥ daśa
translated: The ten young maidens grasp him in the battle of the swift ones,

original: svasāraḥ pārye divi //
analyzed: svasāraḥ pārye divi
translated: His sisters, on the last day.

original: tam īṃ hinvanty agruvo dhamanti bākuraṃ dṛtim /
analyzed: tam īm hinvanti agruvaḥ dhamanti bākuram dṛtim
translated: They impel him, the maidens, they blow the bellows, the bag,

original: tridhātu vāraṇam madhu //
analyzed: tri dhātu vāraṇam madhu
translated: The honey of the three-stranded sieve.

original: abhīmam aghnyā uta śrīṇanti dhenavaḥ śiśum /
analyzed: abhi imam aghnyāḥ uta śrīṇanti dhenavaḥ śiśum
translated: The milch cows mix the child with the innocent one,

original: somam indrāya pātave //
analyzed: somam indrāya pātave
translated: Soma for Indra to drink.

original: asyed indro madeṣv ā viśvā vṛtrāṇi jighnate /
analyzed: asya id indraḥ madeṣu ā viśvā vṛtrāṇi jighnate
translated: In his joys, Indra slays all the Vr̥itras here,

original: śūro maghā ca maṃhate //
analyzed: śūraḥ maghā ca maṃhate
translated: The hero and the generous one gives (gifts).

original: pavasva devavīr ati pavitraṃ soma raṃhyā /
analyzed: pavasva deva vīḥ ati pavitram soma raṃhyā
translated: Flow, O Soma, with the might of the gods, through the purifying cloth, O swift one,

original: indram indo vṛṣā viśa //
analyzed: indram indo vṛṣā viśa
translated: To Indra, O Indu, O bull, enter the most splendid abode,

original: ā vacyasva mahi psaro vṛṣendo dyumnavattamaḥ /
analyzed: ā vacyasva mahi psaraḥ vṛṣā indo dyumnavattamaḥ
translated: O Soma, O mighty one, as the most glorious one.

original: ā yoniṃ dharṇasiḥ sadaḥ //
analyzed: ā yonim dharṇasiḥ sadaḥ
translated: Sit in the place of the firm one.

original: adhukṣata priyam madhu dhārā sutasya vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: adhukṣata priyam madhu dhārā sutasya vedhasaḥ
translated: They have milked the dear honey, the stream of the pressed Soma of the creator,

original: apo vasiṣṭa sukratuḥ //
analyzed: apaḥ vasiṣṭa sukratuḥ
translated: The waters, O Vasisṭha, the wise one.

original: mahāntaṃ tvā mahīr anv āpo arṣanti sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: mahāntam tvā mahīḥ anu āpaḥ arṣanti sindhavaḥ
translated: The great ones, the mighty ones, the waters, the streams follow thee,

original: yad gobhir vāsayiṣyase //
analyzed: yat gobhiḥ vāsayiṣyase
translated: When thou wilt clothe thyself with the cows.

original: samudro apsu māmṛje viṣṭambho dharuṇo divaḥ /
analyzed: samudraḥ apsu māmṛje viṣṭambhaḥ dharuṇaḥ divaḥ
translated: The ocean is anointed in the waters, the prop, the support of the sky,

original: somaḥ pavitre asmayuḥ //
analyzed: somaḥ pavitre asmayuḥ
translated: Soma, in the purifying cloth, eager for us.

original: acikradad vṛṣā harir mahān mitro na darśataḥ /
analyzed: acikradat vṛṣā hariḥ mahān mitraḥ na darśataḥ
translated: The great tawny bull has bellowed, beautiful like Mitra,

original: saṃ sūryeṇa rocate //
analyzed: sam sūryeṇa rocate
translated: He shines together with the sun.

original: giras ta inda ojasā marmṛjyante apasyuvaḥ /🔽yābhir madāya śumbhase //
analyzed: giraḥ te indo ojasā marmṛjyante apasyuvaḥ  yābhiḥ madāya śumbhase
translated: Thy songs, O Indra, are being cleansed with might, the most active ones,🔽With which thou dost adorn thyself for joy.

original: taṃ tvā madāya ghṛṣvaya u lokakṛtnum īmahe /
analyzed: tam tvā madāya ghṛṣvayaḥ u loka kṛtnum īmahe
translated: We implore thee, O joyous one, for our joy, the creator of worlds,

original: tava praśastayo mahīḥ //
analyzed: tava praśastayaḥ mahīḥ
translated: Thy praises are great.

original: asmabhyam indav indrayur madhvaḥ pavasva dhārayā /
analyzed: asmabhyam indo indrayuḥ madhvaḥ pavasva dhārayā
translated: O Soma, flow for Indra, for joy, with thy stream, O sweet one,

original: parjanyo vṛṣṭimāṃ iva //
analyzed: parjanyaḥ vṛṣṭimān iva
translated: Like Parjanya full of rain.

original: goṣā indo nṛṣā asy aśvasā vājasā uta /
analyzed: go sāḥ indo nṛ sāḥ asi aśva sāḥ vāja sāḥ uta
translated: Thou art the winner of cattle, O Indu, the winner of men, the winner of horses, and also of strength,

original: ātmā yajñasya pūrvyaḥ //
analyzed: ātmā yajñasya pūrvyaḥ
translated: The ancient self of the sacrifice.

original: eṣa devo amartyaḥ parṇavīr iva dīyati /
analyzed: eṣa devaḥ amartyaḥ parṇa vīḥ iva dīyati
translated: This immortal God moves like a bird,

original: abhi droṇāny āsadam //
analyzed: abhi droṇāni āsadam
translated: He has sat down in the troughs.

original: eṣa devo vipā kṛto 'ti hvarāṃsi dhāvati /
analyzed: eṣa devaḥ vipā kṛtaḥ ti hvarāṃsi dhāvati
translated: This God, made ready by the pressers, runs🔽Over the fleecy straining-cloths,

original: pavamāno adābhyaḥ //
analyzed: pavamānaḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: This Pavamâna, irresistible.

original: eṣa devo vipanyubhiḥ pavamāna ṛtāyubhiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa devaḥ vipanyubhiḥ pavamānaḥ ṛtāyubhiḥ
translated: This God, Pavamâna, with the men who long for light,

original: harir vājāya mṛjyate //
analyzed: hariḥ vājāya mṛjyate
translated: The golden-hued is cleansed for strength.

original: eṣa viśvāni vāryā śūro yann iva satvabhiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa viśvāni vāryā śūraḥ yan iva satvabhiḥ
translated: This Hero, as 'twere with heroes, strives for all good things,

original: pavamānaḥ siṣāsati //
analyzed: pavamānaḥ siṣāsati
translated: Pavamâna strives to win.

original: eṣa devo ratharyati pavamāno daśasyati /
analyzed: eṣa devaḥ ratharyati pavamānaḥ daśasyati
translated: This God, Pavamâna, speeds him on, he shows his bounty,

original: āviṣ kṛṇoti vagvanum //
analyzed: āvis kṛṇoti vagvanum
translated: And makes the singer's voice to spread.

original: eṣa viprair abhiṣṭuto 'po devo vi gāhate /
analyzed: eṣa vipraiḥ abhiṣṭutaḥ u devaḥ vi gāhate
translated: This God, the Sage, the Holy One, the Purifier, penetrates the waters,

original: dadhad ratnāni dāśuṣe //
analyzed: dadhat ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: And brings treasures to the worshipper.

original: eṣa divaṃ vi dhāvati tiro rajāṃsi dhārayā /
analyzed: eṣa divam vi dhāvati tiras rajāṃsi dhārayā
translated: This God runs through the region, through the misty realms of air,

original: pavamānaḥ kanikradat //
analyzed: pavamānaḥ kanikradat
translated: Pavamâna, roaring mightily.

original: eṣa divaṃ vy āsarat tiro rajāṃsy aspṛtaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa divam vi āsarat tiras rajāṃsi a spṛtaḥ
translated: This God hath spread himself abroad, unwearied, through the misty realms of air,

original: pavamānaḥ svadhvaraḥ //
analyzed: pavamānaḥ su adhvaraḥ
translated: Pavamâna, most devout.

original: eṣa pratnena janmanā devo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa pratnena janmanā devaḥ devebhyaḥ sutaḥ
translated: This God, by ancient generation, pressed for the Gods,

original: hariḥ pavitre arṣati //
analyzed: hariḥ pavitre arṣati
translated: The golden-hued flows on to the sieve.

original: eṣa u sya puruvrato jajñāno janayann iṣaḥ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ u sya puru vrataḥ jajñānaḥ janayan iṣaḥ
translated: This God, of many holy laws, when born, producing food,

original: dhārayā pavate sutaḥ //
analyzed: dhārayā pavate sutaḥ
translated: Flows on with stream when purified.

original: sanā ca soma jeṣi ca pavamāna mahi śravaḥ /
analyzed: sana ca soma jeṣi ca pavamāna mahi śravaḥ
translated: Thou, Soma, winnest fame by ancient birth, O Pavamâna, great is thy renown.

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: sanā jyotiḥ sanā svar viśvā ca soma saubhagā /
analyzed: sana jyotiḥ sana svar viśvā ca soma saubhagā
translated: The light of old, the heaven of old, and all prosperity, O Soma,

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: sanā dakṣam uta kratum apa soma mṛdho jahi /
analyzed: sana dakṣam uta kratum apa soma mṛdhaḥ jahi
translated: The strength of old and the wisdom, O Soma, drive away our enemies,

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: pavītāraḥ punītana somam indrāya pātave /
analyzed: pavītāraḥ punītana somam indrāya pātave
translated: Purifiers, purify the Soma for Indra to drink,

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: tvaṃ sūrye na ā bhaja tava kratvā tavotibhiḥ /
analyzed: tvam sūrye naḥ ā bhaja tava kratvā tava ūtibhiḥ
translated: Thou art the portion in the sun, by thy wisdom and thy help,

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: tava kratvā tavotibhir jyok paśyema sūryam /
analyzed: tava kratvā tava ūtibhiḥ jyok paśyema sūryam
translated: By thy wisdom and thy help may we long behold the sun,

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: abhy arṣa svāyudha soma dvibarhasaṃ rayim /
analyzed: abhi arṣa su āyudha soma dvibarhasam rayim
translated: Flow on, O Soma, with thy weapon, wealth that is doubly strong,

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: abhy arṣānapacyuto rayiṃ samatsu sāsahiḥ /
analyzed: abhi arṣa an apacyutaḥ rayim samatsu sāsahiḥ
translated: Flow on, not failing, wealth that conquers in the contests,

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: tvāṃ yajñair avīvṛdhan pavamāna vidharmaṇi /
analyzed: tvām yajñaiḥ avīvṛdhan pavamāna vidharmaṇi
translated: They have strengthened thee with sacrifices, O Pavamâna, in the conflict,

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: rayiṃ naś citram aśvinam indo viśvāyum ā bhara /
analyzed: rayim naḥ citram aśvinam indo viśvāyum ā bhara
translated: Bring us, O Indu, wealth in horses, wondrous, life-bestowing,

original: athā no vasyasas kṛdhi //
analyzed: athā naḥ vasyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: So make us better still.

original: samiddho viśvatas patiḥ pavamāno vi rājati /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ viśvatas patiḥ pavamānaḥ vi rājati
translated: Enkindled, the all-supporting Pavamâna shines forth as King,

original: prīṇan vṛṣā kanikradat //
analyzed: prīṇan vṛṣā kanikradat
translated: The bull, delighting, lowing.

original: tanūnapāt pavamānaḥ śṛṅge śiśāno arṣati /
analyzed: tanūnapāt pavamānaḥ śṛṅge śiśānaḥ arṣati
translated: Tanūnapāt, Pavamāna, sharpening on the peak, flows on.

original: antarikṣeṇa rārajat //
analyzed: antarikṣeṇa rārajat
translated: Shining in the atmosphere.

original: īḷenyaḥ pavamāno rayir vi rājati dyumān /
analyzed: īḍenyaḥ pavamānaḥ rayiḥ vi rājati dyumān
translated: Pavamāna, to be desired, wealth, shines forth, radiant,

original: madhor dhārābhir ojasā //
analyzed: madhoḥ dhārābhiḥ ojasā
translated: With the streams of honey, with strength.

original: barhiḥ prācīnam ojasā pavamāna stṛṇan hariḥ /
analyzed: barhiḥ prācīnam ojasā pavamāna stṛṇan hariḥ
translated: The tawny Pavamāna, spreading out the ancient strew with might,

original: deveṣu deva īyate //
analyzed: deveṣu devaḥ īyate
translated: Goes to the gods, a god.

original: ud ātair jihate bṛhad dvāro devīr hiraṇyayīḥ /
analyzed: ud ā ataiḥ jihate bṛhat dvāraḥ devīḥ hiraṇyayīḥ
translated: The two doors of the gods, the two golden doors, are opened wide by the winds.

original: pavamānena suṣṭutāḥ //
analyzed: pavamānena suṣṭutāḥ
translated: Well-praised by Pavamāna.

original: suśilpe bṛhatī mahī pavamāno vṛṣaṇyati /
analyzed: su śilpe bṛhatī mahī pavamānaḥ vṛṣaṇyati
translated: Pavamāna, the two beautiful, great, bountiful ones, the two Dawns,

original: naktoṣāsā na darśate //
analyzed: nakta uṣāsā na darśate
translated: Shine like the two Nakshatras.

original: ubhā devā nṛcakṣasā hotārā daivyā huve /
analyzed: ubhā devā nṛ cakṣasā hotārā daivyā huve
translated: I invoke the two divine Hotrs, the two gods with human eyes,

original: pavamāna indro vṛṣā //
analyzed: pavamānaḥ indraḥ vṛṣā
translated: Pavamāna, Indra, the bull.

original: bhāratī pavamānasya sarasvatīḷā mahī /
analyzed: bhāratī pavamānasya sarasvatī iḍā mahī
translated: Bhāratī, Sarasvatī, and the great one of Pavamāna,

original: imaṃ no yajñam ā gaman tisro devīḥ supeśasaḥ //
analyzed: imam naḥ yajñam ā gaman tisraḥ devīḥ supeśasaḥ
translated: May these three goddesses of beautiful forms come to this our sacrifice.

original: tvaṣṭāram agrajāṃ gopām puroyāvānam ā huve /🔽indur indro vṛṣā hariḥ pavamānaḥ prajāpatiḥ //
analyzed: tvaṣṭāram agra jām gopām puras yāvānam ā huve  induḥ indraḥ vṛṣā hariḥ pavamānaḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: I invoke Tvaṣṭar, the eldest, the guardian, the forerunner,🔽Indra, the bull, the tawny one, Pavamāna, Prajāpati.

original: vanaspatim pavamāna madhvā sam aṅgdhi dhārayā /
analyzed: vanaspatim pavamāna madhvā sam aṅgdhi dhārayā
translated: O Pavamāna, anoint with honey the lord of the forest with the stream,

original: sahasravalśaṃ haritam bhrājamānaṃ hiraṇyayam //
analyzed: sahasra valśam haritam bhrājamānam hiraṇyayam
translated: The golden one, shining, with a thousand branches, green.

original: viśve devāḥ svāhākṛtim pavamānasyā gata /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ svāhākṛtim pavamānasya ā gata
translated: The All-Gods have come to the oblation-form of the purifying Soma,

original: vāyur bṛhaspatiḥ sūryo 'gnir indraḥ sajoṣasaḥ //
analyzed: vāyuḥ bṛhaspatiḥ sūryaḥ gniḥ indraḥ sajoṣasaḥ
translated: Vayu, Brihaspati, Surya, Agni, Indra, in unison.

original: mandrayā soma dhārayā vṛṣā pavasva devayuḥ /
analyzed: mandrayā soma dhārayā vṛṣā pavasva devayuḥ
translated: O Soma, flow on, bull, with the sweet stream, dear to the gods,

original: avyo vāreṣv asmayuḥ //
analyzed: avyaḥ vāreṣu asmayuḥ
translated: unobstructed in the sieves, not to be assailed.

original: abhi tyam madyam madam indav indra iti kṣara /
analyzed: abhi tyam madyam madam indo indraḥ iti kṣara
translated: O Indra, pour forth that gladdening drink, the drop,

original: abhi vājino arvataḥ //
analyzed: abhi vājinaḥ arvataḥ
translated: towards the strong horses.

original: abhi tyam pūrvyam madaṃ suvāno arṣa pavitra ā /
analyzed: abhi tyam pūrvyam madam suvānaḥ arṣa pavitre ā
translated: Flowing, press out that ancient gladdening drink, towards the purifying sieve,

original: abhi vājam uta śravaḥ //
analyzed: abhi vājam uta śravaḥ
translated: towards strength and fame.

original: anu drapsāsa indava āpo na pravatāsaran /
analyzed: anu drapsāsaḥ indavaḥ āpaḥ na pravatā asaran
translated: The drops of Soma, like waters, have flowed along the paths,

original: punānā indram āśata //
analyzed: punānāḥ indram āśata
translated: purifying, have come to Indra.

original: yam atyam iva vājinam mṛjanti yoṣaṇo daśa /
analyzed: yam atyam iva vājinam mṛjanti yoṣaṇaḥ daśa
translated: Whom the ten maidens cleanse like a swift horse,

original: vane krīḷantam atyavim //
analyzed: vane krīḍantam atyavim
translated: the courser sporting in the wood.

original: taṃ gobhir vṛṣaṇaṃ rasam madāya devavītaye /
analyzed: tam gobhiḥ vṛṣaṇam rasam madāya deva vītaye
translated: Him, the strong juice, with the cows, for the gladdening of the feast of the gods,

original: sutam bharāya saṃ sṛja //
analyzed: sutam bharāya sam sṛja
translated: mix for bearing away.

original: devo devāya dhārayendrāya pavate sutaḥ /
analyzed: devaḥ devāya dhārayā indrāya pavate sutaḥ
translated: The god, pressed, flows on for the god, for Indra,

original: payo yad asya pīpayat //
analyzed: payaḥ yat asya pīpayat
translated: the milk which he has caused to flow.

original: ātmā yajñasya raṃhyā suṣvāṇaḥ pavate sutaḥ /
analyzed: ātmā yajñasya raṃhyā suṣvāṇaḥ pavate sutaḥ
translated: The self of the sacrifice, the well-swung, pressed, flows on,

original: pratnaṃ ni pāti kāvyam //
analyzed: pratnam ni pāti kāvyam
translated: protecting the ancient hymn.

original: evā punāna indrayur madam madiṣṭha vītaye /
analyzed: eva punānaḥ indrayuḥ madam madiṣṭha vītaye
translated: Thus, being purified, most gladdening, delighting Indra, for the feast,

original: guhā cid dadhiṣe giraḥ //
analyzed: guhā cit dadhiṣe giraḥ
translated: thou containest even hidden songs.

original: asṛgram indavaḥ pathā dharmann ṛtasya suśriyaḥ /
analyzed: asṛgram indavaḥ pathā dharman ṛtasya su śriyaḥ
translated: The drops have flowed along the path of holy order, of truth's fair glory,

original: vidānā asya yojanam //🔽pra dhārā madhvo agriyo mahīr apo vi gāhate /
analyzed: vidānāḥ asya yojanam  pra dhārāḥ madhvaḥ agriyaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ vi gāhate
translated: Finding his yoking of the car.🔽The streams of meath most rich in sweets have plunged into the mighty waters,

original: havir haviṣṣu vandyaḥ //
analyzed: haviḥ haviḥṣu vandyaḥ
translated: To be adored as sacred food among the sacrificial viands.

original: pra yujo vāco agriyo vṛṣāva cakradad vane /

original: tantuṃ tanvānam uttamam anu pravata āśata /
analyzed: tantum tanvānam uttamam anu pravataḥ āśata
translated: Following the highest thread which he is spinning, they have come to the path,

original: utedam uttamāyyam //
analyzed: uta idam uttamāyyam
translated: And this highest offering.

original: tvaṃ soma paṇibhya ā vasu gavyāni dhārayaḥ /
analyzed: tvam soma paṇibhyaḥ ā vasu gavyāni dhārayaḥ
translated: Thou, O Soma, hast bestowed on the sacrificers the treasures consisting of cattle,

original: tataṃ tantum acikradaḥ //
analyzed: tatam tantum acikradaḥ
translated: And hast stretched out the thread.

original: somā asṛgram āśavo madhor madasya dhārayā /
analyzed: somāḥ asṛgram āśavaḥ madhoḥ madasya dhārayā
translated: The swift Somas have flowed forth with the stream of the rapture of sweetness,

original: abhi viśvāni kāvyā //
analyzed: abhi viśvāni kāvyā
translated: To all the treasures of the wise.

original: anu pratnāsa āyavaḥ padaṃ navīyo akramuḥ /
analyzed: anu pratnāsaḥ āyavaḥ padam navīyaḥ akramuḥ
translated: The ancient living ones have followed the newest path.

analyzed: ruce jananta sūryam  ā pavamāna naḥ bhara aryaḥ a dāśuṣaḥ gayam

original: kṛdhi prajāvatīr iṣaḥ //
analyzed: kṛdhi prajāvatīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: Make our food abundant with offspring.

original: abhi somāsa āyavaḥ pavante madyam madam /
analyzed: abhi somāsaḥ āyavaḥ pavante madyam madam
translated: The living Somas are flowing, the Soma, the exhilarating drink,

original: abhi kośam madhuścutam //
analyzed: abhi kośam madhuścutam
translated: To the vat that drips with sweetness.

original: somo arṣati dharṇasir dadhāna indriyaṃ rasam /
analyzed: somaḥ arṣati dharṇasiḥ dadhānaḥ indriyam rasam
translated: Soma flows on, the supporter, bearing the essence of power,

original: suvīro abhiśastipāḥ //
analyzed: su vīraḥ abhiśasti pāḥ
translated: The protector of the hero from imprecation.

original: indrāya soma pavase devebhyaḥ sadhamādyaḥ /
analyzed: indrāya soma pavase devebhyaḥ sadhamādyaḥ
translated: O Soma, thou flowest for Indra, the best mixer with the gods.

original: indo vājaṃ siṣāsasi //
analyzed: indo vājam siṣāsasi
translated: O Indu, thou longest for strength.

original: asya pītvā madānām indro vṛtrāṇy aprati /
analyzed: asya pītvā madānām indraḥ vṛtrāṇi aprati
translated: Having drunk of his gladdening juices, Indra has slain the foes that are not to be resisted.

original: jaghāna jaghanac ca nu //
analyzed: jaghāna jaghanat ca nu
translated: He has slain, and will slay again.

original: pra somāso adhanviṣuḥ pavamānāsa indavaḥ /
analyzed: pra somāsaḥ adhanviṣuḥ pavamānāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: The purifying Somas have flowed, the drops that purify,

original: śrīṇānā apsu mṛñjata //
analyzed: śrīṇānāḥ apsu mṛñjata

original: abhi gāvo adhanviṣur āpo na pravatā yatīḥ /
analyzed: abhi gāvaḥ adhanviṣuḥ āpaḥ na pravatā yatīḥ
translated: The cows have flowed to him, the waters flowing in their channels,

original: punānā indram āśata //
analyzed: punānāḥ indram āśata
translated: Being purified, they have come to Indra.

original: pra pavamāna dhanvasi somendrāya pātave /
analyzed: pra pavamāna dhanvasi soma indrāya pātave
translated: O Pavamana, thou flowest along thy course, O Soma, for Indra to drink,

original: nṛbhir yato vi nīyase //
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ yataḥ vi nīyase

original: tvaṃ soma nṛmādanaḥ pavasva carṣaṇīsahe /
analyzed: tvam soma nṛ mādanaḥ pavasva carṣaṇī sahe
translated: O Soma, gladdening men, flow for the sake of the warrior.

analyzed: sasniḥ yaḥ anumādyaḥ  indo yat adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavitram paridhāvasi

original: aram indrasya dhāmne //
analyzed: aram indrasya dhāmne

analyzed: pavasva vṛtra hantama ukthebhiḥ anumādyaḥ  śuciḥ pāvakaḥ adbhutaḥ
translated: Flow as the best Vritra-slayer, to be praised with hymns,🔽Pure, purifying, wondrous.

original: śuciḥ pāvaka ucyate somaḥ sutasya madhvaḥ /
analyzed: śuciḥ pāvakaḥ ucyate somaḥ sutasya madhvaḥ
translated: The pure, purifying Soma is called the sweet juice of the pressed (drink),

original: devāvīr aghaśaṃsahā //
analyzed: devāvīḥ agha śaṃsa hā
translated: The destroyer of evil, dear to the gods.

original: pavasva dakṣasādhano devebhyaḥ pītaye hare /
analyzed: pavasva dakṣa sādhanaḥ devebhyaḥ pītaye hare
translated: Flow, O golden one, making yourself ready for strength, for the gods to drink,

original: marudbhyo vāyave madaḥ //
analyzed: marudbhyaḥ vāyave madaḥ
translated: A joy to the Maruts and Vayu.

original: pavamāna dhiyā hito 'bhi yoniṃ kanikradat /
analyzed: pavamāna dhiyā hitaḥ bhi yonim kanikradat
translated: O Pavamana, directed by the thought, roaring in the birthplace,

analyzed: dharmaṇā vāyum ā viśa  sam devaiḥ śobhate vṛṣā kaviḥ yonau adhi priyaḥ

original: vṛtrahā devavītamaḥ //
analyzed: vṛtra hā deva vītamaḥ
translated: The slayer of Vrtra, best at the feast of the gods.

original: viśvā rūpāṇy āviśan punāno yāti haryataḥ /
analyzed: viśvā rūpāṇi āviśan punānaḥ yāti haryataḥ

original: yatrāmṛtāsa āsate //
analyzed: yatra amṛtāsaḥ āsate
translated: To where the immortals sit.

original: aruṣo janayan giraḥ somaḥ pavata āyuṣak /
analyzed: aruṣaḥ janayan giraḥ somaḥ pavate āyuṣak
translated: The red (bull) generating songs, Soma flows for life,

original: indraṃ gacchan kavikratuḥ //
analyzed: indram gacchan kavi kratuḥ
translated: Going to Indra, of wise power.

original: ā pavasva madintama pavitraṃ dhārayā kave /
analyzed: ā pavasva madintama pavitram dhārayā kave
translated: Flow, O sweetest one, along the filter, O wise one,

original: arkasya yonim āsadam //
analyzed: arkasya yonim āsadam
translated: To the womb of the Arka (plant).

original: tam amṛkṣanta vājinam upasthe aditer adhi /
analyzed: tam amṛkṣanta vājinam upasthe aditeḥ adhi
translated: They have rubbed the strong one on the lap of Aditi,

original: viprāso aṇvyā dhiyā //
analyzed: viprāsaḥ aṇvyā dhiyā
translated: The sages with a subtle thought.

original: taṃ gāvo abhy anūṣata sahasradhāram akṣitam /
analyzed: tam gāvaḥ abhī anūṣata sahasra dhāram akṣitam

analyzed: indum dhartāram ā divaḥ

original: taṃ vedhām medhayāhyan pavamānam adhi dyavi /
analyzed: tam vedhām medhayā ahyan pavamānam adhi dyavi
translated: They have urged on the measurer, Pavamâna, with thought, to the sky,

original: dharṇasim bhūridhāyasam //
analyzed: dharṇasim bhūri dhāyasam
translated: The supporter, the giver of abundant wealth.

original: tam ahyan bhurijor dhiyā saṃvasānaṃ vivasvataḥ /
analyzed: tam ahyan bhurijoḥ dhiyā saṃvasānam vivasvataḥ
translated: They have urged him, the guest of Vivasvan, with the thought of the two bowls,

original: patiṃ vāco adābhyam //
analyzed: patim vācaḥ adābhyam
translated: The lord of speech, the infallible.

analyzed: tam sānau adhi jāmayaḥ harim hinvanti adribhiḥ

analyzed: haryatam bhūri cakṣasam

original: taṃ tvā hinvanti vedhasaḥ pavamāna girāvṛdham /
analyzed: tam tvā hinvanti vedhasaḥ pavamāna girāvṛdham
translated: The sages urge thee on, O Pavamâna, to increase our song,

original: indav indrāya matsaram //
analyzed: indo indrāya matsaram
translated: O Indu, to Indra, to delight him.

original: eṣa kavir abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitre adhi tośate /
analyzed: eṣa kaviḥ abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitre adhi tośate
translated: This sage, when lauded, delights him on the purifying sieve,

analyzed: punānaḥ ghnan apa sridhaḥ  eṣaḥ indrāya vāyave svar jit pari sicyate
translated: Purifying, slaying the enemies.🔽This one, winning the light, is poured upon the purifying sieve,

original: pavitre dakṣasādhanaḥ //
analyzed: pavitre dakṣa sādhanaḥ

analyzed: eṣa nṛbhiḥ vi nīyate divaḥ mūrdhā vṛṣā sutaḥ

original: somo vaneṣu viśvavit //
analyzed: somaḥ vaneṣu viśva vid

analyzed: eṣa gavyuḥ acikradat pavamānaḥ hiraṇyayuḥ

analyzed: induḥ satrājit astṛtaḥ  eṣa sūryeṇa hāsate pavamānaḥ adhi dyavi

original: pavitre matsaro madaḥ //
analyzed: pavitre matsaraḥ madaḥ

analyzed: eṣa śuṣmī asiṣyadat antarikṣe vṛṣā hariḥ

analyzed: punānaḥ induḥ indram ā

analyzed: eṣa vājī hitaḥ nṛbhiḥ viśva vid manasaḥ patiḥ
translated: This horse, set in place by men, the lord of thoughts, the all-conquering one,

original: avyo vāraṃ vi dhāvati //
analyzed: avyaḥ vāram vi dhāvati

analyzed: eṣa pavitre akṣarat somaḥ devebhyaḥ sutaḥ
translated: This Soma, purified, has flowed into the purifying sieve for the gods,

analyzed: viśvā dhāmāni āviśan  eṣa devaḥ śubhāyate dhi yonau amartyaḥ

original: vṛtrahā devavītamaḥ //
analyzed: vṛtra hā deva vītamaḥ
translated: The slayer of Vrtra, most worshipped by the gods.

original: eṣa vṛṣā kanikradad daśabhir jāmibhir yataḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vṛṣā kanikradat daśabhiḥ jāmibhiḥ yataḥ
translated: This bull, bellowing, is urged on by his ten brothers,

original: abhi droṇāni dhāvati //
analyzed: abhi droṇāni dhāvati

analyzed: eṣa sūryam arocayat pavamānaḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: This Pavamana, most active, has made the sun shine,

original: viśvā dhāmāni viśvavit //
analyzed: viśvā dhāmāni viśva vid

original: eṣa śuṣmy adābhyaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati /
analyzed: eṣa śuṣmī adābhyaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ arṣati
translated: This invincible powerful Soma, being purified, flows,

analyzed: devāvīḥ agha śaṃsa hā
translated: Driving away evil, for the sake of the gods.

analyzed: pra asya dhārāḥ akṣaran vṛṣṇaḥ sutasya ojasā
translated: His streams have flowed forth with the strength of the pressed juice of the bull,

original: devāṃ anu prabhūṣataḥ //
analyzed: devān anu prabhūṣataḥ

original: saptim mṛjanti vedhaso gṛṇantaḥ kāravo girā /
analyzed: saptim mṛjanti vedhasaḥ gṛṇantaḥ kāravaḥ girā

analyzed: jyotiḥ jajñānam ukthyam

analyzed: suṣahā soma tāni te punānāya prabhūvaso
translated: O Soma, these are to be easily borne for you, being purified, O you of abundant wealth,

analyzed: vardha samudram ukthyam

original: viśvā vasūni saṃjayan pavasva soma dhārayā /
analyzed: viśvā vasūni saṃjayan pavasva soma dhārayā
translated: Winning all treasures, O Soma, flow on with thy stream,

original: inu dveṣāṃsi sadhryak //
analyzed: inu dveṣāṃsi sadhryak

analyzed: nidaḥ yatra mumucmahe  ā indo pārthivam rayim divyam pavasva dhārayā
translated: Where we may be freed from calamities.🔽O Indu, flow on with thy stream, heavenly treasure and earthly wealth.

original: dyumantaṃ śuṣmam ā bhara //
analyzed: dyumantam śuṣmam ā bhara
translated: Bring us brilliant strength.

original: pra dhārā asya śuṣmiṇo vṛthā pavitre akṣaran /
analyzed: pra dhārāḥ asya śuṣmiṇaḥ vṛthā pavitre akṣaran
translated: The streams of this mighty one have flowed in the sieve,

original: punāno vācam iṣyati //
analyzed: punānaḥ vācam iṣyati
translated: Purified, he speeds the voice.

original: indur hiyānaḥ sotṛbhir mṛjyamānaḥ kanikradat /
analyzed: induḥ hiyānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ mṛjyamānaḥ kanikradat

analyzed: iyarti vagnum indriyam  ā naḥ śuṣmam nṛṣāhyam vīravantam puruspṛham
translated: Impels the voice, the power.

original: pavasva soma dhārayā //
analyzed: pavasva soma dhārayā
translated: O Soma, flow on with thy stream to us strength to be victorious over men, rich in heroes, much desired.

original: pra somo ati dhārayā pavamāno asiṣyadat /
analyzed: pra somaḥ ati dhārayā pavamānaḥ asiṣyadat
translated: Soma, the purifier, has flowed forth with his stream,

original: abhi droṇāny āsadam //
analyzed: abhi droṇāni āsadam
translated: He has gone to the wooden tubs.

original: apsu tvā madhumattamaṃ hariṃ hinvanty adribhiḥ /
analyzed: apsu tvā madhumattamam harim hinvanti adribhiḥ
translated: They urge thee on with the stones, the tawny one, sweetest with honey, in the waters,

original: indav indrāya pītaye //
analyzed: indo indrāya pītaye
translated: O Indu, for Indra to drink.

original: sunotā madhumattamaṃ somam indrāya vajriṇe /
analyzed: sunota madhumattamam somam indrāya vajriṇe
translated: Press out the sweetest Soma for Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: cāruṃ śardhāya matsaram //
analyzed: cārum śardhāya matsaram
translated: A gladdening drink for the eager one.

original: pra somāsaḥ svādhyaḥ pavamānāso akramuḥ /
analyzed: pra somāsaḥ svādhyaḥ pavamānāsaḥ akramuḥ
translated: The purifying Somas, of good impulse, have flowed forth,

original: rayiṃ kṛṇvanti cetanam //
analyzed: rayim kṛṇvanti cetanam

original: divas pṛthivyā adhi bhavendo dyumnavardhanaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ adhi bhava indo dyumna vardhanaḥ
translated: Be thou, O Indu, on the earth and in the heavens, a strengthener of glory.

original: bhavā vājānām patiḥ //🔽tubhyaṃ vātā abhipriyas tubhyam arṣanti sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: bhavā vājānām patiḥ  tubhyam vātāḥ abhipriyaḥ tubhyam arṣanti sindhavaḥ

original: soma vardhanti te mahaḥ //
analyzed: soma vardhanti te mahaḥ
translated: They increase thy greatness.

original: ā pyāyasva sam etu te viśvataḥ soma vṛṣṇyam /
analyzed: ā pyāyasva sam etu te viśvatas soma vṛṣṇyam
translated: Be thou enlarged, let all thy power come unto thee, O Soma.

original: bhavā vājasya saṃgathe //
analyzed: bhava vājasya saṃgathe
translated: Be thou the gatherer of strength.

original: tubhyaṃ gāvo ghṛtam payo babhro duduhre akṣitam /
analyzed: tubhyam gāvaḥ ghṛtam payaḥ babhro duduhre akṣitam
translated: To thee, O tawny one, the cows have yielded milk and ghee, inexhaustible,

original: varṣiṣṭhe adhi sānavi //
analyzed: varṣiṣṭhe adhi sānavi
translated: On the highest place of all.

original: svāyudhasya te sato bhuvanasya pate vayam /
analyzed: su āyudhasya te sataḥ bhuvanasya pate vayam
translated: Of thee, O thou whose weapons are good, of thee, O lord of the world,

original: indo sakhitvam uśmasi //
analyzed: indo sakhi tvam uśmasi
translated: We desire, O Indu, the friendship.

original: pra somāso madacyutaḥ śravase no maghonaḥ /
analyzed: pra somāsaḥ mada cyutaḥ śravase naḥ maghonaḥ
translated: The gladdening Somas, O ye bounteous ones, for our glory,

original: sutā vidathe akramuḥ //
analyzed: sutāḥ vidathe akramuḥ
translated: The pressed (juices) have moved in the assembly.

original: ād īṃ tritasya yoṣaṇo hariṃ hinvanty adribhiḥ /
analyzed: āt īm tritasya yoṣaṇaḥ harim hinvanti adribhiḥ
translated: The two maidens of Trita urge the tawny one with stones,

original: indum indrāya pītaye //
analyzed: indum indrāya pītaye
translated: The Indu for Indra to drink.

original: ād īṃ haṃso yathā gaṇaṃ viśvasyāvīvaśan matim /
analyzed: āt īm haṃsaḥ yathā gaṇam viśvasya avīvaśat matim

original: atyo na gobhir ajyate //
analyzed: atyaḥ na gobhiḥ ajyate

original: ubhe somāvacākaśan mṛgo na takto arṣasi /
analyzed: ubhe soma avacākaśan mṛgaḥ na taktaḥ arṣasi
translated: The two Somas have looked around: thou flowest, the buck set free,

analyzed: sīdan ṛtasya yonim ā  abhi gāvaḥ anūṣata yoṣāḥ jāram iva priyam

original: agann ājiṃ yathā hitam //
analyzed: agan ājim yathā hitam
translated: Thou hast gone to the race as it were set out.

original: asme dhehi dyumad yaśo maghavadbhyaś ca mahyaṃ ca /
analyzed: asme dhehi dyumat yaśaḥ maghavadbhyaḥ ca mahyam ca

analyzed: punānaḥ yāti haryataḥ somaḥ gīrbhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ

analyzed: viprasya medhyātitheḥ

original: pavamāna vidā rayim asmabhyaṃ soma suśriyam /
analyzed: pavamāna vida rayim asmabhyam soma su śriyam

analyzed: indo sahasra varcasam

original: indur atyo na vājasṛt kanikranti pavitra ā /

analyzed: yat akṣār ati devayuḥ

analyzed: soma rāsva su vīryam

analyzed: pra naḥ indo mahe tane ūrmim na bibhrat arṣasi

analyzed: abhi devān ayāsyaḥ

analyzed: matī juṣṭaḥ dhiyā hitaḥ somaḥ hinve parāvati

analyzed: viprasya dhārayā kaviḥ

analyzed: ayam deveṣu jāgṛviḥ sutaḥ eti pavitre ā

analyzed: somaḥ yāti vicarṣaṇiḥ

analyzed: somaḥ deveṣu ā yamat

analyzed: sa pavasva madāya kam nṛ cakṣāḥ deva vītaye

analyzed: indo indrāya pītaye

analyzed: vi naḥ rāye duraḥ vṛdhi

analyzed: induḥ deveṣu patyate

analyzed: indo stotre su vīryam

original: gobhiḥ śrīṇīta matsaram //
analyzed: gobhiḥ śrīṇīta matsaram

analyzed: sa pavasva dhanañjaya prayantā rādhasaḥ mahaḥ

analyzed: asmabhyam soma gātu vid

analyzed: etam mṛjanti marjyam pavamānam daśa kṣipaḥ

analyzed: indrāya matsaram madam

analyzed: mandānaḥ ud vṛṣāyate

analyzed: bhareṣu jigyuṣām asi

analyzed: asmabhyam vṛṣṭim ā pava

analyzed: indo indrāya pītaye

analyzed: sunota madhumattamam

analyzed: nudasva yāḥ parispṛdhaḥ

original: indum indrāya matsaram //
analyzed: indum indrāya matsaram

original: asya pratnām anu dyutaṃ śukraṃ duduhre ahrayaḥ /
analyzed: asya pratnām anu dyutam śukram duduhre ahrayaḥ

analyzed: payaḥ sahasra sām ṛṣim

analyzed: ayam sūryaḥ iva upadṛś ayam sarāṃsi dhāvati

analyzed: somaḥ devaḥ na sūryaḥ

analyzed: soma viśvā ca saubhagā

original: indo yathā tava stavo yathā te jātam andhasaḥ /
analyzed: indo yathā tava stavaḥ yathā te jātam andhasaḥ

analyzed: ni barhiṣi priye sadaḥ

original: uta no govid aśvavit pavasva somāndhasā /
analyzed: uta naḥ go vid aśva vid pavasva soma andhasā
translated: O Soma, knowing cattle and horses, flow with your juice

original: makṣūtamebhir ahabhiḥ //
analyzed: makṣūtamebhiḥ ahabhiḥ

analyzed: girā jātaḥ iha stutaḥ induḥ indrāya dhīyate

analyzed: pavasva viśvamejaya

analyzed: madhumān astu vāyave

analyzed: somāḥ ṛtasya dhārayā

analyzed: indram gacchantaḥ indavaḥ

analyzed: indum indrāya matsaram

analyzed: indrāya madhumattamam

analyzed: asme vasūni dhāraya soma divyāni pārthivā

analyzed: indo viśvāni vāryā

analyzed: śumbhamānāḥ ṛtāyubhiḥ mṛjyamānāḥ gabhastyoḥ

original: pavante vāre avyaye //

analyzed: pavantām āntarikṣyā

analyzed: ūrmiḥ yaḥ te pavitre ā devāvīḥ paryakṣarat

analyzed: sa naḥ arṣa pavitre ā madaḥ yaḥ deva vītamaḥ

analyzed: iṣe pavasva dhārayā mṛjyamānaḥ manīṣibhiḥ

analyzed: indoḥ rucā abhi gāḥ ihi

analyzed: vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya vṛṇīmahe yujyāya
translated: We choose thee for friendship, we choose thee for union.

original: agna āyūṃṣi pavasa ā suvorjam iṣaṃ ca naḥ /
analyzed: agne āyūṃṣi pavase ā suva ūrjam iṣam ca naḥ
translated: O Agni, thou purifiest life, bestow on us strength and food,

original: āre bādhasva ducchunām //
analyzed: āre bādhasva ducchunām
translated: Drive away evil with thy flame.

original: agnir ṛṣiḥ pavamānaḥ pāñcajanyaḥ purohitaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ ṛṣiḥ pavamānaḥ pāñcajanyaḥ purohitaḥ
translated: Agni, the sage, the purifier, the fivefold priest,

original: tam īmahe mahāgayam //
analyzed: tam īmahe mahā gayam
translated: Him we implore, the great bestower of wealth.

original: agne pavasva svapā asme varcaḥ suvīryam /
analyzed: agne pavasva su apāḥ asme varcaḥ su vīryam
translated: O Agni, purify thyself, O naturally pure one, bestow upon us splendour and good strength,

original: dadhad rayim mayi poṣam //
analyzed: dadhat rayim mayi poṣam
translated: Granting riches and nourishment to me.

original: pavamāno ati sridho 'bhy arṣati suṣṭutim /
analyzed: pavamānaḥ ati sridhaḥ bhī arṣati suṣṭutim
translated: Purified, Pavamâna passeth through the barriers to the eulogy,

original: sūro na viśvadarśataḥ //
analyzed: sūraḥ na viśva darśataḥ
translated: Like the sun, all-beholding.

original: sa marmṛjāna āyubhiḥ prayasvān prayase hitaḥ /
analyzed: sa marmṛjānaḥ āyubhiḥ prayasvān prayase hitaḥ
translated: He, being anointed with the juices, rich, set in the place of sacrifice,

original: indur atyo vicakṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: induḥ atyaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The swift Indu, the discerning one.

original: pavamāna ṛtam bṛhac chukraṃ jyotir ajījanat /
analyzed: pavamānaḥ ṛtam bṛhat śukram jyotiḥ ajījanat
translated: Pavamâna hath generated the great holy order, the bright light,

original: kṛṣṇā tamāṃsi jaṅghanat //
analyzed: kṛṣṇā tamāṃsi jaṅghanat
translated: May Krishna crush the darkness.

original: pavamānasya jaṅghnato hareś candrā asṛkṣata /
analyzed: pavamānasya jaṅghnataḥ hareḥ candrāḥ asṛkṣata
translated: The bright drops have flowed forth from Pavamana, the brown one, as he crushes,

original: jīrā ajiraśociṣaḥ //
analyzed: jīrāḥ ajira śociṣaḥ
translated: The swift ones, with swift radiance.

original: pavamāno rathītamaḥ śubhrebhiḥ śubhraśastamaḥ /
analyzed: pavamānaḥ rathītamaḥ śubhrebhiḥ śubhraśastamaḥ
translated: Pavamana, best of charioteers, most praised with the bright ones,

original: hariścandro marudgaṇaḥ //
analyzed: hari ścandraḥ marut gaṇaḥ
translated: The brown-horsed Marut host.

original: pavamāno vy aśnavad raśmibhir vājasātamaḥ /
analyzed: pavamānaḥ vi aśnavat raśmibhiḥ vāja sātamaḥ
translated: Pavamana, most victorious, has spread himself with his rays,

original: dadhat stotre suvīryam //🔽pra suvāna indur akṣāḥ pavitram aty avyayam /
analyzed: dadhat stotre su vīryam  pra suvānaḥ induḥ akṣār pavitram ati avyayam
translated: Bestowing heroic strength in the praise.🔽The flowing Soma, the drops, have passed through the filter, through the fleece,

original: punāna indur indram ā //
analyzed: punānaḥ induḥ indram ā
translated: Purifying Soma, calling Indra.

original: eṣa somo adhi tvaci gavāṃ krīḷaty adribhiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa somaḥ adhi tvaci gavām krīḍati adribhiḥ
translated: This Soma, on the skin of cows, plays with the stones,

original: indram madāya johuvat //
analyzed: indram madāya johuvat
translated: Inviting Indra to the rapture.

original: yasya te dyumnavat payaḥ pavamānābhṛtaṃ divaḥ /
analyzed: yasya te dyumnavat payaḥ pavamāna ābhṛtam divaḥ
translated: Whose milk, O Pavamana, is yours, full of glory, brought from the sky,

original: tena no mṛḷa jīvase //
analyzed: tena naḥ mṛḍa jīvase
translated: Thereby be gracious to us for life.

original: tvaṃ somāsi dhārayur mandra ojiṣṭho adhvare /
analyzed: tvam soma asi dhārayuḥ mandraḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ adhvare
translated: You, O Soma, are the bearer, the most delightful, strongest at the sacrifice,

original: pavasva maṃhayadrayiḥ //
analyzed: pavasva maṃhayat rayiḥ
translated: Flow on, with wealth to be extolled.

original: tvaṃ suto nṛmādano dadhanvān matsarintamaḥ /
analyzed: tvam sutaḥ nṛ mādanaḥ dadhanvān matsarintamaḥ
translated: You, when pressed, are the gladdener of men, the most exhilarating,

original: indrāya sūrir andhasā //
analyzed: indrāya sūriḥ andhasā
translated: The chief, with the juice, for Indra.

original: tvaṃ suṣvāṇo adribhir abhy arṣa kanikradat /🔽dyumantaṃ śuṣmam uttamam //
analyzed: tvam suṣvāṇaḥ adribhiḥ abhī arṣa kanikradat  dyumantam śuṣmam uttamam
translated: You, being well pressed, with the stones, flow on, roaring,🔽The most glorious, the most powerful.

original: indur hinvāno arṣati tiro vārāṇy avyayā /
analyzed: induḥ hinvānaḥ arṣati tiras vārāṇi avyayā
translated: Soma, being urged, flows on, through the fleecy filter, through the woolen (filter),

original: harir vājam acikradat //
analyzed: hariḥ vājam acikradat
translated: Hari has sent forth the sacrificial food.

original: indo vy avyam arṣasi vi śravāṃsi vi saubhagā /
analyzed: indo vi avyam arṣasi vi śravāṃsi vi saubhagā
translated: O Indu, thou sendest forth the Vyañjas, the glories, the good things,

original: vi vājān soma gomataḥ //🔽ā na indo śatagvinaṃ rayiṃ gomantam aśvinam /
analyzed: vi vājān soma gomataḥ  ā naḥ indo śatagvinam rayim gomantam aśvinam
translated: And the treasures, O Soma.🔽O Indu, bring to us Soma, a hundredfold, a thousandfold,

original: bharā soma sahasriṇam //🔽pavamānāsa indavas tiraḥ pavitram āśavaḥ /
analyzed: bhara soma sahasriṇam  pavamānāsaḥ indavaḥ tiras pavitram āśavaḥ
translated: Wealth in cattle and horses.🔽The purifying drops, O Indu, swift,

original: indraṃ yāmebhir āśata //
analyzed: indram yāmebhiḥ āśata
translated: Have reached Indra with their currents.🔽The delightful Soma juice, the drop, ancient,

original: kakuhaḥ somyo rasa indur indrāya pūrvyaḥ /🔽āyuḥ pavata āyave //
analyzed: kakuhaḥ somyaḥ rasaḥ induḥ indrāya pūrvyaḥ  āyuḥ pavate āyave
translated: Is purified for Indra.

original: hinvanti sūram usrayaḥ pavamānam madhuścutam /
analyzed: hinvanti sūram usrayaḥ pavamānam madhuścutam
translated: The two Dawns impel the Sun, the purifying one, the honey-dripper,

original: abhi girā sam asvaran //🔽avitā no ajāśvaḥ pūṣā yāmaniyāmani /
analyzed: abhi girā sam asvaran  avitā naḥ aja aśvaḥ pūṣā yāmani yāmani
translated: With their voices they have sung together.🔽May Pūṣan, the protector, the swift one, the lord of the path,

original: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ //
analyzed: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ
translated: May he enjoy our oblations.

original: ayaṃ somaḥ kapardine ghṛtaṃ na pavate madhu /
analyzed: ayam somaḥ kapardine ghṛtam na pavate madhu
translated: This Soma, O you with matted locks, flows like ghee and honey.

original: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ //
analyzed: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ
translated: May he enjoy our oblations.

original: ayaṃ ta āghṛṇe suto ghṛtaṃ na pavate śuci /
analyzed: ayam te āghṛṇe sutaḥ ghṛtam na pavate śuci
translated: This, O you who love the hymn, is pressed for you; it flows like ghee, pure.

original: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ //
analyzed: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ
translated: May he enjoy our oblations.

original: vāco jantuḥ kavīnām pavasva soma dhārayā /
analyzed: vācaḥ jantuḥ kavīnām pavasva soma dhārayā
translated: Flow on, O Soma, with thy stream, the germ of the songs of sages,

original: deveṣu ratnadhā asi //🔽ā kalaśeṣu dhāvati śyeno varma vi gāhate /
analyzed: deveṣu ratna dhāḥ asi  ā kalaśeṣu dhāvati śyenaḥ varma vi gāhate
translated: Thou art the bestower of treasure among the gods.🔽He rushes into the jars; the falcon dives into his covering;

original: abhi droṇā kanikradat //
analyzed: abhi droṇā kanikradat
translated: He roars over the trough.

original: pari pra soma te raso 'sarji kalaśe sutaḥ /
analyzed: pari pra soma te rasaḥ sarji kalaśe sutaḥ
translated: The juice of Soma, O Soma, has been pressed out in the wooden trough.

original: śyeno na takto arṣati //
analyzed: śyenaḥ na taktaḥ arṣati
translated: It flows like a hawk let loose.

original: pavasva soma mandayann indrāya madhumattamaḥ //
analyzed: pavasva soma mandayan indrāya madhumattamaḥ
translated: Flow on, O Soma, gladdening, most rich in meath, for Indra.

original: asṛgran devavītaye vājayanto rathā iva //🔽te sutāso madintamāḥ śukrā vāyum asṛkṣata //
analyzed: asṛgran deva vītaye vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva  te sutāsaḥ madintamāḥ śukrāḥ vāyum asṛkṣata
translated: They have been shed for the banquet of the Gods, like horses that win the prize.🔽Those pressed out, most gladdening, bright, have flowed to Vâyu.

original: grāvṇā tunno abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitraṃ soma gacchasi /
analyzed: grāvṇā tunnaḥ abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitram soma gacchasi
translated: Pressed out with the stone, extolled, O Soma, thou goest to the filter,

original: dadhat stotre suvīryam //
analyzed: dadhat stotre su vīryam
translated: Bearing great strength in the laud.

original: eṣa tunno abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitram ati gāhate /
analyzed: eṣa tunnaḥ abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitram ati gāhate
translated: Pressed out, extolled, he goeth over the filter,

original: rakṣohā vāram avyayam //
analyzed: rakṣaḥ hā vāram avyayam
translated: The Raksas-slayer, the fleece that never wears away.

original: yad anti yac ca dūrake bhayaṃ vindati mām iha /
analyzed: yat anti yat ca dūrake bhayam vindati mām iha
translated: Whatever fear is near to me, whatever is afar from me,

original: pavamāna vi taj jahi //🔽pavamānaḥ so adya naḥ pavitreṇa vicarṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: pavamāna vi tat jahi  pavamānaḥ saḥ adya naḥ pavitreṇa vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: O Pavamâna, drive that far away.🔽This Pavamâna, with his purifying power, most active, this day,

original: yaḥ potā sa punātu naḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ potā sa punātu naḥ
translated: He who is our protector, purify us.

original: yat te pavitram arciṣy agne vitatam antar ā /
analyzed: yat te pavitram arciṣi agne vitatam antar ā
translated: That purifying light of thine, O Agni, which is spread within,

original: brahma tena punīhi naḥ //
analyzed: brahma tena punīhi naḥ
translated: With that purify thou us.

original: yat te pavitram arcivad agne tena punīhi naḥ /
analyzed: yat te pavitram arcivat agne tena punīhi naḥ
translated: With that purifying light of thine, O Agni, purify thou us.

original: brahmasavaiḥ punīhi naḥ //
analyzed: brahma savaiḥ punīhi naḥ
translated: Purify us with the Savanas of prayer.

original: ubhābhyāṃ deva savitaḥ pavitreṇa savena ca /
analyzed: ubhābhyām deva savitar pavitreṇa savena ca
translated: With both thy purifiers, O God Savitar, and with thy power,

original: mām punīhi viśvataḥ //
analyzed: mām punīhi viśvatas
translated: Purify thou me on every side.

original: tribhiṣ ṭvaṃ deva savitar varṣiṣṭhaiḥ soma dhāmabhiḥ /
analyzed: tribhiḥ tvam deva savitar varṣiṣṭhaiḥ soma dhāmabhiḥ
translated: With the three highest powers, O god Savitar, O Soma,

original: agne dakṣaiḥ punīhi naḥ //🔽punantu māṃ devajanāḥ punantu vasavo dhiyā /
analyzed: agne dakṣaiḥ punīhi naḥ  punantu mām deva janāḥ punantu vasavaḥ dhiyā
translated: purify us, O Agni, with your powers.🔽May the divine people purify me, may the Vasus purify me with thought,

original: viśve devāḥ punīta mā jātavedaḥ punīhi mā //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ punīta mā jātavedaḥ punīhi mā
translated: may all the gods purify me, O all-knower, purify me.

original: pra pyāyasva pra syandasva soma viśvebhir aṃśubhiḥ /
analyzed: pra pyāyasva pra syandasva soma viśvebhiḥ aṃśubhiḥ
translated: Flow forth, flow onward, O Soma, with all thy rays,

original: devebhya uttamaṃ haviḥ //🔽upa priyam panipnataṃ yuvānam āhutīvṛdham /
analyzed: devebhyaḥ uttamam haviḥ  upa priyam panipnatam yuvānam āhutīvṛdham
translated: the best oblation for the gods.

original: aganma bibhrato namaḥ //
analyzed: aganma bibhrataḥ namaḥ
translated: We have come, bearing homage, to the dear, the youthful one, who grows by oblations.

original: alāyyasya paraśur nanāśa tam ā pavasva deva soma /
analyzed: alāyyasya paraśuḥ nanāśa tam ā pavasva deva soma
translated: The axe of the son of Alāyu was lost; bring it to us, O god Soma.

original: ākhuṃ cid eva deva soma //🔽yaḥ pāvamānīr adhyety ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtaṃ rasam /
analyzed: ākhum cit eva deva soma  yaḥ pāvamānīḥ adhyeti ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtam rasam
translated: Even the mouse, O god Soma.🔽He who studies the purifying hymns, the essence collected by the seers,

original: sarvaṃ sa pūtam aśnāti svaditam mātariśvanā //
analyzed: sarvam sa pūtam aśnāti svaditam mātariśvanā
translated: he eats everything purified, made sweet by Matariśvan.

original: pāvamānīr yo adhyety ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtaṃ rasam /
analyzed: pāvamānīḥ yaḥ adhyeti ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtam rasam
translated: He who studies the purifying hymns, the essence collected by the seers,

original: tasmai sarasvatī duhe kṣīraṃ sarpir madhūdakam //
analyzed: tasmai sarasvatī duhe kṣīram sarpiḥ madhūdakam
translated: for him Sarasvatī milks milk, ghee, honey and water.

original: pra devam acchā madhumanta indavo 'siṣyadanta gāva ā na dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: pra devam acchā madhumantaḥ indavaḥ siṣyadanta gāvaḥ ā na dhenavaḥ
translated: The sweet juices have flowed forth to the god, the cows have lowed like milch cows to Indra.

original: barhiṣado vacanāvanta ūdhabhiḥ parisrutam usriyā nirṇijaṃ dhire //
analyzed: barhiṣadaḥ vacanāvantaḥ ūdhabhiḥ parisrutam usriyāḥ nirṇijam dhire
translated: The grass-sitters, obedient to the voice, with their udders have supported the milk-sprinkled garment of the cow.

original: sa roruvad abhi pūrvā acikradad upāruhaḥ śrathayan svādate hariḥ /
analyzed: sa roruvat abhi pūrvāḥ acikradat upāruhaḥ śrathayan svādate hariḥ
translated: He, roaring, has bellowed to the east, breaking the enclosures, the tawny one licks, stretching.

original: tiraḥ pavitram pariyann uru jrayo ni śaryāṇi dadhate deva ā varam //
analyzed: tiras pavitram pariyan uru jrayaḥ ni śaryāṇi dadhate devaḥ ā varam
translated: Passing through the filter, with wide might, he places in the god's best portion the sharp-pointed (waters).

original: vi yo mame yamyā saṃyatī madaḥ sākaṃvṛdhā payasā pinvad akṣitā /
analyzed: vi yaḥ mame yamyā saṃyatī madaḥ sākaṃvṛdhā payasā pinvat akṣitā
translated: The intoxicating drink which he, the companion of the twins, increases with inexhaustible milk, together with the increaser,

original: mahī apāre rajasī vivevidad abhivrajann akṣitam pāja ā dade //
analyzed: mahī apāre rajasī vivevidat abhivrajan akṣitam pājaḥ ā dade
translated: Has spread out the two vast, boundless regions. Going forward, he has taken the unwasting light.

original: sa mātarā vicaran vājayann apaḥ pra medhiraḥ svadhayā pinvate padam /
analyzed: sa mātarā vicaran vājayan apaḥ pra medhiraḥ svadhayā pinvate padam
translated: He, the wise one, waxing strong, moving between the two mothers, fills his place with his own power.

original: aṃśur yavena pipiśe yato nṛbhiḥ saṃ jāmibhir nasate rakṣate śiraḥ //
analyzed: aṃśuḥ yavena pipiśe yataḥ nṛbhiḥ sam jāmibhiḥ nasate rakṣate śiraḥ
translated: The ray is mixed with barley, from which (it comes) with men. He is born together with his kinsmen. He guards the head.

original: saṃ dakṣeṇa manasā jāyate kavir ṛtasya garbho nihito yamā paraḥ /
analyzed: sam dakṣeṇa manasā jāyate kaviḥ ṛtasya garbhaḥ nihitaḥ yamā paras
translated: The wise one is born together with the dexterous mind. The embryo of truth is placed by Yama on high.

original: yūnā ha santā prathamaṃ vi jajñatur guhā hitaṃ janima nemam udyatam //
analyzed: yūnā ha santā prathamam vi jajñatuḥ guhā hitam janima nemam udyatam
translated: They were first born together, the two young ones. They have disclosed the hidden birth, the uplifted one.

original: mandrasya rūpaṃ vividur manīṣiṇaḥ śyeno yad andho abharat parāvataḥ /
analyzed: mandrasya rūpam vividuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ śyenaḥ yat andhaḥ abharat parāvataḥ
translated: The wise ones have discovered the form of the joyful one, when the falcon brought it from a distance.

original: tam marjayanta suvṛdhaṃ nadīṣv āṃ uśantam aṃśum pariyantam ṛgmiyam //
analyzed: tam marjayanta suvṛdham nadīṣu ām uśantam aṃśum pariyantam ṛgmiyam
translated: They adorn him, the prosperous one, in the waters, the eager, impetuous one, worthy of praise, who goes around.

original: tvām mṛjanti daśa yoṣaṇaḥ sutaṃ soma ṛṣibhir matibhir dhītibhir hitam /
analyzed: tvām mṛjanti daśa yoṣaṇaḥ sutam soma ṛṣibhiḥ matibhiḥ dhītibhiḥ hitam
translated: The ten maidens cleanse thee, O Soma, when thou art pressed, with the thoughts of the Rishis, with the hymns of praise.

original: avyo vārebhir uta devahūtibhir nṛbhir yato vājam ā darṣi sātaye //
analyzed: avyaḥ vārebhiḥ uta deva hūtibhiḥ nṛbhiḥ yataḥ vājam ā darṣi sātaye
translated: With the pure vessels and the invocations of the gods, from the men, whence thou hast shown strength to be gained.

original: pariprayantaṃ vayyaṃ suṣaṃsadaṃ somam manīṣā abhy anūṣata stubhaḥ /
analyzed: pariprayantam vayyam suṣaṃsadam somam manīṣāḥ abhī anūṣata stubhaḥ
translated: The lauds have sung to the Soma who goes around, the young one, who is easy to invoke, who is pressed.

original: yo dhārayā madhumāṃ ūrmiṇā diva iyarti vācaṃ rayiṣāḷ amartyaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ dhārayā madhumān ūrmiṇā divaḥ iyarti vācam rayiṣāh amartyaḥ
translated: He who with his stream, with his honey, from the sky, sends forth speech, immortal, for the sake of wealth.

original: ayaṃ diva iyarti viśvam ā rajaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati /
analyzed: ayam divaḥ iyarti viśvam ā rajaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati
translated: He goes around this all-embracing realm of the sky, Soma, being purified, sits in the jars.

original: adbhir gobhir mṛjyate adribhiḥ sutaḥ punāna indur varivo vidat priyam //
analyzed: adbhiḥ gobhiḥ mṛjyate adribhiḥ sutaḥ punānaḥ induḥ varivaḥ vidat priyam
translated: He is cleansed with the waters, with the cows, being pressed with the stones, being purified, Indu finds the dear wide space.

original: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāno vayo dadhac citratamam pavasva /
analyzed: eva naḥ soma pariṣicyamānaḥ vayaḥ dadhat citratamam pavasva
translated: O Soma, thus, being sprinkled around, bestow upon us the most wonderful life, flow on!

original: adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayim asme suvīram //
analyzed: a dveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devāḥ dhatta rayim asme su vīram
translated: Let us invoke heaven and earth in a friendly spirit. O gods, bestow wealth upon us, with good heroes.

original: iṣur na dhanvan prati dhīyate matir vatso na mātur upa sarjy ūdhani /
analyzed: iṣuḥ na dhanvan prati dhīyate matiḥ vatsaḥ na mātuḥ upa sarji ūdhani
translated: The thought is placed like an arrow on the bow, the calf is let loose on the udder of its mother.

original: urudhāreva duhe agra āyaty asya vrateṣv api soma iṣyate //
analyzed: uru dhārā iva duhe agre āyatī asya vrateṣu api somaḥ iṣyate
translated: Like a cow with a full udder, he milks the foremost, in his ordinances Soma is impelled.

original: upo matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antar āsani /
analyzed: upa u matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antar āsani
translated: The hymn is churned, honey is poured, the gladdening one urges from within the cloud.

original: pavamānaḥ saṃtaniḥ praghnatām iva madhumān drapsaḥ pari vāram arṣati //🔽avye vadhūyuḥ pavate pari tvaci śrathnīte naptīr aditer ṛtaṃ yate /
analyzed: pavamānaḥ saṃtaniḥ praghnatām iva madhumān drapsaḥ pari vāram arṣati  avye vadhūyuḥ pavate pari tvaci śrathnīte naptīḥ aditeḥ ṛtam yate
translated: Pavamana is the cord of the strikers, the honey-rich drop flows around the enclosing sticks.🔽The bridegroom of the raw cow moves around in the skin, the grandson of Aditi, striving for truth.

original: harir akrān yajataḥ saṃyato mado nṛmṇā śiśāno mahiṣo na śobhate //
analyzed: hariḥ akrān yajataḥ saṃyataḥ madaḥ nṛmṇā śiśānaḥ mahiṣaḥ na śobhate
translated: The tawny one, the measured joy of the worshipper, the strong one, like a bull, shines forth, sharpening his manliness.

original: ukṣā mimāti prati yanti dhenavo devasya devīr upa yanti niṣkṛtam /🔽aty akramīd arjunaṃ vāram avyayam atkaṃ na niktam pari somo avyata //
analyzed: ukṣā mimāti prati yanti dhenavaḥ devasya devīḥ upa yanti niṣkṛtam  ati akramīt arjunam vāram avyayam atkam na niktam pari somaḥ avyata
translated: The bull moves, the cows go forth, the divine ones of the god go to the completion.🔽He has passed over the green, unblemished cow-pen, Soma has girded himself like a well-anointed one.

original: amṛktena ruśatā vāsasā harir amartyo nirṇijānaḥ pari vyata /🔽divas pṛṣṭham barhaṇā nirṇije kṛtopastaraṇaṃ camvor nabhasmayam //
analyzed: amṛktena ruśatā vāsasā hariḥ amartyaḥ nirṇijānaḥ pari vyata  divaḥ pṛṣṭham barhaṇā nirṇije kṛta upastaraṇam camvoḥ nabhasmayam
translated: The tawny one, immortal, with a garment that is unblemished and white, has girded himself for the cleansing.🔽On the back of the sky, in the lofty cleansing, the cloud-like one is spread out as a covering in the bowls.

original: sūryasyeva raśmayo drāvayitnavo matsarāsaḥ prasupaḥ sākam īrate /
analyzed: sūryasya iva raśmayaḥ drāvayitnavaḥ matsarāsaḥ prasupaḥ sākam īrate
translated: Like the rays of the sun, the impetuous ones, the envious ones, the sleepy ones, go forth together.

original: tantuṃ tatam pari sargāsa āśavo nendrād ṛte pavate dhāma kiṃ cana //
analyzed: tantum tatam pari sargāsaḥ āśavaḥ na indrāt ṛte pavate dhāma kim cana
translated: The swift ones have spread out the thread spun by the creator. Nothing flows forth apart from Indra.

original: sindhor iva pravaṇe nimna āśavo vṛṣacyutā madāso gātum āśata /
analyzed: sindhoḥ iva pravaṇe nimne āśavaḥ vṛṣa cyutāḥ madāsaḥ gātum āśata
translated: Like swift currents in a ravine of a river, the intoxicating juices released by the bull have come to move.

original: śaṃ no niveśe dvipade catuṣpade 'sme vājāḥ soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ niveśe dvipade catuṣpade sme vājāḥ soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Be auspicious to our dwelling, to our two-legged and four-legged creatures. Let the food-bestowing Soma-pressings remain with us.

original: ā naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavad aśvāvad gomad yavamat suvīryam /
analyzed: ā naḥ pavasva vasumat hiraṇyavat aśvāvat gomat yavamat su vīryam
translated: Flow to us with wealth, with gold, with horses, with cattle, with barley, with good heroism.

original: yūyaṃ hi soma pitaro mama sthana divo mūrdhānaḥ prasthitā vayaskṛtaḥ //
analyzed: yūyam hi soma pitaraḥ mama sthana divaḥ mūrdhānaḥ prasthitāḥ vayaskṛtaḥ
translated: For you, O Soma, are my fathers, the heads of heaven, established, makers of life.

original: ete somāḥ pavamānāsa indraṃ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sātim accha /
analyzed: ete somāḥ pavamānāsaḥ indram rathāḥ iva pra yayuḥ sātim accha
translated: These Soma juices, being purified, have gone to Indra, like chariots, to the contest.

original: sutāḥ pavitram ati yanty avyaṃ hitvī vavriṃ harito vṛṣṭim accha //
analyzed: sutāḥ pavitram ati yanti avyam hitvī vavrim haritaḥ vṛṣṭim accha
translated: The pressed juices pass through the filter to the pure, leaving the skin, the green ones to the rain.

original: indav indrāya bṛhate pavasva sumṛḷīko anavadyo riśādāḥ /
analyzed: indo indrāya bṛhate pavasva su mṛḍīkaḥ anavadyaḥ riśādāḥ
translated: O Indra, flow for great Indra, well-disposed, irreproachable, a destroyer of enemies.

original: bharā candrāṇi gṛṇate vasūni devair dyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṃ naḥ //
analyzed: bhara candrāṇi gṛṇate vasūni devaiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī prāvatam naḥ
translated: And bring the bright treasures to the singer. O heaven and earth, with the gods, protect us.

original: trir asmai sapta dhenavo duduhre satyām āśiram pūrvye vyomani /
analyzed: tris asmai sapta dhenavaḥ duduhre satyām āśiram pūrvye vyomani
translated: Three times seven milch cows have yielded him the true blessing in the ancient expanse of the sky.

original: catvāry anyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yad ṛtair avardhata //
analyzed: catvāri anyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yat ṛtaiḥ avardhata
translated: He has cleansed the four other worlds, and made them beautiful, when he has grown by means of the holy rites.

original: sa bhikṣamāṇo amṛtasya cāruṇa ubhe dyāvā kāvyenā vi śaśrathe /
analyzed: sa bhikṣamāṇaḥ amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ ubhe dyāvā kāvyena vi śaśrathe
translated: He, seeking the lovely nectar, with his wisdom has divided the two heavens.

original: tejiṣṭhā apo maṃhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sado viduḥ //
analyzed: tejiṣṭhāḥ apaḥ maṃhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sadaḥ viduḥ
translated: He has encompassed with his might the most radiant waters, when they have found the abode of the god by his glory.

original: te asya santu ketavo 'mṛtyavo 'dābhyāso januṣī ubhe anu /
analyzed: te asya santu ketavaḥ mṛtyavaḥ dābhyāsaḥ januṣī ubhe anu
translated: Let these be his signs, immortal, infallible, following both generations.

original: yebhir nṛmṇā ca devyā ca punata ād id rājānam mananā agṛbhṇata //
analyzed: yebhiḥ nṛmṇā ca devyā ca punate āt id rājānam mananāḥ agṛbhṇata
translated: By which (signs) they purify themselves for hero-power and the goddess (Vāk), then indeed they have grasped the king in their thoughts.

original: sa mṛjyamāno daśabhiḥ sukarmabhiḥ pra madhyamāsu mātṛṣu prame sacā /🔽vratāni pāno amṛtasya cāruṇa ubhe nṛcakṣā anu paśyate viśau //
analyzed: sa mṛjyamānaḥ daśabhiḥ su karmabhiḥ pra madhyamāsu mātṛṣu prame sacā  vratāni pānaḥ amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ ubhe nṛ cakṣāḥ anu paśyate viśau
translated: He, being cleansed by the ten good deeds, is measured with the middle mothers.🔽The observances, the drink of the lovely nectar, the two peoples, the seer of men, he looks on.

original: sa marmṛjāna indriyāya dhāyasa obhe antā rodasī harṣate hitaḥ /🔽vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa bādhate vi durmatīr ādediśānaḥ śaryaheva śurudhaḥ //
analyzed: sa marmṛjānaḥ indriyāya dhāyase ā ubhe antar rodasī harṣate hitaḥ  vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa bādhate vi durmatīḥ ādediśānaḥ śaryahā iva śurudhaḥ
translated: He, being anointed, for strength, for support, delights in both ends of the heaven and earth, being placed.🔽The bull with his might overcomes the evil thoughts, the one who has directed the gifts, as if with a dart.

original: sa mātarā na dadṛśāna usriyo nānadad eti marutām iva svanaḥ /
analyzed: sa mātarā na dadṛśānaḥ usriyaḥ nānadat eti marutām iva svanaḥ
translated: He, the strong one, is seen like a bull, his voice goes forth roaring, like that of the Maruts.

original: jānann ṛtam prathamaṃ yat svarṇaram praśastaye kam avṛṇīta sukratuḥ //
analyzed: jānan ṛtam prathamam yat svarṇaram praśastaye kam avṛṇīta su kratuḥ
translated: Knowing the first truth, the golden one, the wise one has chosen for praise.

original: ruvati bhīmo vṛṣabhas taviṣyayā śṛṅge śiśāno hariṇī vicakṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ruvati bhīmaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ taviṣyayā śṛṅge śiśānaḥ hariṇī vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The terrible bull roars with might, sharpening his tawny horns, the all-seeing one.

original: ā yoniṃ somaḥ sukṛtaṃ ni ṣīdati gavyayī tvag bhavati nirṇig avyayī //
analyzed: ā yonim somaḥ su kṛtam ni sīdati gavyayī tvac bhavati nirṇij avyayī
translated: Soma sits down in the well-made womb, he becomes the skin of the cow, the back of the sheep.

original: śuciḥ punānas tanvam arepasam avye harir ny adhāviṣṭa sānavi /
analyzed: śuciḥ punānaḥ tanvam arepasam avye hariḥ ni adhāviṣṭa sānavi
translated: Pure, purifying his body, free from blemish, the tawny one has flowed into the back of the sheep.

original: juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave tridhātu madhu kriyate sukarmabhiḥ //
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave tri dhātu madhu kriyate su karmabhiḥ
translated: Approved for Mitra, Varuna, and Vayu, the three-formed honey is made by the skillful ones.

original: pavasva soma devavītaye vṛṣendrasya hārdi somadhānam ā viśa /
analyzed: pavasva soma deva vītaye vṛṣā indrasya hārdi soma dhānam ā viśa
translated: Flow on, O Soma, for the feast of the gods, as a bull enter the heart of Indra, the Soma-holder.

original: purā no bādhād duritāti pāraya kṣetravid dhi diśa āhā vipṛcchate //🔽hito na saptir abhi vājam arṣendrasyendo jaṭharam ā pavasva /
analyzed: purā naḥ bādhāt duritā ati pāraya kṣetra vid hi diśaḥ āha ā vipṛcchate  hitaḥ na saptiḥ abhi vājam arṣa indrasya indo jaṭharam ā pavasva
translated: Carry us over all evil before it overtakes us, for thou knowest the fields and tellest the inquirer the directions.🔽Flow on, urged on, as a swift horse to the prize, O Indu, to the belly of Indra.

original: nāvā na sindhum ati parṣi vidvāñ chūro na yudhyann ava no nida spaḥ //
analyzed: nāvā na sindhum ati parṣi vidvān śūraḥ na yudhyan ava naḥ nidaḥ spaḥ
translated: Like a hero in battle, O thou who knowest, carry us over the flood in a boat.

original: ā dakṣiṇā sṛjyate śuṣmy āsadaṃ veti druho rakṣasaḥ pāti jāgṛviḥ /
analyzed: ā dakṣiṇā sṛjyate śuṣmī āsadam veti druhaḥ rakṣasaḥ pāti jāgṛviḥ
translated: The strong one is let loose to the seat of honor, the watchful one goes to protect the wicked and the Raksases.

original: harir opaśaṃ kṛṇute nabhas paya upastire camvor brahma nirṇije //
analyzed: hariḥ opaśam kṛṇute nabhaḥ payaḥ upastire camvoḥ brahma nirṇije
translated: Hari makes the sky's milk peaceful, in the strew, in the bowls, in the cleansing of the Brahman.

original: pra kṛṣṭiheva śūṣa eti roruvad asuryaṃ varṇaṃ ni riṇīte asya tam /🔽jahāti vavrim pitur eti niṣkṛtam upaprutaṃ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ tanā //
analyzed: pra kṛṣṭi hā iva śūṣaḥ eti roruvat asuryam varṇam ni riṇīte asya tam  jahāti vavrim pituḥ eti niṣkṛtam upaprutam kṛṇute nirṇijam tanā
translated: He goes forth roaring like a plowman, he extends his Asura color.🔽He leaves the covering, he goes to the completion of the father, he makes the cleansing cloth ready with his body.

original: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavate gabhastyor vṛṣāyate nabhasā vepate matī /🔽sa modate nasate sādhate girā nenikte apsu yajate parīmaṇi //🔽pari dyukṣaṃ sahasaḥ parvatāvṛdham madhvaḥ siñcanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim /
analyzed: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavate gabhastyoḥ vṛṣāyate nabhasā vepate matī  sa modate nasate sādhate girā nenikte apsu yajate parīmaṇi  pari dyukṣam sahasaḥ parvatāvṛdham madhvaḥ siñcanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim
translated: Pressed out with stones, he flows forth from the arms, he becomes a bull with the sky, he trembles with thought.🔽He delights, he moves, he perfects with the song, he is anointed in the waters, he sacrifices in the enclosing sticks.🔽They pour the sky-roaming one, the strengthener of the mountains, the shaker of the house, the honey of the sacrifice.

original: ā yasmin gāvaḥ suhutāda ūdhani mūrdhañ chrīṇanty agriyaṃ varīmabhiḥ //
analyzed: ā yasmin gāvaḥ su hutāde ūdhani mūrdham śrīṇanti agriyam varīmabhiḥ
translated: In whom the cows, in the well-offered one, on the udder, spread out the highest place with abundant offerings.

original: sam ī rathaṃ na bhurijor aheṣata daśa svasāro aditer upastha ā /🔽jigād upa jrayati gor apīcyam padaṃ yad asya matuthā ajījanan //
analyzed: sam ī ratham na bhurijoḥ aheṣata daśa svasāraḥ aditeḥ upasthe ā  jigāt upa jrayati goḥ apīcyam padam yat asya matuthāḥ ajījanan
translated: He has started like a chariot on the two poles, the ten sisters of Aditi in the lap.🔽He has gone up to the cow's hidden place, the foot which the wondrous ones have generated for him.

original: śyeno na yoniṃ sadanaṃ dhiyā kṛtaṃ hiraṇyayam āsadaṃ deva eṣati /
analyzed: śyenaḥ na yonim sadanam dhiyā kṛtam hiraṇyayam āsadam devaḥ eṣati
translated: The bird goes to the golden seat, the womb, the resting place made by thought, the god.

original: e riṇanti barhiṣi priyaṃ girāśvo na devāṃ apy eti yajñiyaḥ //🔽parā vyakto aruṣo divaḥ kavir vṛṣā tripṛṣṭho anaviṣṭa gā abhi /
analyzed: ā riṇanti barhiṣi priyam girā aśvaḥ na devān api eti yajñiyaḥ  parā vyaktaḥ aruṣaḥ divaḥ kaviḥ vṛṣā tri pṛṣṭhaḥ anaviṣṭa gāḥ abhi
translated: They carry him on the sacred grass, dear with the song, the God-adoring steed goes forth.🔽The ruddy one, the sage of heaven, goes forth, the bull with three backs, to the cows.

original: sahasraṇītir yatiḥ parāyatī rebho na pūrvīr uṣaso vi rājati //
analyzed: sahasraṇītiḥ yatiḥ parāyatī rebhaḥ na pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ vi rājati
translated: The one who goes a thousand ways, the priest, going away, the singer shines forth over many dawns.

original: tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇute varṇo asya sa yatrāśayat samṛtā sedhati sridhaḥ /
analyzed: tveṣam rūpam kṛṇute varṇaḥ asya sa yatra aśayat samṛtā sedhati sridhaḥ
translated: He assumes a flashing form, his hue, where he lies down, he drives away the enemies of the well-ordered (sacrifice).

original: apsā yāti svadhayā daivyaṃ janaṃ saṃ suṣṭutī nasate saṃ goagrayā //
analyzed: ap sāḥ yāti svadhayā daivyam janam sam suṣṭutī nasate sam go agrayā
translated: He goes to the waters, by his own nature, to the divine people, he goes to the praises, to the foremost of the cows.

original: ukṣeva yūthā pariyann arāvīd adhi tviṣīr adhita sūryasya /🔽divyaḥ suparṇo 'va cakṣata kṣāṃ somaḥ pari kratunā paśyate jāḥ //
analyzed: ukṣā iva yūthā pariyan arāvīt adhi tviṣīḥ adhita sūryasya  divyaḥ suparṇaḥ va cakṣata kṣām somaḥ pari kratunā paśyate jāḥ
translated: Like a bull going around the herds he has roared, on the flames, on the light of the sun.🔽The divine bird has looked down on the earth. Soma, by his wisdom, looks on the people.

original: harim mṛjanty aruṣo na yujyate saṃ dhenubhiḥ kalaśe somo ajyate /
analyzed: harim mṛjanti aruṣaḥ na yujyate sam dhenubhiḥ kalaśe somaḥ ajyate
translated: They cleanse the tawny one, he is yoked like a red (bull), Soma is anointed in the trough with the milk of the cows.

original: ud vācam īrayati hinvate matī puruṣṭutasya kati cit paripriyaḥ //
analyzed: ud vācam īrayati hinvate matī puruṣṭutasya kati cit paripriyaḥ
translated: He sends forth the voice, he impels the thoughts, some dear ones of the much-praised one.

original: sākaṃ vadanti bahavo manīṣiṇa indrasya somaṃ jaṭhare yad āduhuḥ /
analyzed: sākam vadanti bahavaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ indrasya somam jaṭhare yat āduhuḥ
translated: Many wise ones speak together, when they pour Soma into Indra's belly.

original: yadī mṛjanti sugabhastayo naraḥ sanīḷābhir daśabhiḥ kāmyam madhu //
analyzed: yadī mṛjanti su gabhastayaḥ naraḥ sanīḍābhiḥ daśabhiḥ kāmyam madhu
translated: When the men with ten fingers cleanse the lovely mead, the desirable, with the fingers of the hands.

original: aramamāṇo aty eti gā abhi sūryasya priyaṃ duhitus tiro ravam /
analyzed: a ramamāṇaḥ ati eti gāḥ abhi sūryasya priyam duhituḥ tiras ravam
translated: Not resting, he goes over to the cows, to the dear light of the sun, to the daughter's covering.

original: anv asmai joṣam abharad vinaṅgṛsaḥ saṃ dvayībhiḥ svasṛbhiḥ kṣeti jāmibhiḥ //
analyzed: anu asmai joṣam abharat vinaṅgṛsaḥ sam dvayībhiḥ svasṛbhiḥ kṣeti jāmibhiḥ
translated: He has brought him to his own will, the one with the moving feet; he rests with the two-fold sisters, the uterine.

original: nṛdhūto adriṣuto barhiṣi priyaḥ patir gavām pradiva indur ṛtviyaḥ /🔽purandhivān manuṣo yajñasādhanaḥ śucir dhiyā pavate soma indra te //🔽nṛbāhubhyāṃ codito dhārayā suto 'nuṣvadham pavate soma indra te /
analyzed: nṛ dhūtaḥ adri sutaḥ barhiṣi priyaḥ patiḥ gavām pradivaḥ induḥ ṛtviyaḥ  purandhivān manuṣaḥ yajña sādhanaḥ śuciḥ dhiyā pavate somaḥ indra te  nṛ bāhubhyām coditaḥ dhārayā sutaḥ nuṣvadham pavate somaḥ indra te
translated: Urged by men, pressed out by stone, dear on the sacred grass, the lord of the cows, the moon, the proper one, by day.🔽Possessing the women, the man who accomplishes the sacrifice, Soma is purified by thought, pure, for you, O Indra.🔽Urged by the arms of men, poured out in the stream, Soma flows to the goal for you, O Indra.

original: āprāḥ kratūn sam ajair adhvare matīr ver na druṣac camvor āsadad dhariḥ //🔽aṃśuṃ duhanti stanayantam akṣitaṃ kaviṃ kavayo 'paso manīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: āprāḥ kratūn sam ajaiḥ adhvare matīḥ veḥ na druṣat camvoḥ āsadat hariḥ  aṃśum duhanti stanayantam akṣitam kavim kavayaḥ pasaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: He has attained the rites, has won the thoughts in the sacrifice; the tawny one has sat down in the bowls, as in a house.🔽The wise, the thoughtful ones milk the shoot, the thundering one, the imperishable one, the sage.

original: sam ī gāvo matayo yanti saṃyata ṛtasya yonā sadane punarbhuvaḥ //
analyzed: sam ī gāvaḥ matayaḥ yanti saṃyataḥ ṛtasya yonā sadane punarbhuvaḥ
translated: The thoughts of the cows go together, the thoughts of the men go together, to the place of the sacrifice, to the seat of the re-arising.

original: nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divo 'pām ūrmau sindhuṣv antar ukṣitaḥ /
analyzed: nābhā pṛthivyāḥ dharuṇaḥ mahaḥ divaḥ pām ūrmau sindhuṣu antar ukṣitaḥ
translated: The navel of the earth, the support of the great sky, in the wave of the waters, in the rivers, sprinkled within.

original: indrasya vajro vṛṣabho vibhūvasuḥ somo hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ //
analyzed: indrasya vajraḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vibhūvasuḥ somaḥ hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ
translated: The bull, the treasure-giver, Indra's thunderbolt, Soma flows on, a gladdening juice, to the heart.

original: sa tū pavasva pari pārthivaṃ raja stotre śikṣann ādhūnvate ca sukrato /
analyzed: sa tu pavasva pari pārthivam rajaḥ stotre śikṣan ādhūnvate ca su krato
translated: Flow on, purifying, to the earthly realm, instructing in the praise and in the pressing, O wise one.

original: mā no nir bhāg vasunaḥ sādanaspṛśo rayim piśaṅgam bahulaṃ vasīmahi //
analyzed: mā naḥ niḥ bhāk vasunaḥ sādana spṛśaḥ rayim piśaṅgam bahulam vasīmahi
translated: Do not exclude us from a share of wealth, O thou who art touched by the seat. May we obtain yellow, abundant wealth.

original: ā tū na indo śatadātv aśvyaṃ sahasradātu paśumad dhiraṇyavat /
analyzed: ā tu naḥ indo śata dātu aśvyam sahasra dātu paśumat hiraṇyavat
translated: Come to us, O Indu, giving a hundred horses, a thousand, rich in cattle, in gold.

original: upa māsva bṛhatī revatīr iṣo 'dhi stotrasya pavamāna no gahi //
analyzed: upa māsva bṛhatīḥ revatīḥ iṣaḥ dhi stotrasya pavamāna naḥ gahi
translated: Enjoy the great, the rich food. Come to us, O Pavamana, to the praise.

original: srakve drapsasya dhamataḥ sam asvarann ṛtasya yonā sam aranta nābhayaḥ /
analyzed: srakve drapsasya dhamataḥ sam asvaran ṛtasya yonā sam aranta nābhayaḥ
translated: The drops of the melted one have resounded in the sieve, the centres have come together in the womb of truth.

original: trīn sa mūrdhno asuraś cakra ārabhe satyasya nāvaḥ sukṛtam apīparan //
analyzed: trīn sa mūrdhnaḥ asuraḥ cakre ārabhe satyasya nāvaḥ sukṛtam apīparan
translated: The Asura has taken hold of three heads. The boats of truth have brought the well-made one across.

original: samyak samyañco mahiṣā aheṣata sindhor ūrmāv adhi venā avīvipan /
analyzed: samyak samyañcaḥ mahiṣāḥ aheṣata sindhoḥ ūrmau adhi venāḥ avīvipan
translated: The bulls have moved straight forward, straight, they have been urged on the wave of the river, on the impulse.

original: madhor dhārābhir janayanto arkam it priyām indrasya tanvam avīvṛdhan //
analyzed: madhoḥ dhārābhiḥ janayantaḥ arkam id priyām indrasya tanvam avīvṛdhan
translated: Generating the hymn with the streams of honey, they have increased the dear body of Indra.

original: pavitravantaḥ pari vācam āsate pitaiṣām pratno abhi rakṣati vratam /
analyzed: pavitravantaḥ pari vācam āsate pitā eṣām pratnaḥ abhi rakṣati vratam
translated: They sit around the speech, having the filter. This ancient one of theirs guards the vow.

original: mahaḥ samudraṃ varuṇas tiro dadhe dhīrā ic chekur dharuṇeṣv ārabham //
analyzed: mahaḥ samudram varuṇaḥ tiras dadhe dhīrāḥ id śekuḥ dharuṇeṣu ārabham
translated: Varuṇa has placed the great ocean in the distance, the wise have been able to grasp it in the supports.

original: sahasradhāre 'va te sam asvaran divo nāke madhujihvā asaścataḥ /
analyzed: sahasra dhāre va te sam asvaran divaḥ nāke madhu jihvāḥ asaścataḥ
translated: In the thousand-streamed one, your voices have resounded, honey-tongued, imperishable, in the vault of the sky.

original: asya spaśo na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ padepade pāśinaḥ santi setavaḥ //
analyzed: asya spaśaḥ na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ pade pade pāśinaḥ santi setavaḥ
translated: The swift ones do not close their eyes to his glance; in every step there are snares, there are bridges.

original: pitur mātur adhy ā ye samasvarann ṛcā śocantaḥ saṃdahanto avratān /
analyzed: pituḥ mātuḥ adhi ā ye samasvaran ṛcā śocantaḥ saṃdahantaḥ avratān
translated: Those who have resounded together above the father and the mother, lamenting with the Rc verses, burning the faithless.

original: indradviṣṭām apa dhamanti māyayā tvacam asiknīm bhūmano divas pari //
analyzed: indra dviṣṭām apa dhamanti māyayā tvacam asiknīm bhūmanaḥ divaḥ pari
translated: They blow away by magic the skin of the one who hates Indra, the black skin, from the surface of the earth and the sky.

original: pratnān mānād adhy ā ye samasvarañ chlokayantrāso rabhasasya mantavaḥ /
analyzed: pratnāt mānāt adhi ā ye samasvaram śloka yantrāsaḥ rabhasasya mantavaḥ
translated: Those who have resounded together above the ancient measure, the instruments of praise, the thoughts of the impetuous one.

original: apānakṣāso badhirā ahāsata ṛtasya panthāṃ na taranti duṣkṛtaḥ //
analyzed: apāna kṣāsaḥ badhirāḥ ahāsata ṛtasya panthām na taranti duṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The out-breathers, the deaf, have laughed; the evildoers do not cross the path of truth.

original: sahasradhāre vitate pavitra ā vācam punanti kavayo manīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: sahasra dhāre vitate pavitre ā vācam punanti kavayaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: In the thousand-streamed, spread-out purifier, the wise, the thoughtful ones purify the speech.

original: rudrāsa eṣām iṣirāso adruha spaśaḥ svañcaḥ sudṛśo nṛcakṣasaḥ //
analyzed: rudrāsaḥ eṣām iṣirāsaḥ adruhaḥ spaśaḥ svañcaḥ sudṛśaḥ nṛ cakṣasaḥ
translated: The Rudras of these are impetuous, not deceitful, the swift ones, the self-moving ones, the well-seeing ones, the ones who see men.

original: ṛtasya gopā na dabhāya sukratus trī ṣa pavitrā hṛdy antar ā dadhe /
analyzed: ṛtasya gopāḥ na dabhāya su kratuḥ trī sa pavitrā hṛdi antar ā dadhe
translated: The guardian of truth, of good resolve, has placed within his heart three purifiers.

original: vidvān sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paśyaty avājuṣṭān vidhyati karte avratān //
analyzed: vidvān sa viśvā bhuvanā abhi paśyati ava a juṣṭān vidhyati karte avratān
translated: The wise one sees all the worlds. He pierces those who are not to be served and those who are not devoted to vows.

original: ṛtasya tantur vitataḥ pavitra ā jihvāyā agre varuṇasya māyayā /🔽dhīrāś cit tat saminakṣanta āśatātrā kartam ava padāty aprabhuḥ //🔽śiśur na jāto 'va cakradad vane svar yad vājy aruṣaḥ siṣāsati /
analyzed: ṛtasya tantuḥ vitataḥ pavitraḥ ā jihvāyāḥ agre varuṇasya māyayā  dhīrāḥ cit tat saminakṣantaḥ āśata atrā kartam ava padātī aprabhuḥ  śiśuḥ na jātaḥ vaḥ cakradat vane svar yat vājī aruṣaḥ siṣāsati
translated: The thread of truth is spread out as a strainer, at the tip of the tongue, by the magic of Varuna.🔽Even the wise ones do not understand that. The powerless one steps on the path of the powerful one.🔽The child, not yet born, has roared in the forest, when the red steed thirsts for heaven.

original: divo retasā sacate payovṛdhā tam īmahe sumatī śarma saprathaḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ retasā sacate payaḥ vṛdhā tam īmahe sumatī śarma saprathaḥ
translated: We pray to him, the one with good thoughts, for wide protection, who accompanies the rain-increasing semen of heaven.

original: divo ya skambho dharuṇaḥ svātata āpūrṇo aṃśuḥ paryeti viśvataḥ /🔽seme mahī rodasī yakṣad āvṛtā samīcīne dādhāra sam iṣaḥ kaviḥ //🔽mahi psaraḥ sukṛtaṃ somyam madhūrvī gavyūtir aditer ṛtaṃ yate /
analyzed: divaḥ yaḥ skambhaḥ dharuṇaḥ su ātataḥ āpūrṇaḥ aṃśuḥ paryeti viśvatas  sa ime mahī rodasī yakṣat āvṛtā samīcīne dādhāra sam iṣaḥ kaviḥ  mahi psaraḥ su kṛtam somyam madhu urvī gavyūtiḥ aditeḥ ṛtam yate
