translated: The prop of heaven, the support, stretched out, the full ray moves around from all sides.🔽The great two worlds, to be worshipped, he supports, the wise one, the food of the two moving together.🔽The great, well-made, Soma-like honey, the cow-path, the truth of Aditi, to which one is devoted.

original: īśe yo vṛṣṭer ita usriyo vṛṣāpāṃ netā ya itaūtir ṛgmiyaḥ //
analyzed: īśe yaḥ vṛṣṭeḥ itas usriyaḥ vṛṣā apām netā yaḥ itaūtiḥ ṛgmiyaḥ
translated: He who is the lord of rain, the one to be served, the bull, the leader of waters, the one to be praised, the one who comes.

original: ātmanvan nabho duhyate ghṛtam paya ṛtasya nābhir amṛtaṃ vi jāyate /
analyzed: ātmanvat nabhaḥ duhyate ghṛtam payaḥ ṛtasya nābhiḥ amṛtam vi jāyate
translated: The self-existent sky is milked for ghee and milk. The navel of truth, the immortal, is born.

original: samīcīnāḥ sudānavaḥ prīṇanti taṃ naro hitam ava mehanti peravaḥ //
analyzed: samīcīnāḥ sudānavaḥ prīṇanti tam naraḥ hitam ava mehanti peravaḥ
translated: The men, the bountiful, in unison delight him, the good one; the wide-spreading ones sprinkle him.

original: arāvīd aṃśuḥ sacamāna ūrmiṇā devāvyam manuṣe pinvati tvacam /
analyzed: arāvīt aṃśuḥ sacamānaḥ ūrmiṇā devāvyam manuṣe pinvati tvacam
translated: The ray has roared, flowing with the wave; it swells the skin for the man for the god.

original: dadhāti garbham aditer upastha ā yena tokaṃ ca tanayaṃ ca dhāmahe //
analyzed: dadhāti garbham aditeḥ upasthe ā yena tokam ca tanayam ca dhāmahe
translated: It places the embryo in Aditi's lap, by which we may support offspring and progeny.

original: sahasradhāre 'va tā asaścatas tṛtīye santu rajasi prajāvatīḥ /
analyzed: sahasra dhāre vai tāḥ asaścataḥ tṛtīye santu rajasi prajāvatīḥ
translated: They have flowed down through the thousand-streamed (heaven), may they be rich in offspring in the third region.

original: catasro nābho nihitā avo divo havir bharanty amṛtaṃ ghṛtaścutaḥ //
analyzed: catasraḥ nābhaḥ nihitāḥ avas divaḥ haviḥ bharanti amṛtam ghṛtaścutaḥ
translated: Four are placed in the navel of the sky, bearing the immortal oblation, dripping with ghee.

original: śvetaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇute yat siṣāsati somo mīḍhvāṃ asuro veda bhūmanaḥ /
analyzed: śvetam rūpam kṛṇute yat siṣāsati somaḥ mīḍhvān asuraḥ veda bhūmanaḥ
translated: When he desires, he assumes a white form; Soma, the bountiful, the Asura, knows the earth.

original: dhiyā śamī sacate sem abhi pravad divas kavandham ava darṣad udriṇam //
analyzed: dhiyā śamī sacate sem abhi pravat divaḥ kabandham ava darṣat udriṇam
translated: He follows with thought the one who is to be praised; he has pierced through the hollow of the sky, the swollen one.

original: adha śvetaṃ kalaśaṃ gobhir aktaṃ kārṣmann ā vājy akramīt sasavān /
analyzed: adha śvetam kalaśam gobhiḥ aktam kārṣman ā vājī akramīt sasavān
translated: Now the white tub, anointed with milk, the strong one has stepped on the grass, rich in oblations.

original: ā hinvire manasā devayantaḥ kakṣīvate śatahimāya gonām //
analyzed: ā hinvire manasā devayantaḥ kakṣīvate śata himāya gonām
translated: The god-fearing ones urge him with their minds, for Kakshivan, for the one with a hundred winters, for the winner of cattle.

original: adbhiḥ soma papṛcānasya te raso 'vyo vāraṃ vi pavamāna dhāvati /
analyzed: adbhiḥ soma papṛcānasya te rasaḥ vyaḥ vāram vi pavamāna dhāvati
translated: O Soma, the juice of him who has been pressed by you, O Pavamana, flows through the woolen filter.

original: sa mṛjyamānaḥ kavibhir madintama svadasvendrāya pavamāna pītaye //
analyzed: sa mṛjyamānaḥ kavibhiḥ madintama svadasva indrāya pavamāna pītaye
translated: Being cleansed by the wise ones, O most delightful one, be sweet for Indra, O purifying one, to drink.

original: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohito nāmāni yahvo adhi yeṣu vardhate /
analyzed: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohitaḥ nāmāni yahvaḥ adhi yeṣu vardhate
translated: He flows towards the dear names, well-disposed, the youthful one, upon which his glory increases.

original: ā sūryasya bṛhato bṛhann adhi rathaṃ viṣvañcam aruhad vicakṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: ā sūryasya bṛhataḥ bṛhan adhi ratham viṣvañcam aruhat vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The all-seeing one has mounted the wide chariot of the great sun, upon the great one.

original: ṛtasya jihvā pavate madhu priyaṃ vaktā patir dhiyo asyā adābhyaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtasya jihvā pavate madhu priyam vaktā patiḥ dhiyaḥ asyāḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: The tongue of truth flows, the dear honey, the speaker, the lord of these thoughts, is unassailable.

original: dadhāti putraḥ pitror apīcyaṃ nāma tṛtīyam adhi rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: dadhāti putraḥ pitroḥ apīcyam nāma tṛtīyam adhi rocane divaḥ
translated: The son places the wondrous third name upon the light of the sky, of the father and mother.

original: ava dyutānaḥ kalaśāṃ acikradan nṛbhir yemānaḥ kośa ā hiraṇyaye /
analyzed: ava dyutānaḥ kalaśām acikradat nṛbhiḥ yemānaḥ kośe ā hiraṇyaye
translated: The one who shines has roared towards the jars, urged by men, in the golden vessel.

original: abhīm ṛtasya dohanā anūṣatādhi tripṛṣṭha uṣaso vi rājati //🔽adribhiḥ suto matibhiś canohitaḥ prarocayan rodasī mātarā śuciḥ /
analyzed: abhi īm ṛtasya dohanāḥ anūṣata adhi tri pṛṣṭhaḥ uṣasaḥ vi rājati  adribhiḥ sutaḥ matibhiḥ canohitaḥ prarocayan rodasī mātarā śuciḥ
translated: He has sung the milkings of truth. He shines above the three-backed dawns.🔽Pressed with stones and well-disposed with thoughts, illuminating the two mothers, the sky and earth, the pure one.

original: romāṇy avyā samayā vi dhāvati madhor dhārā pinvamānā divedive //
analyzed: romāṇi avyā samayā vi dhāvati madhoḥ dhārā pinvamānā dive dive
translated: He flows along the hairs in due order, the stream of honey, swelling day by day.

original: pari soma pra dhanvā svastaye nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vāsayāśiram /
analyzed: pari soma pra dhanva svastaye nṛbhiḥ punānaḥ abhi vāsaya āśiram
translated: O Soma, flow around for prosperity, being purified by the men, filling the trough with milk.

original: ye te madā āhanaso vihāyasas tebhir indraṃ codaya dātave magham //
analyzed: ye te madāḥ āhanasaḥ vihāyasaḥ tebhiḥ indram codaya dātave magham
translated: Those gladdening juices of thine, O thou who art to be invoked, with them urge Indra to bestow his bounty.

original: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso dakṣo devānām anumādyo nṛbhiḥ /🔽hariḥ sṛjāno atyo na satvabhir vṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣv ā //
analyzed: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyaḥ rasaḥ dakṣaḥ devānām anumādyaḥ nṛbhiḥ  hariḥ sṛjānaḥ atyaḥ na satvabhiḥ vṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣu ā
translated: The purifying juice, the supporter of the sky, the mighty, to be praised by men, the strength of the gods,🔽The tawny one, as he is let loose, with the strong ones, makes his rays useless in the rivers.

original: śūro na dhatta āyudhā gabhastyoḥ svaḥ siṣāsan rathiro gaviṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: śūraḥ na dhatte āyudhā gabhastyoḥ svar siṣāsan rathiraḥ gaviṣṭiṣu
translated: The hero places his weapons in his arms, longing for light, the charioteer in the contests for the spoil.

original: indrasya śuṣmam īrayann apasyubhir indur hinvāno ajyate manīṣibhiḥ //
analyzed: indrasya śuṣmam īrayan apasyubhiḥ induḥ hinvānaḥ ajyate manīṣibhiḥ
translated: Urging Indra's strength with the searching ones, the drop, being impelled, is purified by the wise.

original: indrasya soma pavamāna ūrmiṇā taviṣyamāṇo jaṭhareṣv ā viśa /
analyzed: indrasya soma pavamānaḥ ūrmiṇā taviṣyamāṇaḥ jaṭhareṣu ā viśa
translated: O Soma, the Pavamana, with Indra's wave, being magnified, enter his bellies.

original: pra ṇaḥ pinva vidyud abhreva rodasī dhiyā na vājāṃ upa māsi śaśvataḥ //
analyzed: pra naḥ pinva vidyut abhrā iva rodasī dhiyā na vājām upa māsi śaśvataḥ
translated: Cause our wealth to swell, as the lightning the clouds, in the two world-halves; by wisdom thou always approachest our treasures.

original: viśvasya rājā pavate svardṛśa ṛtasya dhītim ṛṣiṣāḷ avīvaśat /
analyzed: viśvasya rājā pavate svar dṛśaḥ ṛtasya dhītim ṛṣiṣāh avīvaśat
translated: He who looks on the light, the king of the universe, has sent forth the thought of holy order, the Rṣis' desire.

original: yaḥ sūryasyāsireṇa mṛjyate pitā matīnām asamaṣṭakāvyaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ sūryasya asireṇa mṛjyate pitā matīnām a samaṣṭa kāvyaḥ
translated: He who is purified by the sun's rays, the father of the hymns, whose wisdom is not to be surpassed.

original: vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośam arṣasy apām upasthe vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradat /
analyzed: vṛṣā iva yūthā pari kośam arṣasi apām upasthe vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradat
translated: Flow round the vat, O bull, as a bull bellowing in the lap of the waters, around the herd.

original: sa indrāya pavase matsarintamo yathā jeṣāma samithe tvotayaḥ //
analyzed: saḥ indrāya pavase matsarintamaḥ yathā jeṣāma samithe tvotayaḥ
translated: Thou flowest for Indra, most gladdening, that we may conquer, O thou who art to be invoked in the battle.

original: eṣa pra kośe madhumāṃ acikradad indrasya vajro vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraḥ /
analyzed: eṣa pra kośe madhumān acikradat indrasya vajraḥ vapuṣaḥ vapuṣṭaraḥ
translated: This one has roared in the vat, sweeter than the sweet, Indra's thunderbolt, more beautiful than the beautiful.

original: abhīm ṛtasya sudughā ghṛtaścuto vāśrā arṣanti payaseva dhenavaḥ //
analyzed: abhi īm ṛtasya su dughāḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ vāśrāḥ arṣanti payasā iva dhenavaḥ
translated: The milch-cows of holy order, dropping ghee, flow to him, as it were, with milk, in streams of sweetness.

original: sa pūrvyaḥ pavate yaṃ divas pari śyeno mathāyad iṣitas tiro rajaḥ /
analyzed: sa pūrvyaḥ pavate yam divaḥ pari śyenaḥ mathāyat iṣitaḥ tiras rajaḥ
translated: He, the ancient one, flows around from heaven, the falcon urged on, through the region, to his delight.

original: sa madhva ā yuvate vevijāna it kṛśānor astur manasāha bibhyuṣā //
analyzed: sa madhvaḥ ā yuvate vevijānaḥ id kṛśānoḥ astuḥ manasā aha bibhyuṣā
translated: He, the sweet one, is carried along, trembling, by the mind of the active one, fearing the angry one.

original: te naḥ pūrvāsa uparāsa indavo mahe vājāya dhanvantu gomate /
analyzed: te naḥ pūrvāsaḥ uparāsaḥ indavaḥ mahe vājāya dhanvantu gomate
translated: May those earlier and later drops of his, for great strength in cattle, flow to us.

original: īkṣeṇyāso ahyo na cāravo brahmabrahma ye jujuṣur havirhaviḥ //
analyzed: īkṣeṇyāsaḥ ahyaḥ na cāravaḥ brahma brahma ye jujuṣuḥ haviḥ haviḥ
translated: To be gazed upon, like swift horses, they, who have accepted each prayer and each oblation, (flow).

original: ayaṃ no vidvān vanavad vanuṣyata induḥ satrācā manasā puruṣṭutaḥ /🔽inasya yaḥ sadane garbham ādadhe gavām urubjam abhy arṣati vrajam //
analyzed: ayam naḥ vidvān vanavat vanuṣyate induḥ satrācā manasā puruṣṭutaḥ  inasya yaḥ sadane garbham ādadhe gavām urubjam abhī arṣati vrajam
translated: This one, knowing us, will choose, will choose for us, the friend, the ever-present one, praised by many.🔽He who has placed the embryo in the abode of the mare, flows to the wide-opened stall of the cows.

original: cakrir divaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso mahāṃ adabdho varuṇo hurug yate /
analyzed: cakriḥ divaḥ pavate kṛtvyaḥ rasaḥ mahān adabdhaḥ varuṇaḥ huruk yate
translated: The mighty, infallible Varuna, the irresistible juice, is flowing, made, for the heaven.

original: asāvi mitro vṛjaneṣu yajñiyo 'tyo na yūthe vṛṣayuḥ kanikradat //
analyzed: asāvi mitraḥ vṛjaneṣu yajñiyaḥ tyaḥ na yūthe vṛṣayuḥ kanikradat
translated: Mitra, the worshipper, has been pressed in the rites, like a bull bellowing in the herd, the strong one.

original: pra rājā vācaṃ janayann asiṣyadad apo vasāno abhi gā iyakṣati /
analyzed: pra rājā vācam janayan asiṣyadat apaḥ vasānaḥ abhi gāḥ iyakṣati
translated: The king, producing speech, is about to roar, clothed in the waters, he will attack the cows.

original: gṛbhṇāti ripram avir asya tānvā śuddho devānām upa yāti niṣkṛtam //
analyzed: gṛbhṇāti ripram aviḥ asya tānvā śuddhaḥ devānām upa yāti niṣkṛtam
translated: The sheep seizes his blemish, his own; purified, he approaches the blameless path of the gods.

original: indrāya soma pari ṣicyase nṛbhir nṛcakṣā ūrmiḥ kavir ajyase vane /
analyzed: indrāya soma pari sicyase nṛbhiḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ ūrmiḥ kaviḥ ajyase vane
translated: O Soma, thou art poured for Indra by the men; the wave, looking on men, is anointed in the wood, the wise one.

original: pūrvīr hi te srutayaḥ santi yātave sahasram aśvā harayaś camūṣadaḥ //
analyzed: pūrvīḥ hi te srutayaḥ santi yātave sahasram aśvāḥ harayaḥ camūṣadaḥ
translated: For many are thy streams that flow for thee to drink; a thousand steeds, tawny, seated in the bowls.

original: samudriyā apsaraso manīṣiṇam āsīnā antar abhi somam akṣaran /
analyzed: samudriyāḥ apsarasaḥ manīṣiṇam āsīnāḥ antar abhi somam akṣaran
translated: The ocean-going Apsarases, the wise ones, seated within, have sung to the Soma.

original: tā īṃ hinvanti harmyasya sakṣaṇiṃ yācante sumnam pavamānam akṣitam //
analyzed: tāḥ īm hinvanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim yācante sumnam pavamānam akṣitam
translated: They urge him, the shaker of the firm abode; they ask for the bliss, the unfailing Pavamana.

original: gojin naḥ somo rathajid dhiraṇyajit svarjid abjit pavate sahasrajit /
analyzed: go jit naḥ somaḥ ratha jit hiraṇya jit svar jit ap jit pavate sahasra jit
translated: Soma, winning cows for us, winning chariots, gold, heaven, water, he flows, winning a thousand.

original: yaṃ devāsaś cakrire pītaye madaṃ svādiṣṭhaṃ drapsam aruṇam mayobhuvam //
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ cakrire pītaye madam svādiṣṭham drapsam aruṇam mayobhuvam
translated: The gods have made him, the drop, most sweet to drink, the ruddy one, the giver of delight, to be drunk.

original: etāni soma pavamāno asmayuḥ satyāni kṛṇvan draviṇāny arṣasi /
analyzed: etāni soma pavamānaḥ asmayuḥ satyāni kṛṇvan draviṇāni arṣasi
translated: O Soma Pavamana, making these true things, thou art flowing to us, making riches.

original: jahi śatrum antike dūrake ca ya urvīṃ gavyūtim abhayaṃ ca nas kṛdhi //
analyzed: jahi śatrum antike dūrake ca yaḥ urvīm gavyūtim abhayam ca naḥ kṛdhi
translated: Destroy the foe that is near and that is far away, and make wide room for us and give us freedom from fear.

original: acodaso no dhanvantv indavaḥ pra suvānāso bṛhaddiveṣu harayaḥ /
analyzed: acodasaḥ naḥ dhanvantu indavaḥ pra suvānāsaḥ bṛhaddiveṣu harayaḥ
translated: Let the juices flow to us without obstruction, the tawny ones, well pressed, in the great sacrifices.

original: vi ca naśan na iṣo arātayo 'ryo naśanta saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ //🔽pra ṇo dhanvantv indavo madacyuto dhanā vā yebhir arvato junīmasi /
analyzed: vi ca naśan naḥ iṣaḥ arātayaḥ ryaḥ naśanta saniṣanta naḥ dhiyaḥ  pra naḥ dhanvantu indavaḥ mada cyutaḥ dhanā vā yebhiḥ arvataḥ junīmasi
translated: And may the evil spirits turn away from us, and may our wishes be fulfilled.🔽May the juices, O Indu, that are rich in rapture, with which we shall win the prize, come to us.

original: tiro martasya kasya cit parihvṛtiṃ vayaṃ dhanāni viśvadhā bharemahi //
analyzed: tiras martasya kasya cit parihvṛtim vayam dhanāni viśvadhā bharemahi
translated: May we in every way bear off the wealth, beyond the reach of any mortal's envy.

original: uta svasyā arātyā arir hi ṣa utānyasyā arātyā vṛko hi ṣaḥ /
analyzed: uta svasyāḥ arātyāḥ ariḥ hi sa uta anyasyāḥ arātyāḥ vṛkaḥ hi saḥ
translated: And he is the foe of our own misfortune, and he is the wolf of the misfortune of others.

original: dhanvan na tṛṣṇā sam arīta tāṃ abhi soma jahi pavamāna durādhyaḥ //🔽divi te nābhā paramo ya ādade pṛthivyās te ruruhuḥ sānavi kṣipaḥ /
analyzed: dhanvan na tṛṣṇā sam arīta tām abhi soma jahi pavamāna durādhyaḥ  divi te nābhā paramaḥ yaḥ ādade pṛthivyāḥ te ruruhuḥ sānavi kṣipaḥ
translated: O Soma, O Pavamâna, drive away that thirst which is like a desert in the desert. Drive away the evil spirits.🔽Thy highest navel is in the sky, thy shoots have grown on the earth's ridge.

original: adrayas tvā bapsati gor adhi tvacy apsu tvā hastair duduhur manīṣiṇaḥ //
analyzed: adrayaḥ tvā bapsati goḥ adhi tvaci apsu tvā hastaiḥ duduhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The stones embrace thee on the cow's hide. The wise have milked thee with their hands into the waters.

original: evā ta indo subhvaṃ supeśasaṃ rasaṃ tuñjanti prathamā abhiśriyaḥ /
analyzed: eva te indo su bhvam supeśasam rasam tuñjanti prathamāḥ abhiśriyaḥ
translated: Thus, O Indu, they urge thy juice, rich in food, of fair appearance, the first to be pressed.

original: nidaṃnidam pavamāna ni tāriṣa āvis te śuṣmo bhavatu priyo madaḥ //
analyzed: nidaṃnidam pavamāna ni tāriṣaḥ āvis te śuṣmaḥ bhavatu priyaḥ madaḥ
translated: O Pavamâna, save us from this and that: let thy delight be manifest, a gladdening draught.

original: somasya dhārā pavate nṛcakṣasa ṛtena devān havate divas pari /
analyzed: somasya dhārā pavate nṛ cakṣasaḥ ṛtena devān havate divaḥ pari
translated: The stream of Soma flows, beholding men, and with the Law invites the Gods from heaven.

original: bṛhaspate ravathenā vi didyute samudrāso na savanāni vivyacuḥ //🔽yaṃ tvā vājinn aghnyā abhy anūṣatāyohataṃ yonim ā rohasi dyumān /🔽maghonām āyuḥ pratiran mahi śrava indrāya soma pavase vṛṣā madaḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspate ravathena vi didyute samudrāsaḥ na savanāni vivyacuḥ  yam tvā vājin aghnyāḥ abhī anūṣata ayaḥ hatam yonim ā rohasi dyumān  maghonām āyuḥ pratiran mahi śravaḥ indrāya soma pavase vṛṣā madaḥ
translated: O Br̥ihaspati, thou shinest with thy radiance: the oceans have extended the libations.🔽O courser, whom the milch-kine have implored, whom, O thou Strong One, thou mountest to thy place, shining.🔽Prolonging life of bounteous princes, and great glory, O Soma, thou art purified as a strong exhilarating draught.

original: endrasya kukṣā pavate madintama ūrjaṃ vasānaḥ śravase sumaṅgalaḥ /
analyzed: ā indrasya kukṣā pavate madintamaḥ ūrjam vasānaḥ śravase su maṅgalaḥ
translated: The most delightful juice flows forth from Indra's side, bearing strength, auspicious, for glory's sake.

original: pratyaṅ sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paprathe krīḷan harir atyaḥ syandate vṛṣā //
analyzed: pratyaṅ sa viśvā bhuvanā abhi paprathe krīḍan hariḥ atyaḥ syandate vṛṣā
translated: He, looking on all living things, hath spread himself abroad. The tawny courser, sporting, flows as a Steer.

original: taṃ tvā devebhyo madhumattamaṃ naraḥ sahasradhāraṃ duhate daśa kṣipaḥ /
analyzed: tam tvā devebhyaḥ madhumattamam naraḥ sahasra dhāram duhate daśa kṣipaḥ
translated: Men milk thee out, best giver of sweet juices, for the Gods, thee, thousand-streamed, with ten swift fingers.

original: nṛbhiḥ soma pracyuto grāvabhiḥ suto viśvān devāṃ ā pavasvā sahasrajit //
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ soma pracyutaḥ grāvabhiḥ sutaḥ viśvān devān ā pavasva sahasra jit
translated: O Soma, pressed by men, impelled by pressing-stones, flow to all Gods, O thou who winnest thousands.

original: taṃ tvā hastino madhumantam adribhir duhanty apsu vṛṣabhaṃ daśa kṣipaḥ /
analyzed: tam tvā hastinaḥ madhumantam adribhiḥ duhanti apsu vṛṣabham daśa kṣipaḥ
translated: The milkers with the stones, the men, O Steer, milk thee, the sweetest, in the waters, ten-streamed.

original: indraṃ soma mādayan daivyaṃ janaṃ sindhor ivormiḥ pavamāno arṣasi //
analyzed: indram soma mādayan daivyam janam sindhoḥ iva ūrmiḥ pavamānaḥ arṣasi
translated: O Soma, gladdening Indra, the divine people, thou flowest on like a wave of the sea, O purifying one.

original: pra somasya pavamānasyormaya indrasya yanti jaṭharaṃ supeśasaḥ /
analyzed: pra somasya pavamānasya ūrmayaḥ indrasya yanti jaṭharam supeśasaḥ
translated: The waves of Soma, the purifying one, beautiful to behold, enter the belly of Indra,

original: dadhnā yad īm unnītā yaśasā gavāṃ dānāya śūram udamandiṣuḥ sutāḥ //
analyzed: dadhnā yat īm unnītāḥ yaśasā gavām dānāya śūram udamandiṣuḥ sutāḥ
translated: when they have been raised with curds, for the gift of Soma, for the hero, the juices have been made to rejoice with the glory of the cows.

original: acchā hi somaḥ kalaśāṃ asiṣyadad atyo na voḷhā raghuvartanir vṛṣā /
analyzed: acchā hi somaḥ kalaśām asiṣyadat atyaḥ na voḍhā raghu vartaniḥ vṛṣā
translated: For Soma, indeed, has flowed into the jars, the bull, swift-moving, like a strong horse.

original: athā devānām ubhayasya janmano vidvāṃ aśnoty amuta itaś ca yat //
analyzed: athā devānām ubhayasya janmanaḥ vidvān aśnoti amutas itas ca yat
translated: Then he, knowing both the births of the gods, from yonder and from here, enjoys what is his.

original: ā naḥ soma pavamānaḥ kirā vasv indo bhava maghavā rādhaso mahaḥ /🔽śikṣā vayodho vasave su cetunā mā no gayam āre asmat parā sicaḥ //
analyzed: ā naḥ soma pavamānaḥ kira vasū indo bhava maghavā rādhasaḥ mahaḥ  śikṣa vayodhaḥ vasave su cetunā mā naḥ gayam āre asmat parā sicaḥ
translated: O Soma, purifying one, be bountiful to us, O Indu, be a great lord of wealth.🔽Instruct us, O you who seek wealth, to win by good choice. Do not lead our song away from us.

original: ā naḥ pūṣā pavamānaḥ surātayo mitro gacchantu varuṇaḥ sajoṣasaḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ pūṣā pavamānaḥ su rātayaḥ mitraḥ gacchantu varuṇaḥ sajoṣasaḥ
translated: May Pusan, purifying, with good favours, Mitra, Varuna, come to us, of one mind.

original: bṛhaspatir maruto vāyur aśvinā tvaṣṭā savitā suyamā sarasvatī //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ marutaḥ vāyuḥ aśvinā tvaṣṭā savitā su yamā sarasvatī
translated: Brihaspati, the Maruts, Vayu, the two Asvins, Tvastr, Savitar, the well-ruling Sarasvati.

original: ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaminve aryamā devo aditir vidhātā /
analyzed: ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaminve aryamā devaḥ aditiḥ vidhātā
translated: Both heaven and earth, all-impelling, Aryaman, the god, Aditi, the ordainer,

original: bhago nṛśaṃsa urv antarikṣaṃ viśve devāḥ pavamānaṃ juṣanta //
analyzed: bhagaḥ nṛśaṃsaḥ uru antarikṣam viśve devāḥ pavamānam juṣanta
translated: Bhaga, the fierce one, the wide atmosphere, the All-gods delight in the purifying Soma.

original: asāvi somo aruṣo vṛṣā harī rājeva dasmo abhi gā acikradat /🔽punāno vāram pary ety avyayaṃ śyeno na yoniṃ ghṛtavantam āsadam //
analyzed: asāvi somaḥ aruṣaḥ vṛṣā hariḥ rājā iva dasmaḥ abhi gāḥ acikradat  punānaḥ vāram pari eti avyayam śyenaḥ na yonim ghṛtavantam āsadam
translated: The red, bull-like Soma has been pressed; the tawny one has roared like a king over the cattle.🔽Purified, he has gone around the woolen filter; like a hawk he has sat down in his ghee-filled birthplace.

original: kavir vedhasyā pary eṣi māhinam atyo na mṛṣṭo abhi vājam arṣasi /
analyzed: kaviḥ vedhasyā pari eṣi māhinam atyaḥ na mṛṣṭaḥ abhi vājam arṣasi
translated: O wise one, you go around the great one's abode; like a well-anointed horse, you flow on for the prize.

original: apasedhan duritā soma mṛḷaya ghṛtaṃ vasānaḥ pari yāsi nirṇijam //🔽parjanyaḥ pitā mahiṣasya parṇino nābhā pṛthivyā giriṣu kṣayaṃ dadhe /
analyzed: apasedhan duritā soma mṛḍaya ghṛtam vasānaḥ pari yāsi nirṇijam  parjanyaḥ pitā mahiṣasya parṇinaḥ nābhā pṛthivyāḥ giriṣu kṣayam dadhe
translated: Driving away evils, O Soma, be gracious; clothed in ghee, you go around the cleansing filter.🔽Parjanya is the father of the mighty bull; he has placed his abode in the mountains, in the navel of the earth.

original: svasāra āpo abhi gā utāsaran saṃ grāvabhir nasate vīte adhvare //
analyzed: svasāraḥ āpaḥ abhi gāḥ uta asaran sam grāvabhiḥ nasate vīte adhvare
translated: The sisters, the waters, have come to the cattle; he joins with the pressing-stones in the well-performed sacrifice.

original: jāyeva patyāv adhi śeva maṃhase pajrāyā garbha śṛṇuhi bravīmi te /
analyzed: jāyā iva patyau adhi śeva maṃhase pajrāyāḥ garbha śṛṇuhi bravīmi te
translated: Like a wife, you delight in your husband; O embryo of the womb, listen, I speak to you.

original: antar vāṇīṣu pra carā su jīvase 'nindyo vṛjane soma jāgṛhi //
analyzed: antar vāṇīṣu pra cara su jīvase nindyaḥ vṛjane soma jāgṛhi
translated: Move among the voices for the sake of good life; be irreproachable in the task, O Soma, be watchful.

original: yathā pūrvebhyaḥ śatasā amṛdhraḥ sahasrasāḥ paryayā vājam indo /
analyzed: yathā pūrvebhyaḥ śata sāḥ amṛdhraḥ sahasra sāḥ paryayaḥ vājam indo
translated: Just as you have gone around for the sake of a hundred and a thousand, unhindered, for the prize, O Indu, for the former ones,

original: evā pavasva suvitāya navyase tava vratam anv āpaḥ sacante //
analyzed: eva pavasva suvitāya navyase tava vratam anu āpaḥ sacante
translated: Thus flow on for new prosperity: the waters follow thy ordinance.

original: pavitraṃ te vitatam brahmaṇas pate prabhur gātrāṇi pary eṣi viśvataḥ /
analyzed: pavitram te vitatam brahmaṇas pate prabhuḥ gātrāṇi pari eṣi viśvatas
translated: The filter is spread out for thee, O lord of prayer: thou as the powerful one goest round all the limbs (of the sacrifice).

original: ataptatanūr na tad āmo aśnute śṛtāsa id vahantas tat sam āśata //
analyzed: a tapta tanūḥ na tat āmaḥ aśnute śṛtāsaḥ id vahantaḥ tat sam āśata
translated: The unheated body does not reach that: the heated (waters) alone, carrying it, have attained to it.

original: tapoṣ pavitraṃ vitataṃ divas pade śocanto asya tantavo vy asthiran /
analyzed: tapoḥ pavitram vitatam divaḥ pade śocantaḥ asya tantavaḥ vi asthiran
translated: The purifying heat is spread out in the place of heaven: the glowing threads of it have been extended.

original: avanty asya pavītāram āśavo divas pṛṣṭham adhi tiṣṭhanti cetasā //🔽arūrucad uṣasaḥ pṛśnir agriya ukṣā bibharti bhuvanāni vājayuḥ /
analyzed: avanti asya pavītāram āśavaḥ divaḥ pṛṣṭham adhi tiṣṭhanti cetasā  arūrucat uṣasaḥ pṛśniḥ agriyaḥ ukṣā bibharti bhuvanāni vājayuḥ
translated: The swift ones purify his strainer: they stand in the mind on the back of the heaven.🔽The dappled one, the first dawn, hath shone forth: the bull, the winner of strength, beareth the worlds.

original: māyāvino mamire asya māyayā nṛcakṣasaḥ pitaro garbham ā dadhuḥ //
analyzed: māyāvinaḥ mamire asya māyayā nṛ cakṣasaḥ pitaraḥ garbham ā
translated: The magicians have measured out his magic power: the fathers, whose eyes are on men, have laid the germ.

original: gandharva itthā padam asya rakṣati pāti devānāṃ janimāny adbhutaḥ /🔽gṛbhṇāti ripuṃ nidhayā nidhāpatiḥ sukṛttamā madhuno bhakṣam āśata //
analyzed: gandharvaḥ itthā padam asya rakṣati pāti devānām janimāni adbhutaḥ  gṛbhṇāti ripum nidhayā nidhā patiḥ su kṛttamāḥ madhunaḥ bhakṣam āśata
translated: The Gandharva here guardeth his place: the wonderful one guardeth the wondrous generations of the gods.🔽The lord of treasures seizeth the foe with his treasure: the most skilful have attained to the food of honey.

original: havir haviṣmo mahi sadma daivyaṃ nabho vasānaḥ pari yāsy adhvaram /
analyzed: haviḥ haviṣmas mahi sadma daivyam nabhaḥ vasānaḥ pari yāsi adhvaram
translated: Thou, O God, art the great seat of the oblation: clothed in the vault of heaven thou shalt go round the sacrifice.

original: rājā pavitraratho vājam āruhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭir jayasi śravo bṛhat //
analyzed: rājā pavitra rathaḥ vājam āruhaḥ sahasra bhṛṣṭiḥ jayasi śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: The king, the chariot of the pure, having mounted strength, with a thousand points, thou conquerest great glory.

original: pavasva devamādano vicarṣaṇir apsā indrāya varuṇāya vāyave /
analyzed: pavasva deva mādanaḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ ap sāḥ indrāya varuṇāya vāyave
translated: Flow on, gladdening the gods, most active, in the waters, for Indra, for Varuna, for Vayu.

original: kṛdhī no adya varivaḥ svastimad urukṣitau gṛṇīhi daivyaṃ janam //
analyzed: kṛdhī naḥ adya varivaḥ svastimat uru kṣitau gṛṇīhi daivyam janam
translated: Grant us today wide room, with bliss, and praise the divine people in the wide-spread abode.

original: ā yas tasthau bhuvanāny amartyo viśvāni somaḥ pari tāny arṣati /
analyzed: ā yaḥ tasthau bhuvanāni amartyaḥ viśvāni somaḥ pari tāni arṣati
translated: He who stands, the immortal, over the worlds, Soma flows around all those.

original: kṛṇvan saṃcṛtaṃ vicṛtam abhiṣṭaya induḥ siṣakty uṣasaṃ na sūryaḥ //
analyzed: kṛṇvan saṃcṛtam vicṛtam abhiṣṭaye induḥ siṣakti uṣasam na sūryaḥ
translated: Making the moving and the unmoving his helpers, Indu joins with the dawn as with the sun.

original: ā yo gobhiḥ sṛjyata oṣadhīṣv ā devānāṃ sumna iṣayann upāvasuḥ /
analyzed: ā yaḥ gobhiḥ sṛjyate oṣadhīṣu ā devānām sumne iṣayan upāvasuḥ
translated: He who is sent forth with the cows in the plants, bringing the favour of the gods, bestowing wealth,

original: ā vidyutā pavate dhārayā suta indraṃ somo mādayan daivyaṃ janam //
analyzed: ā vidyutā pavate dhārayā sutaḥ indram somaḥ mādayan daivyam janam
translated: With lightning he blows along in a stream, the pressed (juice), Soma gladdening Indra, the divine people.

original: eṣa sya somaḥ pavate sahasrajid dhinvāno vācam iṣirām uṣarbudham /
analyzed: eṣa sya somaḥ pavate sahasra jit dhinvānaḥ vācam iṣirām uṣarbudham
translated: This Soma flows on, conquering a thousandfold, urging on speech, strong, rising at dawn.

original: induḥ samudram ud iyarti vāyubhir endrasya hārdi kalaśeṣu sīdati //
analyzed: induḥ samudram ud iyarti vāyubhiḥ ā indrasya hārdi kalaśeṣu sīdati
translated: Indu rises to the ocean with the winds, he settles in the jars in the heart of Indra.

original: abhi tyaṃ gāvaḥ payasā payovṛdhaṃ somaṃ śrīṇanti matibhiḥ svarvidam /
analyzed: abhi tyam gāvaḥ payasā payaḥ vṛdham somam śrīṇanti matibhiḥ svar vidam
translated: The cows, with milk, increase him who increases milk, they mix Soma, the finder of heaven, with thoughts.

original: dhanañjayaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso vipraḥ kaviḥ kāvyenā svarcanāḥ //🔽indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari sravāpāmīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha /
analyzed: dhanañjayaḥ pavate kṛtvyaḥ rasaḥ vipraḥ kaviḥ kāvyena svar canāḥ  indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari srava apa amīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha
translated: Dhananjaya, the purifying essence, the sage, the poet, is purified by his own poetic inspiration.🔽O Soma, well-pressed, flow around for Indra. Let there be no disease for him together with the demon.

original: mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvino draviṇasvanta iha santv indavaḥ //
analyzed: mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvinaḥ draviṇasvantaḥ iha santu indavaḥ
translated: Let not the two-tongued one taste of your juice. Let the Soma drops be rich in treasure here.

original: asmān samarye pavamāna codaya dakṣo devānām asi hi priyo madaḥ /🔽jahi śatrūṃr abhy ā bhandanāyataḥ pibendra somam ava no mṛdho jahi //
analyzed: asmān samarye pavamāna codaya dakṣaḥ devānām asi hi priyaḥ madaḥ  jahi śatrūṃr abhi ā bhandanāyataḥ piba indra somam ava naḥ mṛdhaḥ jahi
translated: O Pavamana, impel us in the battle. You are the dear exhilarating drink of the gods.🔽Slay the enemies who come to fight. Drink the Soma, O Indra, and drive away our foes.

original: adabdha indo pavase madintama ātmendrasya bhavasi dhāsir uttamaḥ /
analyzed: adabdhaḥ indo pavase madintamaḥ ātmā indrasya bhavasi dhāsiḥ uttamaḥ
translated: O Indu, you flow uninjured, most exhilarating, becoming the highest support of Indra's soul.

original: abhi svaranti bahavo manīṣiṇo rājānam asya bhuvanasya niṃsate //
analyzed: abhi svaranti bahavaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ rājānam asya bhuvanasya niṃsate
translated: Many wise ones sing to you. You are the king of this world.

original: sahasraṇīthaḥ śatadhāro adbhuta indrāyenduḥ pavate kāmyam madhu /
analyzed: sahasraṇīthaḥ śata dhāraḥ adbhutaḥ indrāya induḥ pavate kāmyam madhu
translated: The wondrous Soma, with a thousand paths, a hundred streams, flows for Indra, the desirable honey.

original: jayan kṣetram abhy arṣā jayann apa uruṃ no gātuṃ kṛṇu soma mīḍhvaḥ //
analyzed: jayan kṣetram abhi arṣa jayan apaḥ urum naḥ gātum kṛṇu soma mīḍhvaḥ
translated: Conquering the field, flow on, conquering the waters. Make a wide path for us, O bountiful Soma.

original: kanikradat kalaśe gobhir ajyase vy avyayaṃ samayā vāram arṣasi /
analyzed: kanikradat kalaśe gobhiḥ ajyase vi avyayam samayā vāram arṣasi
translated: You are anointed in the pot with milk. You flow along the woolen filter, passing through the woolen filter.

original: marmṛjyamāno atyo na sānasir indrasya soma jaṭhare sam akṣaraḥ //
analyzed: marmṛjyamānaḥ atyaḥ na sānasiḥ indrasya soma jaṭhare sam akṣaraḥ
translated: Thou, being anointed, art like a courser who wins the prize: into Indra's throat, O Soma, hast thou passed.

original: svāduḥ pavasva divyāya janmane svādur indrāya suhavītunāmne /
analyzed: svāduḥ pavasva divyāya janmane svāduḥ indrāya suhavītunāmne
translated: Sweet, flow for the celestial race: sweet, for Indra, whose due is the invocation of the pious.

original: svādur mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave bṛhaspataye madhumāṃ adābhyaḥ //🔽atyam mṛjanti kalaśe daśa kṣipaḥ pra viprāṇām matayo vāca īrate /
analyzed: svāduḥ mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave bṛhaspataye madhumān adābhyaḥ  atyam mṛjanti kalaśe daśa kṣipaḥ pra viprāṇām matayaḥ vācaḥ īrate
translated: Sweet, for Mitra, Varuna, Vâyu, for Br̥ihaspati, the honey-dropping, never-failing One.🔽They cleanse the courser in the trough, the ten swift ones: the thoughts of sages move in ordered utterance.

original: pavamānā abhy arṣanti suṣṭutim endraṃ viśanti madirāsa indavaḥ //
analyzed: pavamānāḥ abhi arṣanti suṣṭutim ā indram viśanti madirāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: The purifying drops flow on to the eulogy: the drops, the gladdening, enter Indra.

original: pavamāno abhy arṣā suvīryam urvīṃ gavyūtim mahi śarma saprathaḥ /
analyzed: pavamānaḥ abhī arṣa su vīryam urvīm gavyūtim mahi śarma saprathaḥ
translated: O Pavamâna, send us hero strength in plenty, wide pasture, and great shelter that is spacious.

original: mākir no asya pariṣūtir īśatendo jayema tvayā dhanaṃdhanam //
analyzed: mākir naḥ asya pariṣūtiḥ īśata indo jayema tvayā dhanaṃdhanam
translated: Let not the violence of this one overcome us: with thee, O Indu, may we ever win us wealth.

original: adhi dyām asthād vṛṣabho vicakṣaṇo 'rūrucad vi divo rocanā kaviḥ /
analyzed: adhi dyām asthāt vṛṣabhaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ rūrucat vi divaḥ rocanā kaviḥ
translated: The Steer, the wondrous One, hath mounted to the sky: the Sage hath shone resplendent through the regions of the heavens.

original: rājā pavitram aty eti roruvad divaḥ pīyūṣaṃ duhate nṛcakṣasaḥ //
analyzed: rājā pavitram ati eti roruvat divaḥ pīyūṣam duhate nṛ cakṣasaḥ
translated: The King, roaring, passes through the cleansing sieve: they who behold mankind draw forth the milk of heaven.

original: divo nāke madhujihvā asaścato venā duhanty ukṣaṇaṃ giriṣṭhām /
analyzed: divaḥ nāke madhu jihvāḥ asaścataḥ venāḥ duhanti ukṣaṇam giriṣṭhām
translated: In the vault of the sky, with honey in their mouths, the never-failing ones, the streams, milk the wild bull who dwells in the mountain.

original: apsu drapsaṃ vāvṛdhānaṃ samudra ā sindhor ūrmā madhumantam pavitra ā //
analyzed: apsu drapsam vāvṛdhānam samudre ā sindhoḥ ūrmā madhumantam pavitre ā
translated: The drop, grown great in the waters, in the ocean, in the wave of the river, sweet, in the filter.

original: nāke suparṇam upapaptivāṃsaṃ giro venānām akṛpanta pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: nāke suparṇam upapaptivāṃsam giraḥ venānām akṛpanta pūrvīḥ
translated: The bird that hath flown up to the vault of heaven, the many voices of the yearning have sung forth.

original: śiśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṃ hiraṇyayaṃ śakunaṃ kṣāmaṇi sthām //
analyzed: śiśum rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam hiraṇyayam śakunam kṣāmaṇi sthām
translated: The hymns kiss the infant, the golden bird, that hath settled down on the back (of the steed).

original: ūrdhvo gandharvo adhi nāke asthād viśvā rūpā praticakṣāṇo asya /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ gandharvaḥ adhi nāke asthāt viśvā rūpā praticakṣāṇaḥ asya
translated: The Gandharva hath stood up on the vault of heaven, beholding all the forms of this (earth).

original: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā vy adyaut prārūrucad rodasī mātarā śuciḥ //
analyzed: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā vi adyaut prārūrucat rodasī mātarā śuciḥ
translated: The light hath shone with pure radiance; the pure one hath shone forth, the two mothers, the firmaments.

original: pra ta āśavaḥ pavamāna dhījavo madā arṣanti raghujā iva tmanā /
analyzed: pra te āśavaḥ pavamāna dhī javaḥ madāḥ arṣanti raghu jāḥ iva tmanā
translated: Thy swift thoughts, O Pavamâna, thy joys, flow onward, as it were, in their own might, on rapid paths.

original: divyāḥ suparṇā madhumanta indavo madintamāsaḥ pari kośam āsate //
analyzed: divyāḥ suparṇāḥ madhumantaḥ indavaḥ madintamāsaḥ pari kośam āsate
translated: The heavenly birds, the drops full of sweetness, the most gladdening, sit around the reservoir.

original: pra te madāso madirāsa āśavo 'sṛkṣata rathyāso yathā pṛthak /🔽dhenur na vatsam payasābhi vajriṇam indram indavo madhumanta ūrmayaḥ //
analyzed: pra te madāsaḥ madirāsaḥ āśavaḥ sṛkṣata rathyāsaḥ yathā pṛthak  dhenuḥ na vatsam payasā abhi vajriṇam indram indavaḥ madhumantaḥ ūrmayaḥ
translated: Thy gladdening juices, thy most rapid gladdening drinks have flowed apart, like chariots, for the race.🔽The drops, full of honey, like a cow to her calf, have flowed to the wielder of the thunderbolt, to Indra.

original: atyo na hiyāno abhi vājam arṣa svarvit kośaṃ divo adrimātaram /
analyzed: atyaḥ na hiyānaḥ abhi vājam arṣa svar vid kośam divaḥ adri mātaram
translated: Flow on, like a courser eager for the prize, to the reservoir of heaven, the spring of the mountain, the finder of the light.

original: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avyaye somaḥ punāna indriyāya dhāyase //
analyzed: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avyaye somaḥ punānaḥ indriyāya dhāyase
translated: The bull upon the fleece, in the inexhaustible place, Soma, being purified, for Indra's strength and support.

original: pra ta āśvinīḥ pavamāna dhījuvo divyā asṛgran payasā dharīmaṇi /
analyzed: pra te āśvinīḥ pavamāna dhī juvaḥ divyāḥ asṛgran payasā dharīmaṇi
translated: O Pavamana, let thy Aśvin inspirations, urged by the thought, flow with milk into the reservoir, heavenly ones.

original: prāntar ṛṣaya sthāvirīr asṛkṣata ye tvā mṛjanty ṛṣiṣāṇa vedhasaḥ //
analyzed: pra antar ṛṣayaḥ sthāvirīḥ asṛkṣata ye tvā mṛjanti ṛṣiṣāṇa vedhasaḥ
translated: The ancient Rishis have flowed within thee, O thou who art to be known by the Rishis, O thou who art to be purified by the Rishis.

original: viśvā dhāmāni viśvacakṣa ṛbhvasaḥ prabhos te sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ /
analyzed: viśvā dhāmāni viśva cakṣaḥ ṛbhvasaḥ prabhoḥ te sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ
translated: O thou who beholdest all things, O thou who art all-seeing, O thou who art mighty, thy rays go round all the abodes, when thou art powerful.

original: vyānaśiḥ pavase soma dharmabhiḥ patir viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi //
analyzed: vyānaśiḥ pavase soma dharmabhiḥ patiḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi
translated: O Soma, thou shinest with thy powers, thou art the lord of the whole world, thou reignest.

original: ubhayataḥ pavamānasya raśmayo dhruvasya sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ /
analyzed: ubhayatas pavamānasya raśmayaḥ dhruvasya sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ
translated: The rays of Pavamana, of the firm one, go round on both sides, his banners.

original: yadī pavitre adhi mṛjyate hariḥ sattā ni yonā kalaśeṣu sīdati //
analyzed: yadī pavitre adhi mṛjyate hariḥ sattā ni yonā kalaśeṣu sīdati
translated: When the tawny one is purified on the filter, he sits down in the wombs, in the jars.

original: yajñasya ketuḥ pavate svadhvaraḥ somo devānām upa yāti niṣkṛtam /
analyzed: yajñasya ketuḥ pavate su adhvaraḥ somaḥ devānām upa yāti niṣkṛtam
translated: The banner of the sacrifice moves on, purifying itself, Soma approaches the place of the gods.

original: sahasradhāraḥ pari kośam arṣati vṛṣā pavitram aty eti roruvat //
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ pari kośam arṣati vṛṣā pavitram ati eti roruvat
translated: The thousand-streamed one flows into the trough, the bull passes through the filter, roaring.

original: rājā samudraṃ nadyo vi gāhate 'pām ūrmiṃ sacate sindhuṣu śritaḥ /
analyzed: rājā samudram nadyaḥ vi gāhate pām ūrmim sacate sindhuṣu śritaḥ
translated: The king penetrates the ocean, the rivers, he accompanies the wave of the waters, dwelling among the streams.

original: adhy asthāt sānu pavamāno avyayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divaḥ //
analyzed: adhi asthāt sānu pavamānaḥ avyayam nābhā pṛthivyāḥ dharuṇaḥ mahaḥ divaḥ
translated: Pavamâna hath mounted the back of the steed, the undecaying, the centre of the earth, the prop of the great sky.

original: divo na sānu stanayann acikradad dyauś ca yasya pṛthivī ca dharmabhiḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ na sānu stanayan acikradat dyauḥ ca yasya pṛthivī ca dharmabhiḥ
translated: The back of the sky hath roared and thundered; by his laws is the sky and the earth.

original: indrasya sakhyam pavate vivevidat somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati //
analyzed: indrasya sakhyam pavate vivevidat somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati
translated: Soma, purified, flows on to the bowls, winning Indra's friendship.

original: jyotir yajñasya pavate madhu priyam pitā devānāṃ janitā vibhūvasuḥ /
analyzed: jyotiḥ yajñasya pavate madhu priyam pitā devānām janitā vibhūvasuḥ
translated: The dear sweet light of sacrifice flows on, the Father of the Gods, the Begetter, the Possessor of all wealth.

original: dadhāti ratnaṃ svadhayor apīcyam madintamo matsara indriyo rasaḥ //🔽abhikrandan kalaśaṃ vājy arṣati patir divaḥ śatadhāro vicakṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: dadhāti ratnam svadhayoḥ apīcyam madintamaḥ matsaraḥ indriyaḥ rasaḥ  abhikrandan kalaśam vājī arṣati patiḥ divaḥ śata dhāraḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: He places in the two mighty ones the treasure that is his own, the most gladdening juice, the essence that is meet for Indra.🔽The strong one, the lord of the sky, of a hundred streams, the far-seeing,

original: harir mitrasya sadaneṣu sīdati marmṛjāno 'vibhiḥ sindhubhir vṛṣā //
analyzed: hariḥ mitrasya sadaneṣu sīdati marmṛjānaḥ vibhiḥ sindhubhiḥ vṛṣā
translated: bellowing, flows to the jar. The tawny one settles in the seats of Mitra, the strong one, being cleansed, with the floods, with the sheep.

original: agre sindhūnām pavamāno arṣaty agre vāco agriyo goṣu gacchati /
analyzed: agre sindhūnām pavamānaḥ arṣati agre vācaḥ agriyaḥ goṣu gacchati
translated: Forth flows Pavamâna in the van of the streams, in the van of the voices, in the van of the cows he goes.

original: agre vājasya bhajate mahādhanaṃ svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyate vṛṣā //
analyzed: agre vājasya bhajate mahā dhanam su āyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyate vṛṣā
translated: In the van of strength he allots the great prize. The strong one, armed with his own weapons, is purified by the pressers.

original: ayam matavāñ chakuno yathā hito 'vye sasāra pavamāna ūrmiṇā /
analyzed: ayam matavān śakunaḥ yathā hitaḥ vye sasāra pavamānaḥ ūrmiṇā
translated: This Pavamâna, like a bird that hath found its prey, hath flowed in a wave on the fleecy (filter).

original: tava kratvā rodasī antarā kave śucir dhiyā pavate soma indra te //🔽drāpiṃ vasāno yajato divispṛśam antarikṣaprā bhuvaneṣv arpitaḥ /
analyzed: tava kratvā rodasī antarā kave śuciḥ dhiyā pavate somaḥ indra te  drāpim vasānaḥ yajataḥ divispṛśam antarikṣa prāḥ bhuvaneṣu arpitaḥ
translated: O wise one, with thy wisdom between the two world-halves, pure Soma flows for thee, O Indra, with the thought.🔽Wearing the robe of the sacrificer, touching the sky, filling the atmosphere, set in the worlds,

original: svar jajñāno nabhasābhy akramīt pratnam asya pitaram ā vivāsati //
analyzed: svar jajñānaḥ nabhasā abhi akramīt pratnam asya pitaram ā vivāsati
translated: Born in the heaven, he hath passed through the mist. He visits his ancient father.

original: so asya viśe mahi śarma yacchati yo asya dhāma prathamaṃ vyānaśe /
analyzed: saḥ asya viśe mahi śarma yacchati yaḥ asya dhāma prathamam vyānaśe
translated: He bestows great protection on his people, he who first hath extended his abode.

original: padaṃ yad asya parame vyomany ato viśvā abhi saṃ yāti saṃyataḥ //
analyzed: padam yat asya parame vyomani atas viśvāḥ abhi sam yāti saṃyataḥ
translated: The place of his highest heaven, thence he goes forth, self-yoked, over all things.

original: pro ayāsīd indur indrasya niṣkṛtaṃ sakhā sakhyur na pra mināti saṃgiram /
analyzed: pra u ayāsīt induḥ indrasya niṣkṛtam sakhā sakhyuḥ na pra mināti saṃgiram
translated: Indra's decree hath Indu passed, the friend deceives not the friend's command.

original: marya iva yuvatibhiḥ sam arṣati somaḥ kalaśe śatayāmnā pathā //
analyzed: maryaḥ iva yuvatibhiḥ sam arṣati somaḥ kalaśe śata yāmnā pathā
translated: Like a young man he flows with the maidens, Soma in the jar by the path of a hundred winters.

original: pra vo dhiyo mandrayuvo vipanyuvaḥ panasyuvaḥ saṃvasaneṣv akramuḥ /🔽somam manīṣā abhy anūṣata stubho 'bhi dhenavaḥ payasem aśiśrayuḥ //
analyzed: pra vaḥ dhiyaḥ mandrayuvaḥ vipanyuvaḥ panasyuvaḥ saṃvasaneṣu akramuḥ  somam manīṣāḥ abhī anūṣata stubhaḥ bhi dhenavaḥ payasā īm aśiśrayuḥ
translated: Your thoughts, O friends, young and joyous, longing for the meeting-place, have come forth.🔽The hymns have sung after the Soma with their thought, the milch-kine have sat down to the milk.

original: ā naḥ soma saṃyatam pipyuṣīm iṣam indo pavasva pavamāno asridham /
analyzed: ā naḥ soma saṃyatam pipyuṣīm iṣam indo pavasva pavamānaḥ asridham
translated: O Soma, make our food abundant, which is prepared, O Indu, flow on, O Purifier, unresisted.

original: yā no dohate trir ahann asaścuṣī kṣumad vājavan madhumat suvīryam //
analyzed: yā naḥ dohate tris ahan a saścuṣī kṣumat vājavat madhumat su vīryam
translated: Which, unfailing, thrice a day, gives us food, strength, and honey, and good heroic power.

original: vṛṣā matīnām pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ somo ahnaḥ pratarītoṣaso divaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā matīnām pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ somaḥ ahnaḥ pratarītā uṣasaḥ divaḥ
translated: The bull, the all-seeing one, flows on for the thoughts, Soma, the leader of the day, of the dawn, of the sky.

original: krāṇā sindhūnāṃ kalaśāṃ avīvaśad indrasya hārdy āviśan manīṣibhiḥ //
analyzed: krāṇā sindhūnām kalaśām avīvaśat indrasya hārdi āviśat manīṣibhiḥ
translated: He has filled the jars of the rivers, he has entered the heart of Indra, the wise ones.

original: manīṣibhiḥ pavate pūrvyaḥ kavir nṛbhir yataḥ pari kośāṃ acikradat /
analyzed: manīṣibhiḥ pavate pūrvyaḥ kaviḥ nṛbhiḥ yataḥ pari kośān acikradat
translated: The wise one flows on, the ancient sage, urged on by the men, he has roared around the vats.

original: tritasya nāma janayan madhu kṣarad indrasya vāyoḥ sakhyāya kartave //
analyzed: tritasya nāma janayat madhu kṣarat indrasya vāyoḥ sakhyāya kartave
translated: Producing Trita's name, letting the honey flow, for Indra and Vayu to make friendship.

original: ayam punāna uṣaso vi rocayad ayaṃ sindhubhyo abhavad u lokakṛt /
analyzed: ayam punānaḥ uṣasaḥ vi rocayat ayam sindhubhyaḥ abhavat u loka kṛt
translated: This one, being purified, illumines the dawns; this one has become the maker of room for the rivers.

original: ayaṃ triḥ sapta duduhāna āśiraṃ somo hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ //
analyzed: ayam tris sapta duduhānaḥ āśiram somaḥ hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ
translated: This one, being milked thrice seven times, the sweet milk, Soma flows on for delight into Indra's heart.

original: pavasva soma divyeṣu dhāmasu sṛjāna indo kalaśe pavitra ā /🔽sīdann indrasya jaṭhare kanikradan nṛbhir yataḥ sūryam ārohayo divi //
analyzed: pavasva soma divyeṣu dhāmasu sṛjānaḥ indo kalaśe pavitre ā  sīdan indrasya jaṭhare kanikradan nṛbhiḥ yataḥ sūryam ārohayaḥ divi
translated: Flow on, O Soma, in the heavenly abodes, being created, O Indu, in the jar, in the filter.🔽Roaring, entering into Indra's belly, urged on by the men, thou mountest the sun in the sky.

original: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavase pavitra āṃ indav indrasya jaṭhareṣv āviśan /
analyzed: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavase pavitre ām indo indrasya jaṭhareṣu āviśan
translated: Being pressed with the stones, thou flowest on for purification, O Indu, entering into Indra's bellies.

original: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā abhavo vicakṣaṇa soma gotram aṅgirobhyo 'vṛṇor apa //
analyzed: tvam nṛ cakṣāḥ abhavaḥ vicakṣaṇa soma gotram aṅgirobhyaḥ vṛṇoḥ apa
translated: O Soma, thou hast become the seer of men, O thou of wondrous deeds; thou hast disclosed the fold to the Angirases.

original: tvāṃ soma pavamānaṃ svādhyo 'nu viprāso amadann avasyavaḥ /🔽tvāṃ suparṇa ābharad divas parīndo viśvābhir matibhiḥ pariṣkṛtam //
analyzed: tvām soma pavamānam su ādhyaḥ nu viprāsaḥ amadan avasyavaḥ  tvām suparṇaḥ ābharat divaḥ pari indo viśvābhiḥ matibhiḥ pariṣkṛtam
translated: O Soma Pavamâna, the sages, the pious, have rejoiced in thee, the bountiful.🔽The eagle hath brought thee down from heaven, O Indu, purified by all the thoughts of men.

original: avye punānam pari vāra ūrmiṇā hariṃ navante abhi sapta dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: avye punānam pari vāre ūrmiṇā harim navante abhi sapta dhenavaḥ
translated: The seven milch-kine with their wave, in the fleecy cloth, cleanse thee the tawny one who purifiest thee.

original: apām upasthe adhy āyavaḥ kavim ṛtasya yonā mahiṣā aheṣata //🔽induḥ punāno ati gāhate mṛdho viśvāni kṛṇvan supathāni yajyave /
analyzed: apām upasthe adhi āyavaḥ kavim ṛtasya yonā mahiṣāḥ aheṣata  induḥ punānaḥ ati gāhate mṛdhaḥ viśvāni kṛṇvan su pathāni yajyave
translated: In the lap of the waters the mighty ones have urged the sage, the living one, to the birthplace of holy order.🔽The Indu, while he is purified, passes through the filth, making all the paths easy for the worshipper.

original: gāḥ kṛṇvāno nirṇijaṃ haryataḥ kavir atyo na krīḷan pari vāram arṣati //
analyzed: gāḥ kṛṇvānaḥ nirṇijam haryataḥ kaviḥ atyaḥ na krīḍan pari vāram arṣati
translated: Making the cows, the cleansing, the tawny one, the sage, he flows over the fleecy cloth, sporting like a horse.

original: asaścataḥ śatadhārā abhiśriyo hariṃ navante 'va tā udanyuvaḥ /
analyzed: asaścataḥ śata dhārāḥ abhiśriyaḥ harim navante vai tāḥ udanyuvaḥ
translated: The hundred-streaming, never-failing streams, the tawny one, the bountiful, the waters, have sung forth.

original: kṣipo mṛjanti pari gobhir āvṛtaṃ tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: kṣipaḥ mṛjanti pari gobhiḥ āvṛtam tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ
translated: The drops adorn him, him who is encompassed by the cows, on the third height, in the light of the sky.

original: tavemāḥ prajā divyasya retasas tvaṃ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi /
analyzed: tava imāḥ prajāḥ divyasya retasaḥ tvam viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi
translated: These creatures of thine, of the heavenly seed, thou rulest over all the world.

original: athedaṃ viśvam pavamāna te vaśe tvam indo prathamo dhāmadhā asi //
analyzed: atha idam viśvam pavamāna te vaśe tvam indo prathamaḥ dhāma dhāḥ asi
translated: Now this whole universe is under your control, O Pavamâna; thou, O Indu, art the first to hold the abode.

original: tvaṃ samudro asi viśvavit kave tavemāḥ pañca pradiśo vidharmaṇi /
analyzed: tvam samudraḥ asi viśva vid kave tava imāḥ pañca pradiśaḥ vidharmaṇi
translated: Thou art the ocean, O wise one, all-knowing; these five regions of thine are in the world-order.

original: tvaṃ dyāṃ ca pṛthivīṃ cāti jabhriṣe tava jyotīṃṣi pavamāna sūryaḥ //
analyzed: tvam dyām ca pṛthivīm ca ati jabhriṣe tava jyotīṃṣi pavamāna sūryaḥ
translated: Thou hast filled full the sky and the earth; thy lights, O Pavamâna, are the sun.

original: tvam pavitre rajaso vidharmaṇi devebhyaḥ soma pavamāna pūyase /
analyzed: tvam pavitre rajasaḥ vidharmaṇi devebhyaḥ soma pavamāna pūyase
translated: Thou, on the purifying filter, in the world-order, art purified for the gods, O Soma, O Pavamâna.

original: tvām uśijaḥ prathamā agṛbhṇata tubhyemā viśvā bhuvanāni yemire //🔽pra rebha ety ati vāram avyayaṃ vṛṣā vaneṣv ava cakradad dhariḥ /
analyzed: tvām uśijaḥ prathamāḥ agṛbhṇata tubhya imā viśvā bhuvanāni yemire  pra rebhaḥ eti ati vāram avyayam vṛṣā vaneṣu ava cakradat hariḥ
translated: The longing ones have first laid hold on thee; for thee all these existing things have bowed.🔽The singer has come to the sieve that is not to be transgressed; the tawny bull has bellowed in the woods.

original: saṃ dhītayo vāvaśānā anūṣata śiśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam //
analyzed: sam dhītayaḥ vāvaśānāḥ anūṣata śiśum rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam
translated: The songs, longing for him, have resounded; the thoughts kiss the child who is bent on his way.

original: sa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ pari vyata tantuṃ tanvānas trivṛtaṃ yathā vide /🔽nayann ṛtasya praśiṣo navīyasīḥ patir janīnām upa yāti niṣkṛtam //
analyzed: sa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ pari vyata tantum tanvānaḥ trivṛtam yathā vide  nayan ṛtasya praśiṣaḥ navīyasīḥ patiḥ janīnām upa yāti niṣkṛtam
translated: He is clothed with the rays of the sun, weaving the thread as he knows the threefold one.🔽Leading the newest ordinances of truth, the lord of the people goes to the place of rest.

original: rājā sindhūnām pavate patir diva ṛtasya yāti pathibhiḥ kanikradat /
analyzed: rājā sindhūnām pavate patiḥ divaḥ ṛtasya yāti pathibhiḥ kanikradat
translated: The king of the rivers flows, the lord of the sky, roaring along the paths of truth.

original: sahasradhāraḥ pari ṣicyate hariḥ punāno vācaṃ janayann upāvasuḥ //
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ pari sicyate hariḥ punānaḥ vācam janayan upāvasuḥ
translated: The thousand-streamed tawny one is poured around, purifying, producing speech, bestowing wealth.

original: pavamāna mahy arṇo vi dhāvasi sūro na citro avyayāni pavyayā /
analyzed: pavamāna mahi arṇaḥ vi dhāvasi sūraḥ na citraḥ avyayāni pavyayā
translated: O Pavamana, you flow through the great ocean, like the variegated sun through the undecaying (waters),

original: gabhastipūto nṛbhir adribhiḥ suto mahe vājāya dhanyāya dhanvasi //
analyzed: gabhasti pūtaḥ nṛbhiḥ adribhiḥ sutaḥ mahe vājāya dhanyāya dhanvasi
translated: purified by the filter, pressed by men and stones, you flow for the great prize, for the winning of wealth.

original: iṣam ūrjam pavamānābhy arṣasi śyeno na vaṃsu kalaśeṣu sīdasi /
analyzed: iṣam ūrjam pavamāna abhi arṣasi śyenaḥ na kalaśeṣu sīdasi
translated: You flow on, O Pavamana, with food and strength. You sit in the jars like a hawk in a reed-bed.

original: indrāya madvā madyo madaḥ suto divo viṣṭambha upamo vicakṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: indrāya madvā madyaḥ madaḥ sutaḥ divaḥ viṣṭambhaḥ upamaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Pressed for Indra, you are the gladdener's gladdest drink, the drink for the mighty, the wise support of heaven.

original: sapta svasāro abhi mātaraḥ śiśuṃ navaṃ jajñānaṃ jenyaṃ vipaścitam /
analyzed: sapta svasāraḥ abhi mātaraḥ śiśum navam jajñānam jenyam vipaścitam
translated: The seven sisters, the mothers, the newly born child, the young, the wise one, the noble one,

original: apāṃ gandharvaṃ divyaṃ nṛcakṣasaṃ somaṃ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājase //
analyzed: apām gandharvam divyam nṛ cakṣasam somam viśvasya bhuvanasya rājase
translated: the Gandharva of the waters, the heavenly one, the one with human eyes, Soma, you shine as king of the whole world.

original: īśāna imā bhuvanāni vīyase yujāna indo haritaḥ suparṇyaḥ /🔽tās te kṣarantu madhumad ghṛtam payas tava vrate soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: īśānaḥ imā bhuvanāni vīyase yujānaḥ indo haritaḥ suparṇyaḥ  tāḥ te kṣarantu madhumat ghṛtam payaḥ tava vrate soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: You rule over these worlds, O Indra, yoking your tawny well-winged mares.🔽May they flow for you, full of honey, ghee, and milk. May the people stand in your covenant, O Soma.

original: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā asi soma viśvataḥ pavamāna vṛṣabha tā vi dhāvasi /
analyzed: tvam nṛ cakṣāḥ asi soma viśvatas pavamāna vṛṣabha tā vi dhāvasi
translated: You, O Soma, are the one who sees men from all sides, O Pavamana, O bull, you flow through them.

original: sa naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavad vayaṃ syāma bhuvaneṣu jīvase //
analyzed: sa naḥ pavasva vasumat hiraṇyavat vayam syāma bhuvaneṣu jīvase
translated: Flow on to us, bringing wealth in cattle and gold, that we may live in the worlds of the living.

original: govit pavasva vasuvid dhiraṇyavid retodhā indo bhuvaneṣv arpitaḥ /
analyzed: go vid pavasva vasu vid hiraṇya vid retaḥ dhāḥ indo bhuvaneṣu arpitaḥ
translated: Find the cattle, find the wealth, find the gold, O Indu, the bestower of seed, placed in the worlds.

original: tvaṃ suvīro asi soma viśvavit taṃ tvā viprā upa girema āsate //
analyzed: tvam su vīraḥ asi soma viśva vid tam tvā viprāḥ upa girā ime āsate
translated: You are the Soma with good heroes, finding all things. The sages sit near you on the mountain.

original: un madhva ūrmir vananā atiṣṭhipad apo vasāno mahiṣo vi gāhate /🔽rājā pavitraratho vājam āruhat sahasrabhṛṣṭir jayati śravo bṛhat //
analyzed: ud madhvaḥ ūrmiḥ vananāḥ atiṣṭhipat apaḥ vasānaḥ mahiṣaḥ vi gāhate  rājā pavitra rathaḥ vājam āruhat sahasra bhṛṣṭiḥ jayati śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: The sweet wave has risen above the crushings. The bull, clothed in waters, plunges into the great (ocean).🔽The king, with the chariot of the filter, has mounted the strength. He, with a thousand spikes, conquers great glory.

original: sa bhandanā ud iyarti prajāvatīr viśvāyur viśvāḥ subharā ahardivi /
analyzed: sa bhandanāḥ ud iyarti prajāvatīḥ viśvāyuḥ viśvāḥ subharāḥ ahardivi
translated: He lifts up the joyful songs, rich in offspring, with life for all, bearing all good burdens by day and night.

original: brahma prajāvad rayim aśvapastyam pīta indav indram asmabhyaṃ yācatāt //
analyzed: brahma prajāvat rayim aśva pastyam pītaḥ indo indram asmabhyam yācatāt
translated: O pressed Soma, ask Indra for Brahman, for wealth with offspring, and for horses and cattle.

original: so agre ahnāṃ harir haryato madaḥ pra cetasā cetayate anu dyubhiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ agre ahnām hariḥ haryataḥ madaḥ pra cetasā cetayate anu dyubhiḥ
translated: He, the first of the days, the tawny joy of the tawny one, thinks with his mind, according to the lights.

original: dvā janā yātayann antar īyate narā ca śaṃsaṃ daivyaṃ ca dhartari //
analyzed: dvā janā yātayan antar īyate narā ca śaṃsam daivyam ca dhartari
translated: He goes between the two peoples, guiding, he goes between the two men and the divine assembly, O supporter.

original: añjate vy añjate sam añjate kratuṃ rihanti madhunābhy añjate /
analyzed: añjate vi añjate sam añjate kratum rihanti madhunā abhi añjate
translated: They anoint, they anoint apart, they anoint together. They kiss the thought, they anoint with honey.

original: sindhor ucchvāse patayantam ukṣaṇaṃ hiraṇyapāvāḥ paśum āsu gṛbhṇate //
analyzed: sindhoḥ ucchvāse patayantam ukṣaṇam hiraṇya pāvāḥ paśum āsu gṛbhṇate
translated: The golden-hued ones seize the bull, the moving one, falling in the breath of Sindhu, in the waters.

original: vipaścite pavamānāya gāyata mahī na dhārāty andho arṣati /🔽ahir na jūrṇām ati sarpati tvacam atyo na krīḷann asarad vṛṣā hariḥ //🔽agrego rājāpyas taviṣyate vimāno ahnām bhuvaneṣv arpitaḥ /
analyzed: vipaścite pavamānāya gāyata mahī na dhārā ati andhaḥ arṣati  ahiḥ na jūrṇām ati sarpati tvacam atyaḥ na krīḍan asarat vṛṣā hariḥ  agregaḥ rājā āpyaḥ taviṣyate vimānaḥ ahnām bhuvaneṣu arpitaḥ
translated: Sing to the wise Pavamana, the great one flows on in a stream of ghee.🔽He glides like a serpent over his worn-out skin, the strong tawny one moves like a horse at play.🔽The first-born king, the powerful one, the unmeasured one, is set in the worlds of the days.

original: harir ghṛtasnuḥ sudṛśīko arṇavo jyotīrathaḥ pavate rāya okyaḥ //
analyzed: hariḥ ghṛtasnuḥ su dṛśīkaḥ arṇavaḥ jyotīrathaḥ pavate rāye okyaḥ
translated: The tawny one, anointed with ghee, the well-looking one, the ocean, the chariot of light, flows for the sake of wealth.

original: asarji skambho diva udyato madaḥ pari tridhātur bhuvanāny arṣati /🔽aṃśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṃ girā yadi nirṇijam ṛgmiṇo yayuḥ //
analyzed: asarji skambhaḥ divaḥ udyataḥ madaḥ pari tri dhātuḥ bhuvanāni arṣati  aṃśum rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam girā yadi nirṇijam ṛgmiṇaḥ yayuḥ
translated: The pillar, the uplifted joy, has been sent forth; it flows through the three worlds.🔽The thoughts kiss the bent stalk, if the singers have gone to the cleansing with the song.

original: pra te dhārā aty aṇvāni meṣyaḥ punānasya saṃyato yanti raṃhayaḥ /🔽yad gobhir indo camvoḥ samajyasa ā suvānaḥ soma kalaśeṣu sīdasi //
analyzed: pra te dhārāḥ ati aṇvāni meṣyaḥ punānasya saṃyataḥ yanti raṃhayaḥ  yat gobhiḥ indo camvoḥ samajyase ā suvānaḥ soma kalaśeṣu sīdasi
translated: The streams of the purified one, O honey-maker, go forth to the subtle parts, the swift ones, when restrained.🔽When, O Indu, thou art pressed with the cows in the bowls, thou sittest, being pressed, in the jars, O Soma.

original: pavasva soma kratuvin na ukthyo 'vyo vāre pari dhāva madhu priyam /
analyzed: pavasva soma kratu vid naḥ ukthyaḥ vyaḥ vāre pari dhāva madhu priyam
translated: Flow on, O Soma, wise, meet for praise, run through the woollen filter the dear sweet (juice).

original: jahi viśvān rakṣasa indo atriṇo bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: jahi viśvān rakṣasaḥ indo atriṇaḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Slay all the Raksases, O Indu, the devourers, and may we speak loftily in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: pra tu drava pari kośaṃ ni ṣīda nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vājam arṣa /
analyzed: pra tu drava pari kośam ni sīda nṛbhiḥ punānaḥ abhi vājam arṣa
translated: Rush forward, sit in the vat, being purified by the men, flow on to the booty.

original: aśvaṃ na tvā vājinam marjayanto 'cchā barhī raśanābhir nayanti //
analyzed: aśvam na tvā vājinam marjayantaḥ u chā barhī raśanābhiḥ nayanti
translated: They lead thee on, O strong one, as they adorn thee, the horse, with reins, to the place of the sacrifice.

original: svāyudhaḥ pavate deva indur aśastihā vṛjanaṃ rakṣamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: su āyudhaḥ pavate devaḥ induḥ aśasti hā vṛjanam rakṣamāṇaḥ
translated: The god Indu flows on, well-weaponed, protecting the people, slaying the reviler.

original: pitā devānāṃ janitā sudakṣo viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ //
analyzed: pitā devānām janitā su dakṣaḥ viṣṭambhaḥ divaḥ dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The father of the gods, the creator, of good skill, the supporter of the sky, the prop of the earth.

original: ṛṣir vipraḥ puraetā janānām ṛbhur dhīra uśanā kāvyena /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ vipraḥ puraetā janānām ṛbhuḥ dhīraḥ uśanā kāvyena
translated: The seer, the priest, the leader of the people, the R̥ibhu, the wise, Uśanâ by his wisdom.

original: sa cid viveda nihitaṃ yad āsām apīcyaṃ guhyaṃ nāma gonām //
analyzed: sa cit viveda nihitam yat āsām apīcyam guhyam nāma gonām
translated: He even hath discovered the hidden, wonderful name of these, the cows.

original: eṣa sya te madhumāṃ indra somo vṛṣā vṛṣṇe pari pavitre akṣāḥ /
analyzed: eṣa sya te madhumān indra somaḥ vṛṣā vṛṣṇe pari pavitre akṣāḥ
translated: This Soma of thine, O Indra, is full of sweetness, the bull for the bull, it hath flowed into the purifying sieve.

original: sahasrasāḥ śatasā bhūridāvā śaśvattamam barhir ā vājy asthāt //
analyzed: sahasra sāḥ śata sāḥ bhūri dāvā śaśvattamam barhiḥ ā vājī asthāt
translated: The bountiful one, winning a thousand, a hundred, hath sat down on the grass, the most enduring, as a prize.

original: ete somā abhi gavyā sahasrā mahe vājāyāmṛtāya śravāṃsi /
analyzed: ete somāḥ abhi gavyā sahasrā mahe vājāya amṛtāya śravāṃsi
translated: These Somas, for great strength, for immortality, have sent forth their voices, their glories, in thousands.

original: pavitrebhiḥ pavamānā asṛgrañ chravasyavo na pṛtanājo atyāḥ //
analyzed: pavitrebhiḥ pavamānāḥ asṛgram śravasyavaḥ na pṛtanājaḥ atyāḥ
translated: The purifiers have been poured forth with the purifying vessels, the glories, the racers in the race.

original: pari hi ṣmā puruhūto janānāṃ viśvāsarad bhojanā pūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: pari hi sma puruhūtaḥ janānām bhojanā pūyamānaḥ
translated: For he, much invoked, has surrounded the people, the all-supporting one, while being purified.

original: athā bhara śyenabhṛta prayāṃsi rayiṃ tuñjāno abhi vājam arṣa //
analyzed: athā bhara śyena bhṛta prayāṃsi rayim tuñjānaḥ abhi vājam arṣa
translated: Then, O bearer of the swift one, bring the offerings, and, urging wealth, flow on to the prize.

original: eṣa suvānaḥ pari somaḥ pavitre sargo na sṛṣṭo adadhāvad arvā /🔽tigme śiśāno mahiṣo na śṛṅge gā gavyann abhi śūro na satvā //
analyzed: eṣa suvānaḥ pari somaḥ pavitre sargaḥ na sṛṣṭaḥ adadhāvat arvā  tigme śiśānaḥ mahiṣaḥ na śṛṅge gāḥ gavyan abhi śūraḥ na satvā
translated: This Soma, being pressed, has flowed around the purifying filter, like a created creation, moving forward.🔽Sharpening himself, like a mighty bull his horns, the hero, like a warrior seeking cattle,

original: eṣā yayau paramād antar adreḥ kūcit satīr ūrve gā viveda /🔽divo na vidyut stanayanty abhraiḥ somasya te pavata indra dhārā //
analyzed: eṣā yayau paramāt antar adreḥ kūcid satīḥ ūrve gāḥ viveda  divaḥ na vidyut stanayantī abhraiḥ somasya te pavate indra dhārā
translated: This one has gone from the highest point of the mountain, and has found the cows hidden in the two thighs.🔽Like lightning from the sky thunders with the clouds. O Indra, this is the stream of Soma being purified for you.

original: uta sma rāśim pari yāsi gonām indreṇa soma saratham punānaḥ /
analyzed: uta sma rāśim pari yāsi gonām indreṇa soma sa ratham punānaḥ
translated: And, O Soma, being purified, you go around the herd of cows together with Indra in the same chariot.

original: pūrvīr iṣo bṛhatīr jīradāno śikṣā śacīvas tava tā upaṣṭut //🔽ayaṃ soma indra tubhyaṃ sunve tubhyam pavate tvam asya pāhi /
analyzed: pūrvīḥ iṣaḥ bṛhatīḥ jīra dāno śikṣa śacīvas tava tāḥ upaṣṭut  ayam somaḥ indra tubhyam sunve tubhyam pavate tvam asya pāhi
translated: O giver of abundant food, you have attained the many great gifts, O you who are powerful. These are praised by you.🔽This Soma, O Indra, is being pressed for you. It is being purified for you. You must protect it.

original: tvaṃ ha yaṃ cakṛṣe tvaṃ vavṛṣa indum madāya yujyāya somam //
analyzed: tvam ha yam cakṛṣe tvam vavṛṣe indum madāya yujyāya somam
translated: You, indeed, whom you have made, you have made to rain, the moon for joy, the Soma for yoking.

original: sa īṃ ratho na bhuriṣāḷ ayoji mahaḥ purūṇi sātaye vasūni /
analyzed: saḥ īm rathaḥ na bhuriṣāh ayoji mahaḥ purūṇi sātaye vasūni
translated: He has been yoked like a chariot for many things, for the sake of great wealth.

original: ād īṃ viśvā nahuṣyāṇi jātā svarṣātā vana ūrdhvā navanta //
analyzed: āt īm viśvā nahuṣyāṇi jātā svarṣātā vane ūrdhvāḥ navanta
translated: I praise the one who has conquered all human powers, who shines alone, who is self-luminous, who is lofty like a tree.

original: vāyur na yo niyutvāṃ iṣṭayāmā nāsatyeva hava ā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: vāyuḥ na yaḥ niyutvān iṣṭa yāmā nāsatyā iva have ā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ
translated: Like Vayu, the lord of the Maruts, you are to be worshipped with oblations. Like the two Asvins, you are the most auspicious in the invocation.

original: viśvavāro draviṇodā iva tman pūṣeva dhījavano 'si soma //
analyzed: viśva vāraḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ iva tman pūṣā iva dhī javanaḥ si soma
translated: Like a giver of wealth, you are the bestower of all boons. Like Pushan, you are the inspirer of thoughts, O Soma.

original: indro na yo mahā karmāṇi cakrir hantā vṛtrāṇām asi soma pūrbhit /
analyzed: indraḥ na yaḥ mahā karmāṇi cakriḥ hantā vṛtrāṇām asi soma pūḥ bhid
translated: Like Indra, you are the performer of great deeds. You are the destroyer of enemies, O Soma, the fulfiller of desires.

original: paidvo na hi tvam ahināmnāṃ hantā viśvasyāsi soma dasyoḥ //
analyzed: paidvaḥ na hi tvam ahi nāmnām hantā viśvasya asi soma dasyoḥ
translated: Like the son of Paira, you are the slayer of the Ahi race. You are the destroyer of all the dasyus, O Soma.

original: agnir na yo vana ā sṛjyamāno vṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣu /
analyzed: agniḥ na yaḥ vane ā sṛjyamānaḥ vṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣu
translated: Like Agni, you are released in the forest. You spread your rays in the rivers.

original: jano na yudhvā mahata upabdir iyarti somaḥ pavamāna ūrmim //
analyzed: janaḥ na yudhvā mahataḥ upabdiḥ iyarti somaḥ pavamānaḥ ūrmim
translated: Like a warrior in battle, you make a great noise. Soma Pavamana moves with a wave.

original: ete somā ati vārāṇy avyā divyā na kośāso abhravarṣāḥ /🔽vṛthā samudraṃ sindhavo na nīcīḥ sutāso abhi kalaśāṃ asṛgran //
analyzed: ete somāḥ ati vārāṇi avyā divyāḥ na kośāsaḥ abhra varṣāḥ  vṛthā samudram sindhavaḥ na nīcīḥ sutāsaḥ abhi kalaśām asṛgran
translated: These Somas have passed through the woolen filters, like the heavenly reservoirs of rain clouds.🔽Like rivers flowing to the ocean, the pressed juices have been poured into the jars.

original: śuṣmī śardho na mārutam pavasvānabhiśastā divyā yathā viṭ /
analyzed: śuṣmī śardhaḥ na mārutam pavasva an abhiśastā divyā yathā viś
translated: Flow on, O strong one, like the Marut host, purified, as directed, like the heavenly people.

original: āpo na makṣū sumatir bhavā naḥ sahasrāpsāḥ pṛtanāṣāṇ na yajñaḥ //
analyzed: āpaḥ na makṣū sumatiḥ bhava naḥ sahasra apsāḥ pṛtanāṣāh na yajñaḥ
translated: Like the waters, may your favor be swift for us, like the sacrifice with a thousand rewards, seeking the prize.

original: rājño nu te varuṇasya vratāni bṛhad gabhīraṃ tava soma dhāma /
analyzed: rājñaḥ nu te varuṇasya vratāni bṛhat gabhīram tava soma dhāma
translated: O King, are these the vows of Varuna? O Soma, your abode is vast and deep.

original: śuciṣ ṭvam asi priyo na mitro dakṣāyyo aryamevāsi soma //
analyzed: śuciḥ tvam asi priyaḥ na mitraḥ dakṣāyyaḥ aryamā iva asi soma
translated: You are pure, dear as a friend, more useful than Aryaman, you are Soma.

original: pro sya vahniḥ pathyābhir asyān divo na vṛṣṭiḥ pavamāno akṣāḥ /
analyzed: pra u sya vahniḥ pathyābhiḥ asyān divaḥ na vṛṣṭiḥ pavamānaḥ akṣār
translated: Let his fire go forth with the paths of this (earth), let the rain of heaven, let Pavamana go forth.

original: sahasradhāro asadan ny asme mātur upasthe vana ā ca somaḥ //
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ asadat ni asme mātuḥ upasthe vane ā ca somaḥ
translated: The one with a thousand streams has sat down for us in the lap of the mother, in the wood, and Soma.

original: rājā sindhūnām avasiṣṭa vāsa ṛtasya nāvam āruhad rajiṣṭhām /
analyzed: rājā sindhūnām avasiṣṭa vāsaḥ ṛtasya nāvam āruhat rajiṣṭhām
translated: The king has dwelt in the garments of the rivers, he has mounted the boat of truth, the most excellent.

original: apsu drapso vāvṛdhe śyenajūto duha īm pitā duha īm pitur jām //
analyzed: apsu drapsaḥ vāvṛdhe śyena jūtaḥ duhe īm pitā duhe īm pituḥ jām
translated: The drop has grown in the waters, urged on by the falcon. He milks him, the father, he milks him, the son's son.

original: siṃhaṃ nasanta madhvo ayāsaṃ harim aruṣaṃ divo asya patim /
analyzed: siṃham nasanta madhvaḥ ayāsam harim aruṣam divaḥ asya patim
translated: They make him a lion, the swift one of the sweet (drink), the tawny one, the red one, the lord of heaven.

original: śūro yutsu prathamaḥ pṛcchate gā asya cakṣasā pari pāty ukṣā //
analyzed: śūraḥ yutsu prathamaḥ pṛcchate gāḥ asya cakṣasā pari pāti ukṣā
translated: The hero, the first in battle, asks for the cows. The bull protects them with his eye.

original: madhupṛṣṭhaṃ ghoram ayāsam aśvaṃ rathe yuñjanty urucakra ṛṣvam /
analyzed: madhu pṛṣṭham ghoram ayāsam aśvam rathe yuñjanti uru cakre ṛṣvam
translated: They yoke to the chariot the horse with a back like honey, the terrible one, the swift one, the tawny one with large wheels.

original: svasāra īṃ jāmayo marjayanti sanābhayo vājinam ūrjayanti //
analyzed: svasāraḥ īm jāmayaḥ marjayanti sanābhayaḥ vājinam ūrjayanti
translated: His sisters, his cousins, make him shine; his uterine brothers make strong the strong one.

original: catasra īṃ ghṛtaduhaḥ sacante samāne antar dharuṇe niṣattāḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ īm ghṛta duhaḥ sacante samāne antar dharuṇe niṣattāḥ
translated: Four milk him, yielding ghee, sitting together in the same receptacle.

original: tā īm arṣanti namasā punānās tā īṃ viśvataḥ pari ṣanti pūrvīḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ īm arṣanti namasā punānāḥ tāḥ īm viśvatas pari santi pūrvīḥ
translated: They flow to him, purified with reverence, they, the many, come to him from all sides.

original: viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyā viśvā uta kṣitayo haste asya /
analyzed: viṣṭambhaḥ divaḥ dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ viśvāḥ uta kṣitayaḥ haste asya
translated: The supporter of the sky, the prop of the earth, and in his hand all the regions (of the world).

original: asat ta utso gṛṇate niyutvān madhvo aṃśuḥ pavata indriyāya //
analyzed: asat te utsaḥ gṛṇate niyutvān madhvaḥ aṃśuḥ pavate indriyāya
translated: The well, with the team, is for the singer, the stalk of the sweet (Soma) flows for power.

original: vanvann avāto abhi devavītim indrāya soma vṛtrahā pavasva /
analyzed: vanvan a vātaḥ abhi deva vītim indrāya soma vṛtra hā pavasva
translated: Flowing, free from guile, to the feast of the gods, O Soma, flow for Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: śagdhi mahaḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma //🔽pra hinvāno janitā rodasyo ratho na vājaṃ saniṣyann ayāsīt /
analyzed: śagdhi mahaḥ puru ścandrasya rāyaḥ su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma  pra hinvānaḥ janitā rodasyaḥ rathaḥ na vājam saniṣyan ayāsīt
translated: Be thou able to give the great wealth of the very glorious one: may we be lords of brave sons and riches.🔽The impeller, the creator of earth and heaven, like a chariot, hath gone forth, fain to win strength.

original: indraṃ gacchann āyudhā saṃśiśāno viśvā vasu hastayor ādadhānaḥ //
analyzed: indram gacchan āyudhā saṃśiśānaḥ viśvā vasu hastayoḥ ādadhānaḥ
translated: Going to Indra, sharpening his weapons, placing in his hands all treasures.

original: abhi tripṛṣṭhaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vayodhām āṅgūṣāṇām avāvaśanta vāṇīḥ /
analyzed: abhi tri pṛṣṭham vṛṣaṇam vayodhām āṅgūṣāṇām avāvaśanta vāṇīḥ
translated: The songs of the bards have sung to the three-backed, the mighty, the life-bestower.

original: vanā vasāno varuṇo na sindhūn vi ratnadhā dayate vāryāṇi //🔽śūragrāmaḥ sarvavīraḥ sahāvāñ jetā pavasva sanitā dhanāni /
analyzed: vanā vasānaḥ varuṇaḥ na sindhūn vi ratna dhāḥ dayate vāryāṇi  śūra grāmaḥ sarva vīraḥ saha āvām jetā pavasva sanitā dhanāni
translated: Wearing the woods, like Varuna the rivers, he distributes treasures, the good things (of life).🔽Flow on, victorious, with all thy heroes, conquering the strongholds, winning the booty.

original: tigmāyudhaḥ kṣipradhanvā samatsv aṣāḷhaḥ sāhvān pṛtanāsu śatrūn //
analyzed: tigma āyudhaḥ kṣipra dhanvā samatsu aṣāḷhaḥ sāhvān pṛtanāsu śatrūn
translated: With keen weapons, a swift bow in battles, invincible, challenging the foes in the contests.

original: urugavyūtir abhayāni kṛṇvan samīcīne ā pavasvā purandhī /
analyzed: uru gavyūtiḥ abhayāni kṛṇvan samīcīne ā pavasva purandhī
translated: Making wide shelter and security, pour on us, O thou of far-reaching help, O thou who givest light, with those that move in unison.

original: apaḥ siṣāsann uṣasaḥ svar gāḥ saṃ cikrado maho asmabhyaṃ vājān //
analyzed: apaḥ siṣāsan uṣasaḥ svar gāḥ sam cikradaḥ mahaḥ asmabhyam vājān
translated: Desiring the waters, the dawns, the light, and the great prizes, roar for us.

original: matsi soma varuṇam matsi mitram matsīndram indo pavamāna viṣṇum /
analyzed: matsi soma varuṇam matsi mitram matsi indram indo pavamāna viṣṇum
translated: Thou rejoicest, O Soma, thou rejoicest Varuna, thou rejoicest Mitra, thou rejoicest Indra, O Indu Pavamana, thou rejoicest Vishnu.

original: matsi śardho mārutam matsi devān matsi mahām indram indo madāya //
analyzed: matsi śardhaḥ mārutam matsi devān matsi mahām indram indo madāya
translated: Thou rejoicest the Marut host, thou rejoicest the gods, thou rejoicest the great Indra, O Indu, for the rapture.

original: evā rājeva kratumāṃ amena viśvā ghanighnad duritā pavasva /
analyzed: eva rājā iva kratumān amena viśvā ghanighnat duritā pavasva
translated: So, like a king full of wisdom, crush all our troubles, O thou who art to be cleansed. Pour on us.

original: indo sūktāya vacase vayo dhā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: indo sūktāya vacase vayaḥ dhāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: O Indu, for the hymn and the song, give life. Do ye, O ye who are to be cleansed, protect us evermore with your favours.

original: asarji vakvā rathye yathājau dhiyā manotā prathamo manīṣī /
analyzed: asarji vakvā rathye yathā ājau dhiyā manotā prathamaḥ manīṣī
translated: The swift one has been sent forth, like a charioteer to the battle, by the thought, the first, the wise one, the one to be invoked.

original: daśa svasāro adhi sāno avye 'janti vahniṃ sadanāny accha //
analyzed: daśa svasāraḥ adhi sāno avye janti vahnim sadanāni accha
translated: The ten sisters on the uneven ridge of the sky go to the abode of the carrier.

original: vītī janasya divyasya kavyair adhi suvāno nahuṣyebhir induḥ /
analyzed: vītī janasya divyasya kavyaiḥ adhi suvānaḥ nahuṣyebhiḥ induḥ
translated: The Indu, being pressed, with the divine people's sacred food and the Nahushas,

original: pra yo nṛbhir amṛto martyebhir marmṛjāno 'vibhir gobhir adbhiḥ //
analyzed: pra yaḥ nṛbhiḥ amṛtaḥ martyebhiḥ marmṛjānaḥ vibhiḥ gobhiḥ adbhiḥ
translated: The immortal one, with the men, with the mortals, being anointed with the limbs, with the cows, with the waters.

original: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe roruvad aṃśur asmai pavamāno ruśad īrte payo goḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe roruvat aṃśuḥ asmai pavamānaḥ ruśat īrte payaḥ goḥ
translated: The bull, the strong one, the roaring one, the shoot for this one, Pavamana, leads the milk of the cow, the red one.

original: sahasram ṛkvā pathibhir vacovid adhvasmabhiḥ sūro aṇvaṃ vi yāti //
analyzed: sahasram ṛkvā pathibhiḥ vacaḥ vid adhvasmabhiḥ sūraḥ aṇvam vi yāti
translated: The singer, knowing speech, with a thousand paths, on his way, goes to the sun, to his home.

original: rujā dṛḷhā cid rakṣasaḥ sadāṃsi punāna inda ūrṇuhi vi vājān /
analyzed: rujā dṛḍhā cit rakṣasaḥ sadāṃsi punānaḥ indo ūrṇuhi vi vājān
translated: O Indra, purifying, break through the firm strongholds of the Raksases and win the treasures.

original: vṛścopariṣṭāt tujatā vadhena ye anti dūrād upanāyam eṣām //
analyzed: vṛśca upariṣṭāt tujatā vadhena ye anti dūrāt upanāyam eṣām
translated: With your sharp weapon, from above, from afar, destroy those who approach to harm them.

original: sa pratnavan navyase viśvavāra sūktāya pathaḥ kṛṇuhi prācaḥ /
analyzed: sa pratna vat navyase viśva vāra sūktāya pathaḥ kṛṇuhi prācaḥ
translated: Make the paths go forward, as of old, for the new praise, O you who give all boons.

original: ye duḥṣahāso vanuṣā bṛhantas tāṃs te aśyāma purukṛt purukṣo //
analyzed: ye duḥṣahāsaḥ vanuṣā bṛhantaḥ tān te aśyāma puru kṛt purukṣo
translated: May we obtain those, O you of much wealth, who are difficult to conquer, who are great in their desire.

original: evā punāno apaḥ svar gā asmabhyaṃ tokā tanayāni bhūri /
analyzed: eva punānaḥ apaḥ svar gāḥ asmabhyam tokā tanayāni bhūri
translated: Thus, purifying, go to the waters, to heaven, give us abundant offspring and progeny.

original: śaṃ naḥ kṣetram uru jyotīṃṣi soma jyoṅ naḥ sūryaṃ dṛśaye rirīhi //
analyzed: śam naḥ kṣetram uru jyotīṃṣi soma jyok naḥ sūryam dṛśaye rirīhi
translated: Make our field prosperous, O Soma, make the lights shine for us, make the sun visible to us.

original: pari suvāno harir aṃśuḥ pavitre ratho na sarji sanaye hiyānaḥ /
analyzed: pari suvānaḥ hariḥ aṃśuḥ pavitre rathaḥ na sarji sanaye hiyānaḥ
translated: The tawny drop, being pressed, flows around in the filter, like a chariot being sent forth for victory.

original: āpac chlokam indriyam pūyamānaḥ prati devāṃ ajuṣata prayobhiḥ //
analyzed: āpat ślokam indriyam pūyamānaḥ prati devām ajuṣata prayobhiḥ
translated: Purifying, it brings the song and power, and delights the gods with its offerings.

original: acchā nṛcakṣā asarat pavitre nāma dadhānaḥ kavir asya yonau /
analyzed: acchā nṛ cakṣāḥ asarat pavitre nāma dadhānaḥ kaviḥ asya yonau
translated: Looking on men, it has gone to the filter, bearing its name, the wise one in its birthplace.

original: sīdan hoteva sadane camūṣūpem agmann ṛṣayaḥ sapta viprāḥ //
analyzed: sīdan hotā iva sadane camūṣu upa īm agman ṛṣayaḥ sapta viprāḥ
