translated: The seven sages, the inspired ones, have come to it, as to a seat, to the vessel, sitting as a priest.

original: pra sumedhā gātuvid viśvadevaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ sada eti nityam /
analyzed: pra sumedhāḥ gātu vid viśva devaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ sadaḥ eti nityam
translated: The very wise Soma, who finds the way, who belongs to all the gods, being purified, comes to the seat, ever present.

original: bhuvad viśveṣu kāvyeṣu rantānu janān yatate pañca dhīraḥ //
analyzed: bhuvat viśveṣu kāvyeṣu rantā anu janān yatate pañca dhīraḥ
translated: He has become the enjoyer of all the poetic compositions; the wise one strives to reach the five peoples.

original: tava tye soma pavamāna niṇye viśve devās traya ekādaśāsaḥ /
analyzed: tava tye soma pavamāna niṇye viśve devāḥ trayaḥ ekādaśāsaḥ
translated: These, O Soma Pavamâna, are thy stations, where all the gods, the thirty-one, are present.

original: daśa svadhābhir adhi sāno avye mṛjanti tvā nadyaḥ sapta yahvīḥ //
analyzed: daśa svadhābhiḥ adhi sāno avye mṛjanti tvā nadyaḥ sapta yahvīḥ
translated: On the back of the cloud, with ten powers, the seven young rivers cleanse thee.

original: tan nu satyam pavamānasyāstu yatra viśve kāravaḥ saṃnasanta /
analyzed: tat nu satyam pavamānasya astu yatra viśve kāravaḥ saṃnasanta
translated: This is the truth of Pavamâna, where all the craftsmen are assembled.

original: jyotir yad ahne akṛṇod u lokam prāvan manuṃ dasyave kar abhīkam //
analyzed: jyotiḥ yat ahne akṛṇot u lokam prāvat manum dasyave kaḥ abhīkam
translated: The light which he has made for the day, he has given Manu a fearful deed to the Dasyu.

original: pari sadmeva paśumānti hotā rājā na satyaḥ samitīr iyānaḥ /
analyzed: pari sadmā iva paśumānti hotā rājā na satyaḥ samitīḥ iyānaḥ
translated: The priest is surrounded like a dwelling by the wealthy, the true king, going to the assemblies.

original: somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśāṃ ayāsīt sīdan mṛgo na mahiṣo vaneṣu //
analyzed: somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśān ayāsīt sīdan mṛgaḥ na mahiṣaḥ vaneṣu
translated: Soma, being purified, has gone to the jars, like a deer lying down in the woods, a mighty bull.

original: sākamukṣo marjayanta svasāro daśa dhīrasya dhītayo dhanutrīḥ /🔽hariḥ pary adravaj jāḥ sūryasya droṇaṃ nanakṣe atyo na vājī //
analyzed: sākamukṣaḥ marjayanta svasāraḥ daśa dhīrasya dhītayaḥ dhanutrīḥ  hariḥ pari adravat jāḥ sūryasya droṇam nanakṣe atyaḥ na vājī
translated: The sisters who pour together are cleansing the ten wise thoughts of the wise one, the victorious.🔽The tawny one has run around the offspring of the sun; the swift one has plunged into the trough, like a strong horse.

original: sam mātṛbhir na śiśur vāvaśāno vṛṣā dadhanve puruvāro adbhiḥ /
analyzed: sam mātṛbhiḥ na śiśuḥ vāvaśānaḥ vṛṣā dadhanve puru vāraḥ adbhiḥ
translated: The youngling, lowing like a calf to its mother, the bull, the giver of much, rushes with the waters.

original: maryo na yoṣām abhi niṣkṛtaṃ yan saṃ gacchate kalaśa usriyābhiḥ //
analyzed: maryaḥ na yoṣām abhi niṣkṛtam yan sam gacchate kalaśe usriyābhiḥ
translated: As a man to a maiden, when he goes to the appointed place, so he goes to the trough with the milch-kine.

original: uta pra pipya ūdhar aghnyāyā indur dhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ /
analyzed: uta pra pipye ūdhar aghnyāyāḥ induḥ dhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ
translated: And the wise Indu, with the streams, swells the udder of the harmless cow.

original: mūrdhānaṃ gāvaḥ payasā camūṣv abhi śrīṇanti vasubhir na niktaiḥ //🔽sa no devebhiḥ pavamāna radendo rayim aśvinaṃ vāvaśānaḥ /
analyzed: mūrdhānam gāvaḥ payasā camūṣu abhi śrīṇanti vasubhiḥ na niktaiḥ  sa naḥ devebhiḥ pavamāna rada indoḥ rayim aśvinam vāvaśānaḥ
translated: The cows fill the head with milk in the ladles, as with unwashed (utensils).🔽Do thou, O Pavamâna, with the gods, O Indu, longing for it, send us riches in horses.

original: rathirāyatām uśatī purandhir asmadryag ā dāvane vasūnām //
analyzed: rathirāyatām uśatī purandhiḥ asmadryak ā dāvane vasūnām
translated: Let the eager one, the bountiful, extend the chariot-path to us, to bestow on us treasures.

original: nū no rayim upa māsva nṛvantam punāno vātāpyaṃ viśvaścandram /
analyzed: nu naḥ rayim upa māsva nṛvantam punānaḥ vātāpyam viśva ścandram
translated: Now, being purified, do thou bestow on us wealth which shall be full of men, which shall be dear to Vâta, and which shall be all-delightful.

original: pra vanditur indo tāry āyuḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt //
analyzed: pra vandituḥ indo tāri āyuḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
translated: O Indu, let the worshipper's life be prolonged, and let him come in the morning with wealth in his thought.

original: adhi yad asmin vājinīva śubha spardhante dhiyaḥ sūrye na viśaḥ /
analyzed: adhi yat asmin vājinī iva śubhe spardhante dhiyaḥ sūrye na viśaḥ
translated: When in this (steed) like a noble lady, the thoughts contend, as the clans (compete) for the sun,

original: apo vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyan vrajaṃ na paśuvardhanāya manma //
analyzed: apaḥ vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyan vrajam na paśu vardhanāya manma
translated: Selecting the waters, he flows on, most wise, for the hymn, as 'twere, to increase the herd of cattle.

original: dvitā vyūrṇvann amṛtasya dhāma svarvide bhuvanāni prathanta /
analyzed: dvitā vyūrṇvan amṛtasya dhāma svarvide bhuvanāni prathanta
translated: Stretching out the two worlds, he who unfolds the abode of immortality, finds the light.

original: dhiyaḥ pinvānāḥ svasare na gāva ṛtāyantīr abhi vāvaśra indum //
analyzed: dhiyaḥ pinvānāḥ svasare na gāvaḥ ṛtāyantīḥ abhi vāvaśre indum
translated: The thoughts, swelling in the sister, like cows, striving for the truth, low to the Indu.

original: pari yat kaviḥ kāvyā bharate śūro na ratho bhuvanāni viśvā /🔽deveṣu yaśo martāya bhūṣan dakṣāya rāyaḥ purubhūṣu navyaḥ //
analyzed: pari yat kaviḥ kāvyā bharate śūraḥ na rathaḥ bhuvanāni viśvā  deveṣu yaśaḥ martāya bhūṣan dakṣāya rāyaḥ puru bhūṣu navyaḥ
translated: When the wise one bears his thoughts, like a strong chariot through all the worlds,🔽Gaining glory among the gods for the mortal, bestowing wealth on the skillful, ever new.

original: śriye jātaḥ śriya ā nir iyāya śriyaṃ vayo jaritṛbhyo dadhāti /
analyzed: śriye jātaḥ śriye ā niḥ iyāya śriyam vayaḥ jaritṛbhyaḥ dadhāti
translated: Born for glory, he goes forth to glory; he bestows glory and strength upon the worshippers.

original: śriyaṃ vasānā amṛtatvam āyan bhavanti satyā samithā mitadrau //
analyzed: śriyam vasānāḥ amṛta tvam āyan bhavanti satyā samithā mitadrau
translated: Clad in glory, they have attained immortality; they become true, O you of measured wealth, in the assemblies.

original: iṣam ūrjam abhy arṣāśvaṃ gām uru jyotiḥ kṛṇuhi matsi devān /
analyzed: iṣam ūrjam abhi arṣa aśvam gām uru jyotiḥ kṛṇuhi matsi devān
translated: Flow on to food and strength, to the horse, to the cow; make wide light; delight the gods.

original: viśvāni hi suṣahā tāni tubhyam pavamāna bādhase soma śatrūn //
analyzed: viśvāni hi suṣahā tāni tubhyam pavamāna bādhase soma śatrūn
translated: For all these easy tasks are yours, O Soma Pavamâna; thou drivest off the foes.

original: kanikranti harir ā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdan vanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ /
analyzed: kanikranti hariḥ ā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdan vanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ
translated: The tawny one neighs when let loose, sitting in the belly of the wood, being purified.

original: nṛbhir yataḥ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ gā ato matīr janayata svadhābhiḥ //
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ yataḥ kṛṇute nirṇijam gāḥ atas matīḥ janayata svadhābhiḥ
translated: When urged by men, he makes the cleansing sieve; from that he produces thoughts by his own powers.

original: hariḥ sṛjānaḥ pathyām ṛtasyeyarti vācam ariteva nāvam /
analyzed: hariḥ sṛjānaḥ pathyām ṛtasya iyarti vācam aritā iva nāvam
translated: The tawny one, spreading out the path of holy order, moves the speech, as 'twere a boat in the water.

original: devo devānāṃ guhyāni nāmāviṣ kṛṇoti barhiṣi pravāce //
analyzed: devaḥ devānām guhyāni nāma āvis kṛṇoti barhiṣi pravāce
translated: The god reveals the secret names of the gods on the sacrificial grass, in the proclamation.

original: apām ived ūrmayas tarturāṇāḥ pra manīṣā īrate somam accha /
analyzed: apām iva id ūrmayaḥ tarturāṇāḥ pra manīṣāḥ īrate somam accha
translated: Like the waves of the waters, striving to cross, the thoughts move forth to Soma.

original: namasyantīr upa ca yanti saṃ cā ca viśanty uśatīr uśantam //
analyzed: namasyantīḥ upa ca yanti sam ca ā ca viśanti uśatīḥ uśantam
translated: And they, the loving ones, approach and enter him who is to be loved.

original: tam marmṛjānam mahiṣaṃ na sānāv aṃśuṃ duhanty ukṣaṇaṃ giriṣṭhām /
analyzed: tam marmṛjānam mahiṣam na sānau aṃśum duhanti ukṣaṇam giriṣṭhām
translated: They milk the stalk, the bull, as he is being anointed, the stalk that stands on the mountain, the bull.

original: taṃ vāvaśānam matayaḥ sacante trito bibharti varuṇaṃ samudre //🔽iṣyan vācam upavakteva hotuḥ punāna indo vi ṣyā manīṣām /
analyzed: tam vāvaśānam matayaḥ sacante tritaḥ bibharti varuṇam samudre  iṣyan vācam upavaktā iva hotuḥ punānaḥ indo vi sya manīṣām
translated: The thoughts attend on him who is eager; Trita bears Varuna in the ocean.🔽Desiring to utter speech, as it were, before the Hotar, purifying, O Indu, expand the thought.

original: indraś ca yat kṣayathaḥ saubhagāya suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma //
analyzed: indraḥ ca yat kṣayathaḥ saubhagāya su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma
translated: And when Indra and thou rejoice for good fortune, may we be lords of good heroism.

original: pra senānīḥ śūro agre rathānāṃ gavyann eti harṣate asya senā /
analyzed: pra senā nīḥ śūraḥ agre rathānām gavyan eti harṣate asya senā
translated: The hero, the general, goes in front of the chariots, he who wins the cattle, his army is delighted.

original: bhadrān kṛṇvann indrahavān sakhibhya ā somo vastrā rabhasāni datte //
analyzed: bhadrān kṛṇvan indra havān sakhibhyaḥ ā somaḥ vastrā rabhasāni datte
translated: Making the auspicious calls to Indra for his friends, Soma gives out the garments and the swift ones.

original: sam asya hariṃ harayo mṛjanty aśvahayair aniśitaṃ namobhiḥ /
analyzed: sam asya harim harayaḥ mṛjanti aśva hayaiḥ aniśitam namobhiḥ
translated: His tawny (horses) anoint his tawny (steed), the sharp one with the Namoci mantras, with the horse and the steed.

original: ā tiṣṭhati ratham indrasya sakhā vidvāṃ enā sumatiṃ yāty accha //
analyzed: ā tiṣṭhati ratham indrasya sakhā vidvān enā sumatim yāti accha
translated: The friend of Indra mounts the chariot, the wise one goes to the good will of the two.

original: sa no deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarasa indrapānaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarase indra pānaḥ
translated: Flow on for us, O god, to the godhead, O great Soma, as a drink for Indra, O drink for Indra.

original: kṛṇvann apo varṣayan dyām utemām uror ā no varivasyā punānaḥ //
analyzed: kṛṇvan apaḥ varṣayan dyām uta imām uroḥ ā naḥ varivasyā punānaḥ
translated: Making the waters rain, and this sky, favouring us from the breast, O purifier.

original: ajītaye 'hataye pavasva svastaye sarvatātaye bṛhate /
analyzed: ajītaye hataye pavasva svastaye sarvatātaye bṛhate
translated: Flow for victory, for the unconquered, for well-being, for all-embracing greatness.

original: tad uśanti viśva ime sakhāyas tad ahaṃ vaśmi pavamāna soma //
analyzed: tat uśanti viśve ime sakhāyaḥ tat aham vaśmi pavamāna soma
translated: This is what all these friends desire, and this I ask of you, O Soma Pavamana.

original: somaḥ pavate janitā matīnāṃ janitā divo janitā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ pavate janitā matīnām janitā divaḥ janitā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Soma flows, the begetter of thoughts, the begetter of heaven, the begetter of earth.

original: janitāgner janitā sūryasya janitendrasya janitota viṣṇoḥ //
analyzed: janitā agneḥ janitā sūryasya janitā indrasya janitā uta viṣṇoḥ
translated: The begetter of Agni, the begetter of the sun, the begetter of Indra, and the begetter of Vishnu.

original: brahmā devānām padavīḥ kavīnām ṛṣir viprāṇām mahiṣo mṛgāṇām /
analyzed: brahmā devānām padavīḥ kavīnām ṛṣiḥ viprāṇām mahiṣaḥ mṛgāṇām
translated: Brahman of the gods, the path of the sages, the seer of the seers, the bull of the beasts,

original: śyeno gṛdhrāṇāṃ svadhitir vanānāṃ somaḥ pavitram aty eti rebhan //
analyzed: śyenaḥ gṛdhrāṇām svadhitiḥ vanānām somaḥ pavitram ati eti rebhan
translated: the eagle of the eagles, the axe of the woods, Soma flows, singing, over the purifying sieve.

original: prāvīvipad vāca ūrmiṃ na sindhur giraḥ somaḥ pavamāno manīṣāḥ /
analyzed: prāvīvipat vācaḥ ūrmim na sindhuḥ giraḥ somaḥ pavamānaḥ manīṣāḥ
translated: Soma Pavamana has sent forth a wave of speech like a river, and songs of praise,

original: antaḥ paśyan vṛjanemāvarāṇy ā tiṣṭhati vṛṣabho goṣu jānan //
analyzed: antar paśyan vṛjanā imā avarāṇi ā tiṣṭhati vṛṣabhaḥ goṣu jānan
translated: looking within, he stands among the people, the bull knowing among the cows.

original: sa matsaraḥ pṛtsu vanvann avātaḥ sahasraretā abhi vājam arṣa /🔽indrāyendo pavamāno manīṣy aṃśor ūrmim īraya gā iṣaṇyan //
analyzed: sa matsaraḥ pṛtsu vanvan a vātaḥ sahasra retāḥ abhi vājam arṣa  indrāya indo pavamānaḥ manīṣī aṃśoḥ ūrmim īraya gāḥ iṣaṇyan
translated: Joyful, victorious in battles, unvanquished, with a thousand powers, flow forth to strength.🔽O Soma, Pavamana, the wise one, for Indra, send forth a wave of the Amsu, urging the cows.

original: pari priyaḥ kalaśe devavāta indrāya somo raṇyo madāya /
analyzed: pari priyaḥ kalaśe deva vātaḥ indrāya somaḥ raṇyaḥ madāya
translated: The dear one, blowing on the gods, flows around in the jar, Soma for Indra, the gladdening one, for joy.

original: sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja indur vājī na saptiḥ samanā jigāti //
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ śata vājaḥ induḥ vājī na saptiḥ samanā jigāti
translated: The thousand-streamed, hundred-powered Indu, the strong steed, goes straight forward like a charioteer.

original: sa pūrvyo vasuvij jāyamāno mṛjāno apsu duduhāno adrau /
analyzed: sa pūrvyaḥ vasu vid jāyamānaḥ mṛjānaḥ apsu duduhānaḥ adrau
translated: The ancient one, finding wealth, being born, purified in the waters, milked in the mountain,

original: abhiśastipā bhuvanasya rājā vidad gātum brahmaṇe pūyamānaḥ //
analyzed: abhiśasti pāḥ bhuvanasya rājā vidat gātum brahmaṇe pūyamānaḥ
translated: The king of the world, the protector from imprecation, finding a way, being purified for the Brahman,

original: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamāna dhīrāḥ /
analyzed: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamāna dhīrāḥ
translated: For, O Soma, our fathers, O Pavamana, the wise ones performed deeds in the past.

original: vanvann avātaḥ paridhīṃr aporṇu vīrebhir aśvair maghavā bhavā naḥ //🔽yathāpavathā manave vayodhā amitrahā varivovid dhaviṣmān /
analyzed: vanvan a vātaḥ paridhīn aporṇu vīrebhiḥ aśvaiḥ maghavā bhava naḥ  yathā apavathāḥ manave vayaḥ dhāḥ amitra hā varivaḥ vid haviṣmān
translated: Unharmed, unrolling the enclosing sticks, be bountiful to us with heroes and horses.🔽As you, O Pavamana, the bestower of strength to Manu, the slayer of enemies, the finder of room, the possessor of oblations,

original: evā pavasva draviṇaṃ dadhāna indre saṃ tiṣṭha janayāyudhāni //
analyzed: eva pavasva draviṇam dadhānaḥ indre sam tiṣṭha janaya āyudhāni
translated: Thus, O Soma, bestowing wealth, flow on, unite with Indra, generate weapons.

original: pavasva soma madhumāṃ ṛtāvāpo vasāno adhi sāno avye /
analyzed: pavasva soma madhumān ṛtāvāpaḥ vasānaḥ adhi sāno avye
translated: Flow on, O Soma, full of honey, righteous, clothed in the waters on the uneven ridge,

original: ava droṇāni ghṛtavānti sīda madintamo matsara indrapānaḥ //
analyzed: ava droṇāni ghṛtavānti sīda madintamaḥ matsaraḥ indra pānaḥ
translated: Sit in the troughs filled with ghee, most delightful, the gladdener, to be drunk by Indra.

original: vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ śatadhāraḥ pavasva sahasrasā vājayur devavītau /
analyzed: vṛṣṭim divaḥ śata dhāraḥ pavasva sahasra sāḥ vājayuḥ deva vītau
translated: Flow on, O hundred-streamed one, from the sky, with a thousand powers, winning strength, at the feast of the gods,

original: saṃ sindhubhiḥ kalaśe vāvaśānaḥ sam usriyābhiḥ pratiran na āyuḥ //
analyzed: sam sindhubhiḥ kalaśe vāvaśānaḥ sam usriyābhiḥ pratiran naḥ āyuḥ
translated: Roaring in the trough with the rivers, prolonging our life with the cows.

original: eṣa sya somo matibhiḥ punāno 'tyo na vājī taratīd arātīḥ /
analyzed: eṣa sya somaḥ matibhiḥ punānaḥ tyaḥ na vājī tarati id arātīḥ
translated: This Soma, being purified by the thoughts, like a strong horse, overcomes the enemies.

original: payo na dugdham aditer iṣiram urv iva gātuḥ suyamo na voḷhā //
analyzed: payaḥ na dugdham aditeḥ iṣiram uru iva gātuḥ su yamaḥ na voḷhā
translated: Like milk from Aditi, like swift food, like a well-controlled path on a wide plain, O Soma.

original: svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyamāno 'bhy arṣa guhyaṃ cāru nāma /
analyzed: su āyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyamānaḥ bhi arṣa guhyam cāru nāma
translated: Well-weaponed, being purified by the pressers, flow to the secret and beautiful name.

original: abhi vājaṃ saptir iva śravasyābhi vāyum abhi gā deva soma //
analyzed: abhi vājam saptiḥ iva śravasya abhi vāyum abhi gāḥ deva soma
translated: Like a horse striving for booty, strive for strength, for Vayu, for the cows, O divine Soma.

original: śiśuṃ jajñānaṃ haryatam mṛjanti śumbhanti vahnim maruto gaṇena /
analyzed: śiśum jajñānam haryatam mṛjanti śumbhanti vahnim marutaḥ gaṇena
translated: They cleanse the tawny one, the newly-born child, they adorn the carrier with the host of Maruts.

original: kavir gīrbhiḥ kāvyenā kaviḥ san somaḥ pavitram aty eti rebhan //
analyzed: kaviḥ gīrbhiḥ kāvyena kaviḥ san somaḥ pavitram ati eti rebhan
translated: The sage, being a sage with hymns and with poetry, Soma flows over the filter, singing.

original: ṛṣimanā ya ṛṣikṛt svarṣāḥ sahasraṇīthaḥ padavīḥ kavīnām /
analyzed: ṛṣi manāḥ yaḥ ṛṣi kṛt svarṣāḥ sahasraṇīthaḥ padavīḥ kavīnām
translated: He who has the mind of a sage, who makes sages, who has a thousand paths, the paths of the sages,

original: tṛtīyaṃ dhāma mahiṣaḥ siṣāsan somo virājam anu rājati ṣṭup //
analyzed: tṛtīyam dhāma mahiṣaḥ siṣāsan somaḥ virājam anu rājati ṣṭubh
translated: The bull, desiring the third abode, Soma shines after the Viraj, after the Tristubh.

original: camūṣac chyenaḥ śakuno vibhṛtvā govindur drapsa āyudhāni bibhrat /
analyzed: camūṣat śyenaḥ śakunaḥ vibhṛtvā go vinduḥ drapsaḥ āyudhāni bibhrat
translated: The falcon, the bird, carrying in his beak, the drop marked with a cow, bearing weapons,

original: apām ūrmiṃ sacamānaḥ samudraṃ turīyaṃ dhāma mahiṣo vivakti //
analyzed: apām ūrmim sacamānaḥ samudram turīyam dhāma mahiṣaḥ vivakti
translated: Following the wave of the waters, the ocean, the bull proclaims the fourth abode.

original: maryo na śubhras tanvam mṛjāno 'tyo na sṛtvā sanaye dhanānām /
analyzed: maryaḥ na śubhraḥ tanvam mṛjānaḥ tyaḥ na sṛtvā sanaye dhanānām
translated: Like a fair youth anointing his body, like a horse after a race, for the winning of treasures,

original: vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośam arṣan kanikradac camvor ā viveśa //🔽pavasvendo pavamāno mahobhiḥ kanikradat pari vārāṇy arṣa /
analyzed: vṛṣā iva yūthā pari kośam arṣan kanikradat camvoḥ ā viveśa  pavasva indo pavamānaḥ mahobhiḥ kanikradat pari vārāṇi arṣa
translated: Like a bull around the herd, flow to the vat, roaring, thou hast entered the wooden tubs.🔽Flow on, O Indu, purified, with mighty forces, roaring, flow round the strainers.

original: krīḷañ camvor ā viśa pūyamāna indraṃ te raso madiro mamattu //🔽prāsya dhārā bṛhatīr asṛgrann akto gobhiḥ kalaśāṃ ā viveśa /
analyzed: krīḍam camvoḥ ā viśa pūyamānaḥ indram te rasaḥ madiraḥ mamattu  prāsya dhārāḥ bṛhatīḥ asṛgran aktaḥ gobhiḥ kalaśān ā viveśa
translated: Sportingly enter the wooden tubs, being purified. Let thy intoxicating juice gladden Indra.🔽He hath sent forth his lofty streams; anointed, he hath entered the jars with the milk.

original: sāma kṛṇvan sāmanyo vipaścit krandann ety abhi sakhyur na jāmim //
analyzed: sāma kṛṇvan sāmanyaḥ vipaścit krandan eti abhi sakhyuḥ na jāmim
translated: Making the chant, the wise one, the chanter, crying, he cometh to his friend's sister.

original: apaghnann eṣi pavamāna śatrūn priyāṃ na jāro abhigīta induḥ /🔽sīdan vaneṣu śakuno na patvā somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sattā //
analyzed: apaghnan eṣi pavamāna śatrūn priyām na jāraḥ abhigītaḥ induḥ  sīdan vaneṣu śakunaḥ na patvā somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sattā
translated: Thou goest forth, O Pavamâna, slaying foes, O Indu, as a lover to his love.🔽Sitting in the woods like a bird on the wing, Soma, being purified, sits in the jars.

original: ā te rucaḥ pavamānasya soma yoṣeva yanti sudughāḥ sudhārāḥ /🔽harir ānītaḥ puruvāro apsv acikradat kalaśe devayūnām //
analyzed: ā te rucaḥ pavamānasya soma yoṣā iva yanti sudughāḥ su dhārāḥ  hariḥ ānītaḥ puru vāraḥ apsu acikradat kalaśe devayūnām
translated: Thy rays, O Pavamâna Soma, flow like milch-kine well-milked, with easy flowing streams.🔽The tawny one, the bestower of boons, is brought to the waters. He hath bellowed in the heaven of the Gods.

original: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamāno devo devebhiḥ sam apṛkta rasam /
analyzed: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamānaḥ devaḥ devebhiḥ sam apṛkta rasam
translated: His messengers, being purified with wool, the God hath mingled his juice with the Gods.

original: sutaḥ pavitram pary eti rebhan miteva sadma paśumānti hotā //
analyzed: sutaḥ pavitram pari eti rebhan mitā iva sadma paśumānti hotā
translated: The pressed (juice) goeth round the purifying cloth, singing, like an envoy to his seat, like a priest to the house of him who hath cattle.

original: bhadrā vastrā samanyā vasāno mahān kavir nivacanāni śaṃsan /
analyzed: bhadrā vastrā samanyā vasānaḥ mahān kaviḥ nivacanāni śaṃsan
translated: Wearing beautiful garments, the great sage, proclaiming the words,

original: ā vacyasva camvoḥ pūyamāno vicakṣaṇo jāgṛvir devavītau //
analyzed: ā vacyasva camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ jāgṛviḥ deva vītau
translated: Be purified in the bowls, the all-seeing one, the watchful one, at the feast of the gods.

original: sam u priyo mṛjyate sāno avye yaśastaro yaśasāṃ kṣaito asme /
analyzed: sam u priyaḥ mṛjyate sāno avye yaśastaraḥ yaśasām kṣaitaḥ asme
translated: The dear one is being cleansed on the woolen filter, more famous than the famous, the strong one for us.

original: abhi svara dhanvā pūyamāno yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: abhi svara dhanva pūyamānaḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Sing out, O Dhanvan, being purified. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: pra gāyatābhy arcāma devān somaṃ hinota mahate dhanāya /
analyzed: pra gāyata abhi arcāma devān somam hinota mahate dhanāya
translated: Sing forth, let us honor the gods. Impel Soma for great wealth.

original: svāduḥ pavāte ati vāram avyam ā sīdāti kalaśaṃ devayur naḥ //
analyzed: svāduḥ pavāte ati vāram avyam ā sīdāti kalaśam devayuḥ naḥ
translated: The sweet one flows over the woolen filter. The god-adoring one sits in our pot.

original: indur devānām upa sakhyam āyan sahasradhāraḥ pavate madāya /🔽nṛbhi stavāno anu dhāma pūrvam agann indram mahate saubhagāya //
analyzed: induḥ devānām upa sakhyam āyan sahasra dhāraḥ pavate madāya  nṛbhiḥ stavānaḥ anu dhāma pūrvam agan indram mahate saubhagāya
translated: Indra has come to the companionship of the gods, the thousand-streamed one flows for the rapture.🔽Praised by men, following the ancient way, he has gone to Indra for great good fortune.

original: stotre rāye harir arṣā punāna indram mado gacchatu te bharāya /
analyzed: stotre rāye hariḥ arṣa punānaḥ indram madaḥ gacchatu te bharāya
translated: O golden one, flow for the praise and wealth, let the rapture go to Indra for your bearing.

original: devair yāhi sarathaṃ rādho acchā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: devaiḥ yāhi sa ratham rādhaḥ acchā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Go with the gods to the chariot, to the gift. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: pra kāvyam uśaneva bruvāṇo devo devānāṃ janimā vivakti /
analyzed: pra kāvyam uśanā iva bruvāṇaḥ devaḥ devānām janimā vivakti
translated: Speaking like Uśanā, the god reveals the birth of the gods, the poet.

original: mahivrataḥ śucibandhuḥ pāvakaḥ padā varāho abhy eti rebhan //
analyzed: mahi vrataḥ śuci bandhuḥ pāvakaḥ padā varāhaḥ abhī eti rebhan
translated: The one of great vow, with pure kinsmen, the purifier, the boar goes forth with his foot, singing.

original: pra haṃsāsas tṛpalam manyum acchāmād astaṃ vṛṣagaṇā ayāsuḥ /
analyzed: pra haṃsāsaḥ tṛpalam manyum accha amāt astam vṛṣagaṇāḥ ayāsuḥ
translated: The flocks of geese have turned away their anger from the Tripal tree, the herds of bulls have gone away.

original: āṅgūṣyam pavamānaṃ sakhāyo durmarṣaṃ sākam pra vadanti vāṇam //
analyzed: āṅgūṣyam pavamānam sakhāyaḥ durmarṣam sākam pra vadanti vāṇam
translated: The friends call together the irresistible arrow, the Pavamana who is to be praised.

original: sa raṃhata urugāyasya jūtiṃ vṛthā krīḷantam mimate na gāvaḥ /
analyzed: sa raṃhate uru gāyasya jūtim vṛthā krīḍantam mimate na gāvaḥ
translated: He speeds on the impulse of the far-striding one; the cows do not follow the one who plays at will.

original: parīṇasaṃ kṛṇute tigmaśṛṅgo divā harir dadṛśe naktam ṛjraḥ //
analyzed: parīṇasam kṛṇute tigma śṛṅgaḥ divā hariḥ dadṛśe naktam ṛjraḥ
translated: The one with sharp horns makes the round complete; the tawny one is seen by day, the dark one by night.

original: indur vājī pavate gonyoghā indre somaḥ saha invan madāya /
analyzed: induḥ vājī pavate gonyoghāḥ indre somaḥ sahaḥ invan madāya
translated: The strong Indu flows on, driving the cows, Soma for Indra, to stimulate his joy.

original: hanti rakṣo bādhate pary arātīr varivaḥ kṛṇvan vṛjanasya rājā //
analyzed: hanti rakṣaḥ bādhate pari arātīḥ varivaḥ kṛṇvan vṛjanasya rājā
translated: He slays the Raksases, repels the enemies, the king of the people, making room (for us).

original: adha dhārayā madhvā pṛcānas tiro roma pavate adridugdhaḥ /
analyzed: adha dhārayā madhvā pṛcānaḥ tiras roma pavate adri dugdhaḥ
translated: Now, being purified, he flows along with the stream, with the sweet (liquid), through the hair, milked from the stone.

original: indur indrasya sakhyaṃ juṣāṇo devo devasya matsaro madāya //
analyzed: induḥ indrasya sakhyam juṣāṇaḥ devaḥ devasya matsaraḥ madāya
translated: Indu, delighting in Indra's friendship, the god, for the god's joy, in his own juice.

original: abhi priyāṇi pavate punāno devo devān svena rasena pṛñcan /
analyzed: abhi priyāṇi pavate punānaḥ devaḥ devān svena rasena pṛñcan
translated: He flows on, purifying, to the dear (objects), the god, besmearing the gods with his own juice.

original: indur dharmāṇy ṛtuthā vasāno daśa kṣipo avyata sāno avye //
analyzed: induḥ dharmāṇi ṛtuthā vasānaḥ daśa kṣipaḥ avyata sāno avye
translated: Indu, clothed in the laws of the seasons, has woven the ten streams on the fleece of the ewe.

original: vṛṣā śoṇo abhikanikradad gā nadayann eti pṛthivīm uta dyām /
analyzed: vṛṣā śoṇaḥ abhikanikradat gāḥ nadayan eti pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: The red bull roars to the cows, thundering, he goes to the earth and to the sky.

original: indrasyeva vagnur ā śṛṇva ājau pracetayann arṣati vācam emām //
analyzed: indrasya iva vagnuḥ ā śṛṇve ājau pracetayan arṣati vācam ā imām
translated: Like the voice of Indra, he listens in the battle, and, making all things clear, he sends forth this speech.

original: rasāyyaḥ payasā pinvamāna īrayann eṣi madhumantam aṃśum /
analyzed: rasāyyaḥ payasā pinvamānaḥ īrayan eṣi madhumantam aṃśum
translated: The one to be offered, swelling with milk, urging, you go to the honey-filled stalk.

original: pavamānaḥ saṃtanim eṣi kṛṇvann indrāya soma pariṣicyamānaḥ //
analyzed: pavamānaḥ saṃtanim eṣi kṛṇvan indrāya soma pariṣicyamānaḥ
translated: O Pavamana, you go to the end, creating, O Soma, being sprinkled for Indra.

original: evā pavasva madiro madāyodagrābhasya namayan vadhasnaiḥ /
analyzed: eva pavasva madiraḥ madāya udagrābhasya namayan vadhasnaiḥ
translated: Thus flow, O intoxicating one, for delight, bending the weapons of the one with the uplifted arms.

original: pari varṇam bharamāṇo ruśantaṃ gavyur no arṣa pari soma siktaḥ //
analyzed: pari varṇam bharamāṇaḥ ruśantam gavyuḥ naḥ arṣa pari soma siktaḥ
translated: Bearing the shining form, O Soma, flowing, grant us riches in cattle, being sprinkled.

original: juṣṭvī na indo supathā sugāny urau pavasva varivāṃsi kṛṇvan /🔽ghaneva viṣvag duritāni vighnann adhi ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye //
analyzed: juṣṭvī naḥ indo su pathā sugāni urau pavasva varivāṃsi kṛṇvan  ghanā iva viṣvak duritāni vighnan adhi snunā dhanva sāno avye
translated: O Indu, flow to us, dear one, with good paths and good songs, making room, creating wide spaces.🔽Breaking through the evils like a strong one on all sides, on the firm, on the back, on the uneven.

original: vṛṣṭiṃ no arṣa divyāṃ jigatnum iḷāvatīṃ śaṅgayīṃ jīradānum /
analyzed: vṛṣṭim naḥ arṣa divyām jigatnum iḷāvatīm śaṅgayīm jīra dānum
translated: Flow to us rain from heaven, victorious, full of food, with plenty of food, giving joy.

original: stukeva vītā dhanvā vicinvan bandhūṃr imāṃ avarāṃ indo vāyūn //
analyzed: stukā iva vītā dhanva vicinvan bandhūṃr imān avarān indo vāyūn
translated: Like a bird, searching, spreading out, O Indu, the near and the distant, the low and the high.

original: granthiṃ na vi ṣya grathitam punāna ṛjuṃ ca gātuṃ vṛjinaṃ ca soma /
analyzed: granthim na vi sya grathitam punānaḥ ṛjum ca gātum vṛjinam ca soma
translated: Untie, O purifying one, the tied knot, O Soma, the straight path and the crooked one.

original: atyo na krado harir ā sṛjāno maryo deva dhanva pastyāvān //
analyzed: atyaḥ na kradaḥ hariḥ ā sṛjānaḥ maryaḥ deva dhanva pastyāvān
translated: Like a horse, a tawny courser, set free, a young god, O wealth, dwelling in the desert.

original: juṣṭo madāya devatāta indo pari ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye /
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ madāya devatāte indo pari snunā dhanva sāno avye
translated: O Indu, dear to the gods for the joy of the feast, flow around the edge, the uneven, the back.

original: sahasradhāraḥ surabhir adabdhaḥ pari srava vājasātau nṛṣahye //
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ surabhiḥ adabdhaḥ pari srava vājasātau nṛṣahye
translated: With a thousand streams, fragrant, infallible, flow around in the battle for booty, in the contest with men.

original: araśmāno ye 'rathā ayuktā atyāso na sasṛjānāsa ājau /
analyzed: a raśmānaḥ ye rathāḥ a yuktāḥ atyāsaḥ na sasṛjānāsaḥ ājau
translated: Those who are not yoked to chariots, not harnessed, the swift ones not set free in the battle,

original: ete śukrāso dhanvanti somā devāsas tāṃ upa yātā pibadhyai //
analyzed: ete śukrāsaḥ dhanvanti somāḥ devāsaḥ tām upa yātā pibadhyai
translated: these bright ones flow through the desert, the Soma-pressers. Come to them, O gods, to drink.

original: evā na indo abhi devavītim pari srava nabho arṇaś camūṣu /
analyzed: eva naḥ indo abhi deva vītim pari srava nabhaḥ arṇaḥ camūṣu
translated: Thus, O Indu, flow to the feast of the gods, flow around the cloud and the water in the bowls.

original: somo asmabhyaṃ kāmyam bṛhantaṃ rayiṃ dadātu vīravantam ugram //
analyzed: somaḥ asmabhyam kāmyam bṛhantam rayim dadātu vīravantam ugram
translated: May Soma grant us great wealth, desirable, mighty, full of heroes.

original: takṣad yadī manaso venato vāg jyeṣṭhasya vā dharmaṇi kṣor anīke /
analyzed: takṣat yadī manasaḥ venataḥ vāc jyeṣṭhasya vā dharmaṇi kṣoḥ anīke
translated: He fashions, when the mind is stirred, the speech of the eldest, in the place of the law, in the presence.

original: ād īm āyan varam ā vāvaśānā juṣṭam patiṃ kalaśe gāva indum //
analyzed: āt īm āyan varam ā vāvaśānāḥ juṣṭam patim kalaśe gāvaḥ indum
translated: Then they came, lowing, to the chosen one, the cows to the dear husband in the pot, to Indu.

original: pra dānudo divyo dānupinva ṛtam ṛtāya pavate sumedhāḥ /
analyzed: pra dānudaḥ divyaḥ dānu pinvaḥ ṛtam ṛtāya pavate sumedhāḥ
translated: The giver of gifts, the divine one who swells the gifts, flows for truth to truth, the well-minded one.

original: dharmā bhuvad vṛjanyasya rājā pra raśmibhir daśabhir bhāri bhūma //
analyzed: dharmā bhuvat vṛjanyasya rājā pra raśmibhiḥ daśabhiḥ bhāri bhūma
translated: He became the law, the king of the people. He bears the earth with his ten rays.

original: pavitrebhiḥ pavamāno nṛcakṣā rājā devānām uta martyānām /🔽dvitā bhuvad rayipatī rayīṇām ṛtam bharat subhṛtaṃ cārv induḥ //
analyzed: pavitrebhiḥ pavamānaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ rājā devānām uta martyānām  dvitā bhuvat rayi patiḥ rayīṇām ṛtam bharat su bhṛtam cāru induḥ
translated: Purified by the pure ones, Pavamâna, the King of Gods and men, with eyes that look on men,🔽Has become the two-fold Lord of wealth and riches: the Indu brings forth well-preserved eternal truth.

original: arvāṃ iva śravase sātim acchendrasya vāyor abhi vītim arṣa /🔽sa naḥ sahasrā bṛhatīr iṣo dā bhavā soma draviṇovit punānaḥ //
analyzed: arvān iva śravase sātim acchā indrasya vāyoḥ abhi vītim arṣa  sa naḥ sahasrā bṛhatīḥ iṣaḥ dāḥ bhava soma draviṇaḥ vid punānaḥ
translated: Flow on for conquest, as it were, to glory, to the enjoyment of Indra and of Vâyu.🔽Be thou, O Soma, who knowest wealth, a giver of great gifts of food to us when purified.

original: devāvyo naḥ pariṣicyamānāḥ kṣayaṃ suvīraṃ dhanvantu somāḥ /
analyzed: devāvyaḥ naḥ pariṣicyamānāḥ kṣayam su vīram dhanvantu somāḥ
translated: The Soma-drops, when sprinkled round, O God among the Gods, shall bring us to a dwelling rich in brave men.

original: āyajyavaḥ sumatiṃ viśvavārā hotāro na diviyajo mandratamāḥ //
analyzed: āyajyavaḥ sumatim viśva vārāḥ hotāraḥ na diviyajaḥ mandratamāḥ
translated: The priests who bring the sacrifice, all-bounteous, most delightful, who offer sacrifice to heaven.

original: evā deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarase devapānaḥ /🔽mahaś cid dhi ṣmasi hitāḥ samarye kṛdhi suṣṭhāne rodasī punānaḥ //
analyzed: eva deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarase deva pānaḥ  mahaḥ cit hi smasi hitāḥ samarye kṛdhi suṣṭhāne rodasī punānaḥ
translated: So, O God, flow on to the Gods, O Soma, to the great enjoyment, to be drunk by the Gods.🔽For we are fain to win great glory in the fray: purifying, make the two worlds easy to support.

original: aśvo no krado vṛṣabhir yujānaḥ siṃho na bhīmo manaso javīyān /
analyzed: aśvaḥ naḥ kradaḥ vṛṣabhiḥ yujānaḥ siṃhaḥ na bhīmaḥ manasaḥ javīyān
translated: Like a horse, O Indu, yoked with strong steeds, swifter than thought is the terrible lion.

original: arvācīnaiḥ pathibhir ye rajiṣṭhā ā pavasva saumanasaṃ na indo //
analyzed: arvācīnaiḥ pathibhiḥ ye rajiṣṭhāḥ ā pavasva saumanasam naḥ indo
translated: Flow on with the most direct paths hitherward: bring us, O Indu, the favour of the spirit.

original: śataṃ dhārā devajātā asṛgran sahasram enāḥ kavayo mṛjanti /
analyzed: śatam dhārāḥ deva jātāḥ asṛgran sahasram enāḥ kavayaḥ mṛjanti
translated: A hundred streams, born of the Gods, have flowed: a thousand of them the sages cleanse.

original: indo sanitraṃ diva ā pavasva puraetāsi mahato dhanasya //🔽divo na sargā asasṛgram ahnāṃ rājā na mitram pra mināti dhīraḥ /
analyzed: indo sanitram divaḥ ā pavasva puraetā asi mahataḥ dhanasya  divaḥ na sargāḥ asasṛgram ahnām rājā na mitram pra mināti dhīraḥ
translated: O Indu, flow for the friend of the sky, thou art the forerunner of great wealth.🔽The streams of the days have flowed forth from the sky, the wise king, like a friend, transgresses not.

original: pitur na putraḥ kratubhir yatāna ā pavasva viśe asyā ajītim //🔽pra te dhārā madhumatīr asṛgran vārān yat pūto atyeṣy avyān /
analyzed: pituḥ na putraḥ kratubhiḥ yatānaḥ ā pavasva viśe asyai ajītim  pra te dhārāḥ madhumatīḥ asṛgran vārān yat pūtaḥ atyeṣi avyān
translated: Like a son of his father, urged on by the holy rites, flow for the victory of this people.🔽They have let loose thy streams, rich in honey, when, purified, thou shalt pass over the clouds.

original: pavamāna pavase dhāma gonāṃ jajñānaḥ sūryam apinvo arkaiḥ //
analyzed: pavamāna pavase dhāma gonām jajñānaḥ sūryam apinvaḥ arkaiḥ
translated: O Pavamâna, thou purifiest the abode of the cows, thou, being born, hast filled the sun with thy rays.

original: kanikradad anu panthām ṛtasya śukro vi bhāsy amṛtasya dhāma /
analyzed: kanikradat anu panthām ṛtasya śukraḥ vi bhāsi amṛtasya dhāma
translated: The bright one, roaring, hath followed the path of holy order, the abode of immortality.

original: sa indrāya pavase matsaravān hinvāno vācam matibhiḥ kavīnām //
analyzed: saḥ indrāya pavase matsaravān hinvānaḥ vācam matibhiḥ kavīnām
translated: Thou, O Pavamâna, flowest for Indra, full of joy, impelling the song of the sages with their thoughts.

original: divyaḥ suparṇo 'va cakṣi soma pinvan dhārāḥ karmaṇā devavītau /
analyzed: divyaḥ suparṇaḥ va cakṣi soma pinvan dhārāḥ karmaṇā deva vītau
translated: The heavenly bird hath looked down, O Soma, filling the streams, in the performance of the rite, in the banquet of the gods.

original: endo viśa kalaśaṃ somadhānaṃ krandann ihi sūryasyopa raśmim //
analyzed: ā indo viśa kalaśam soma dhānam krandan ihi sūryasya upa raśmim
translated: O Indu, enter the vat, the receptacle of Soma, roaring, go thou to the ray of the sun.

original: tisro vāca īrayati pra vahnir ṛtasya dhītim brahmaṇo manīṣām /
analyzed: tisraḥ vācaḥ īrayati pra vahniḥ ṛtasya dhītim brahmaṇaḥ manīṣām
translated: The priest sends forth three voices, the thought of holy order, the wisdom of prayer.

original: gāvo yanti gopatim pṛcchamānāḥ somaṃ yanti matayo vāvaśānāḥ //
analyzed: gāvaḥ yanti gopatim pṛcchamānāḥ somam yanti matayaḥ vāvaśānāḥ
translated: The cows go to the lord of the cows, inquiring; the thoughts go to Soma, longing for him.

original: somaṃ gāvo dhenavo vāvaśānāḥ somaṃ viprā matibhiḥ pṛcchamānāḥ /
analyzed: somam gāvaḥ dhenavaḥ vāvaśānāḥ somam viprāḥ matibhiḥ pṛcchamānāḥ
translated: The cows, the milch-kine, and the calves lowing to their dams, the priests with hymns, have sought to Soma.

original: somaḥ sutaḥ pūyate ajyamānaḥ some arkās triṣṭubhaḥ saṃ navante //
analyzed: somaḥ sutaḥ pūyate ajyamānaḥ some arkāḥ triṣṭubhaḥ sam navante
translated: Soma, when pressed, is purified, and made resplendent: in Soma the Triṣṭups and the hymns of praise are gathered.

original: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāna ā pavasva pūyamānaḥ svasti /
analyzed: eva naḥ soma pariṣicyamānaḥ ā pavasva pūyamānaḥ svasti
translated: So, O Soma, being poured, being purified, flow thou to us for our welfare.

original: indram ā viśa bṛhatā raveṇa vardhayā vācaṃ janayā purandhim //🔽ā jāgṛvir vipra ṛtā matīnāṃ somaḥ punāno asadac camūṣu /
analyzed: indram ā viśa bṛhatā raveṇa vardhaya vācam janaya purandhim  ā jāgṛviḥ vipraḥ ṛtā matīnām somaḥ punānaḥ asadat camūṣu
translated: Enter thou Indra with a loud roar: exalt thy voice, O thou of much wealth, and give us speech.🔽The sage, the inspirer of holy thoughts, Soma, being purified, hath sat down in the beakers.

original: sapanti yam mithunāso nikāmā adhvaryavo rathirāsaḥ suhastāḥ //
analyzed: sapanti yam mithunāsaḥ nikāmāḥ adhvaryavaḥ rathirāsaḥ su hastāḥ
translated: Him whom the skilful Adhvaryus, the swift, the well-handed, in pairs, according to their wish, impel.

original: sa punāna upa sūre na dhātobhe aprā rodasī vi ṣa āvaḥ /
analyzed: sa punānaḥ upa sūre na dhātā ubhe aprāḥ rodasī vi saḥ āvaḥ
translated: He, being purified, hath risen to the sky, like a sun, and hath filled the two world-halves with light.

original: priyā cid yasya priyasāsa ūtī sa tū dhanaṃ kāriṇe na pra yaṃsat //
analyzed: priyā cit yasya priyasāsaḥ ūtī sa tu dhanam kāriṇe na pra yaṃsat
translated: He, whose help, when he is delighted, is dear, will not withhold his wealth from him who acts.

original: sa vardhitā vardhanaḥ pūyamānaḥ somo mīḍhvāṃ abhi no jyotiṣāvīt /
analyzed: sa vardhitā vardhanaḥ pūyamānaḥ somaḥ mīḍhvān abhi naḥ jyotiṣā āvīt
translated: He, being purified, the increaser, the strengthener, Soma, the bountiful, hath come to us with light.

original: yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñāḥ svarvido abhi gā adrim uṣṇan //
analyzed: yena naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pada jñāḥ svar vidaḥ abhi gāḥ adrim uṣṇan
translated: By whom our sires of old, who knew the place, bestowing heaven, have warmed themselves to the milk-yielding stone.

original: akrān samudraḥ prathame vidharmañ janayan prajā bhuvanasya rājā /
analyzed: akrān samudraḥ prathame vidharmam janayan prajāḥ bhuvanasya rājā
translated: The ocean hath flowed forth in the first place, according to law, begetting offspring, king of the world.

original: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avye bṛhat somo vāvṛdhe suvāna induḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avye bṛhat somaḥ vāvṛdhe suvānaḥ induḥ
translated: The bull on the pure fleece, on the back of the cloud, Soma has grown great, the Indu, when pressed.

original: mahat tat somo mahiṣaś cakārāpāṃ yad garbho 'vṛṇīta devān /
analyzed: mahat tat somaḥ mahiṣaḥ cakāra apām yat garbhaḥ vṛṇīta devān
translated: That great deed Soma and the great bull have done, that the waters' germ has chosen the gods.

original: adadhād indre pavamāna ojo 'janayat sūrye jyotir induḥ //
analyzed: adadhāt indre pavamānaḥ ojaḥ janayat sūrye jyotiḥ induḥ
translated: He has placed strength in Indra, O purifying one, Indu has produced light in the sun.

original: matsi vāyum iṣṭaye rādhase ca matsi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: matsi vāyum iṣṭaye rādhase ca matsi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ
translated: You delight Vayu for the sake of assistance and for the sake of bounty, you delight Mitra and Varuna when purified.

original: matsi śardho mārutam matsi devān matsi dyāvāpṛthivī deva soma //
analyzed: matsi śardhaḥ mārutam matsi devān matsi dyāvāpṛthivī deva soma
translated: You delight the Marut host, you delight the gods, you delight heaven and earth, O god Soma.

original: ṛjuḥ pavasva vṛjinasya hantāpāmīvām bādhamāno mṛdhaś ca /🔽abhiśrīṇan payaḥ payasābhi gonām indrasya tvaṃ tava vayaṃ sakhāyaḥ //
analyzed: ṛjuḥ pavasva vṛjinasya hantā apa amīvām bādhamānaḥ mṛdhaḥ ca  abhiśrīṇan payaḥ payasā abhi gonām indrasya tvam tava vayam sakhāyaḥ
translated: Flow straight, O slayer of the crooked one, repelling evil speech and enemies.🔽Blending the milk with milk for the cows, you and we, O Soma, are friends of Indra.

original: madhvaḥ sūdam pavasva vasva utsaṃ vīraṃ ca na ā pavasvā bhagaṃ ca /
analyzed: madhvaḥ sūdam pavasva vasvaḥ utsam vīram ca naḥ ā pavasva bhagam ca
translated: Flow on, purifying, as a presser, the sweet juice, the spring of wealth, and flow on to us, O Soma, for hero strength and for good fortune.

original: svadasvendrāya pavamāna indo rayiṃ ca na ā pavasvā samudrāt //
analyzed: svadasva indrāya pavamānaḥ indoḥ rayim ca naḥ ā pavasva samudrāt
translated: Be sweet for Indra, O purifying Indu, and flow on to us from the ocean, O Soma, wealth.

original: somaḥ suto dhārayātyo na hitvā sindhur na nimnam abhi vājy akṣāḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ sutaḥ dhārayā atyaḥ na hitvā sindhuḥ na nimnam abhi vājī akṣār
translated: Soma, when pressed, flows on in a stream, like a swift steed, like a river to the low ground.

original: ā yoniṃ vanyam asadat punānaḥ sam indur gobhir asarat sam adbhiḥ //
analyzed: ā yonim vanyam asadat punānaḥ sam induḥ gobhiḥ asarat sam adbhiḥ
translated: When purified, he has sat down in the wooden trough, the drop has flowed together with the cows and with the waters.

original: eṣa sya te pavata indra somaś camūṣu dhīra uśate tavasvān /
analyzed: eṣa sya te pavate indra somaḥ camūṣu dhīraḥ uśate tavasvān
translated: This is thy Soma, O Indra, being purified, the wise one in the bowls, for the eager one, the strong one.

original: svarcakṣā rathiraḥ satyaśuṣmaḥ kāmo na yo devayatām asarji //
analyzed: svar cakṣāḥ rathiraḥ satya śuṣmaḥ kāmaḥ na yaḥ devayatām asarji
translated: The one with true sight, the charioteer, of true strength, like a wish, who has been sent forth by those who delight in the gods.

original: eṣa pratnena vayasā punānas tiro varpāṃsi duhitur dadhānaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa pratnena vayasā punānaḥ tiras varpāṃsi duhituḥ dadhānaḥ
translated: This one, being purified with the ancient way, concealing the forms of his daughter,

original: vasānaḥ śarma trivarūtham apsu hoteva yāti samaneṣu rebhan //
analyzed: vasānaḥ śarma tri varūtham apsu hotā iva yāti samaneṣu rebhan
translated: wearing the threefold protection, the shelter, in the waters, he goes like a priest, singing in the assemblies.

original: nū nas tvaṃ rathiro deva soma pari srava camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: nu naḥ tvam rathiraḥ deva soma pari srava camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ
translated: Now, O charioteer, O god Soma, being purified in the bowls, flow around us.

original: apsu svādiṣṭho madhumāṃ ṛtāvā devo na yaḥ savitā satyamanmā //
analyzed: apsu svādiṣṭhaḥ madhumān ṛtāvā devaḥ na yaḥ savitā satya manmā
translated: In the waters, most sweet, full of honey, righteous, like the god Savitar, of true thought.

original: abhi vāyuṃ vīty arṣā gṛṇāno 'bhi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: abhi vāyum vītī arṣa gṛṇānaḥ bhi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ
translated: Flowing past Vayu, being purified, flow to Mitra-Varuna,

original: abhī naraṃ dhījavanaṃ ratheṣṭhām abhīndraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhum //
analyzed: abhi naram dhī javanam ratheṣṭhām abhi indram vṛṣaṇam vajra bāhum
translated: past the man who delights in thought, who sits in the chariot, past Indra, the strong one, with the thunderbolt in his arm.

original: abhi vastrā suvasanāny arṣābhi dhenūḥ sudughāḥ pūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: abhi vastrā su vasanāni arṣa abhi dhenūḥ su dughāḥ pūyamānaḥ
translated: Flow past the garments that are well-woven, being purified, flow past the cows that yield good milk,

original: abhi candrā bhartave no hiraṇyābhy aśvān rathino deva soma //
analyzed: abhi candrā bhartave naḥ hiraṇyā abhi aśvān rathinaḥ deva soma
translated: past the radiant gold to carry for us, O god Soma, past the horses that are yoked to the chariot.

original: abhī no arṣa divyā vasūny abhi viśvā pārthivā pūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: abhi naḥ arṣa divyā vasūni abhi viśvā pārthivā pūyamānaḥ
translated: Flow to us, being purified, the heavenly riches, and all the earthly ones,

original: abhi yena draviṇam aśnavāmābhy ārṣeyaṃ jamadagnivan naḥ //
analyzed: abhi yena draviṇam aśnavāma abhi ārṣeyam jamadagni vat naḥ
translated: By which we may win wealth, and the Arṣeya for us, like Jamadagni.

original: ayā pavā pavasvainā vasūni māṃścatva indo sarasi pra dhanva /🔽bradhnaś cid atra vāto na jūtaḥ purumedhaś cit takave naraṃ dāt //
analyzed: ayā pavā pavasva enā vasūni māṃścatve indo sarasi pra dhanva  bradhnaḥ cit atra vātaḥ na jūtaḥ puru medhaḥ cit takave naram dāt
translated: Flow onward, O Indu, with these treasures, with these powers to the lake, O Indu.🔽Even here let the swift wind, even the bountiful Puru-medhas give a man to Takav.

original: uta na enā pavayā pavasvādhi śrute śravāyyasya tīrthe /
analyzed: uta naḥ enā pavayā pavasva adhi śrute śravāyyasya tīrthe
translated: And for us, O Indu, flow onward with this purifying (stream) to the famous ford of the adorable one.

original: ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā naiguto vasūni vṛkṣaṃ na pakvaṃ dhūnavad raṇāya //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭim sahasrā naigutaḥ vasūni vṛkṣam na pakvam dhūnavat raṇāya
translated: Thou hast shaken for the fight, as a ripe tree, sixty thousand treasures of the Nigra.

original: mahīme asya vṛṣanāma śūṣe māṃścatve vā pṛśane vā vadhatre /
analyzed: mahi ime asya vṛṣa nāma śūṣe māṃścatve vā pṛśane vā vadhatre
translated: I will strive for his great and mighty power, either in the battle of the waters or in the battle of the slaughter.

original: asvāpayan nigutaḥ snehayac cāpāmitrāṃ apācito acetaḥ //
analyzed: asvāpayat nigutaḥ snehayat ca apa amitrān apa acitaḥ acetaḥ
translated: He has caused the Nigra to sleep and has melted him, the unfriendly one, the senseless one.

original: saṃ trī pavitrā vitatāny eṣy anv ekaṃ dhāvasi pūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: sam trī pavitrā vitatāni eṣi anu ekam dhāvasi pūyamānaḥ
translated: Thou hast spread out the three purifying (streams) to be passed over; purified, thou runnest along one of them.

original: asi bhago asi dātrasya dātāsi maghavā maghavadbhya indo //
analyzed: asi bhagaḥ asi dātrasya dātā asi maghavā maghavadbhyaḥ indo
translated: Thou art Bhaga, thou art the giver of the giver, thou art the bountiful one for the bountiful ones, O Indu.

original: eṣa viśvavit pavate manīṣī somo viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā /
analyzed: eṣa viśva vid pavate manīṣī somaḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
translated: This all-knowing, wise one flows, Soma, the king of the whole world.

original: drapsāṃ īrayan vidatheṣv indur vi vāram avyaṃ samayāti yāti //
analyzed: drapsān īrayan vidatheṣu induḥ vi vāram avyam samayā ati yāti
translated: Sending forth the drop, the Indu in the sacrifices, he goes, he moves along, passing through the variegated fleece.

original: induṃ rihanti mahiṣā adabdhāḥ pade rebhanti kavayo na gṛdhrāḥ /
analyzed: indum rihanti mahiṣāḥ adabdhāḥ pade rebhanti kavayaḥ na gṛdhrāḥ
translated: The mighty bulls, infallible, lick the moon; the sages, like vultures, sing in the foot.

original: hinvanti dhīrā daśabhiḥ kṣipābhiḥ sam añjate rūpam apāṃ rasena //
analyzed: hinvanti dhīrāḥ daśabhiḥ kṣipābhiḥ sam añjate rūpam apām rasena
translated: The wise urge him with ten swift (horses); they anoint his form with the essence of the waters.

original: tvayā vayam pavamānena soma bhare kṛtaṃ vi cinuyāma śaśvat /🔽tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tvayā vayam pavamānena soma bhare kṛtam vi cinuyāma śaśvat  tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: By thee, O Soma, by this purifying (juice), may we always win the treasure in the contest.🔽May this be granted to us by Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the Sindhu, the earth, and the sky.

original: abhi no vājasātamaṃ rayim arṣa puruspṛham /
analyzed: abhi naḥ vāja sātamam rayim arṣa puruspṛham
translated: Pour on us, O Indu, wealth most to be desired in battle, wealth longed for by many,

original: indo sahasrabharṇasaṃ tuvidyumnaṃ vibhvāsaham //
analyzed: indo sahasrabharṇasam tuvi dyumnam vibhvāsaham
translated: O Indu, wealth a thousandfold, wealth of great splendour, to be gained by all.

original: pari ṣya suvāno avyayaṃ rathe na varmāvyata /🔽indur abhi druṇā hito hiyāno dhārābhir akṣāḥ //
analyzed: pari sya suvānaḥ avyayam rathe na varmā avyata  induḥ abhi druṇā hitaḥ hiyānaḥ dhārābhiḥ akṣār
translated: Flowing around, pressed out, he is clothed in a robe, like a chariot, in a coat of mail.🔽Indu, pierced by the goad, is carried along, with streams, with the reins.

original: pari ṣya suvāno akṣā indur avye madacyutaḥ /
analyzed: pari sya suvānaḥ akṣāḥ induḥ avye mada cyutaḥ
translated: Flowing around, pressed out, Indu, in the woollen filter, distilling rapture,

original: dhārā ya ūrdhvo adhvare bhrājā naiti gavyayuḥ //🔽sa hi tvaṃ deva śaśvate vasu martāya dāśuṣe /
analyzed: dhārā yaḥ ūrdhvaḥ adhvare bhrājā na eti gavyayuḥ  sa hi tvam deva śaśvate vasu martāya dāśuṣe
translated: whose stream, rising in the sacrifice, goes forth, seeking the milk, with a bright flame.🔽For thou, O God, to the mortal worshipper, O Indu, givest wealth, wealth in thousands,

original: indo sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ śatātmānaṃ vivāsasi //
analyzed: indo sahasriṇam rayim śata ātmānam vivāsasi
translated: wealth of a hundred forms, to be desired by many.

original: vayaṃ te asya vṛtrahan vaso vasvaḥ puruspṛhaḥ /
analyzed: vayam te asya vṛtra han vaso vasvaḥ puruspṛhaḥ
translated: We, O Vritra-slayer, O Vasu, of this thy bounty, O thou who art longed for by many,

original: ni nediṣṭhatamā iṣaḥ syāma sumnasyādhrigo //
analyzed: ni nediṣṭhatamāḥ iṣaḥ syāma sumnasya adhrigo
translated: May we be nearest to the food, to the fulfilment of our wish.

original: dvir yam pañca svayaśasaṃ svasāro adrisaṃhatam /
analyzed: dvis yam pañca sva yaśasam svasāraḥ adri saṃhatam
translated: The five sisters purify him, the self-resplendent one, girt by the mountains,

original: priyam indrasya kāmyam prasnāpayanty ūrmiṇam //
analyzed: priyam indrasya kāmyam prasnāpayanti ūrmiṇam
translated: The dear one, desirable to Indra, the wave-like one.

original: pari tyaṃ haryataṃ harim babhrum punanti vāreṇa /
analyzed: pari tyam haryatam harim babhrum punanti vāreṇa
translated: They purify the tawny one, the cheerful one, the brown one, with the sieve,

original: yo devān viśvāṃ it pari madena saha gacchati //
analyzed: yaḥ devān viśvān id pari madena saha gacchati
translated: Who goes around with the rapture to all the gods.

original: asya vo hy avasā pānto dakṣasādhanam /
analyzed: asya vaḥ hi avasā pāntaḥ dakṣa sādhanam
translated: For you indeed is this help, this protection, which accomplishes strength,

original: yaḥ sūriṣu śravo bṛhad dadhe svar ṇa haryataḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ sūriṣu śravaḥ bṛhat dadhe svar na haryataḥ
translated: Which has placed great fame among the princes, the delightful one.

original: sa vāṃ yajñeṣu mānavī indur janiṣṭa rodasī /
analyzed: sa vām yajñeṣu mānavī induḥ janiṣṭa rodasī
translated: That Indu of yours, O men, has generated the two worlds at your sacrifices,

original: devo devī giriṣṭhā asredhan taṃ tuviṣvaṇi //
analyzed: devaḥ devī giriṣṭhāḥ asredhan tam tuviṣvaṇi
translated: The god, the goddess dwelling on the mountain, the uninjured one, him of great strength.

original: indrāya soma pātave vṛtraghne pari ṣicyase /
analyzed: indrāya soma pātave vṛtra ghne pari sicyase
translated: O Soma, you are being poured out for Indra to drink, for the Vrtra-killer,

original: nare ca dakṣiṇāvate devāya sadanāsade //🔽te pratnāso vyuṣṭiṣu somāḥ pavitre akṣaran /
analyzed: nare ca dakṣiṇāvate devāya sadanāsade  te pratnāsaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu somāḥ pavitre akṣaran
translated: For the god who sits in the seat, who deserves the sacrificial fee, and for the man who gives the fee.🔽Those ancient Somas have flowed into the purifying sieve at the dawns,

original: apaprothantaḥ sanutar huraścitaḥ prātas tāṃ apracetasaḥ //🔽taṃ sakhāyaḥ purorucaṃ yūyaṃ vayaṃ ca sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: apaprothantaḥ sanutar huraścitaḥ prātar tām apracetasaḥ  tam sakhāyaḥ purorucam yūyam vayam ca sūrayaḥ
translated: Stretching out to the distant ones, the eager ones, the ones to be known in the morning, the ones to be known.🔽You, O friends, and we, the princes,

original: aśyāma vājagandhyaṃ sanema vājapastyam //
analyzed: aśyāma vājagandhyam sanema vāja pastyam
translated: May we obtain the one who smells like strength, may we gain the one who has strength as his share.

original: ā haryatāya dhṛṣṇave dhanus tanvanti pauṃsyam /🔽śukrāṃ vayanty asurāya nirṇijaṃ vipām agre mahīyuvaḥ //
analyzed: ā haryatāya dhṛṣṇave dhanuḥ tanvanti pauṃsyam  śukrām vayanti asurāya nirṇijam vipām agre mahīyuvaḥ
translated: They stretch the bow for the tawny, impetuous one, for manly strength.🔽They make the bright garment for the Asura, the great ones first, the powerful ones.

original: adha kṣapā pariṣkṛto vājāṃ abhi pra gāhate /
analyzed: adha kṣapā pariṣkṛtaḥ vājām abhi pra gāhate
translated: Now, in the night, purified, he plunges into the strength,

original: yadī vivasvato dhiyo hariṃ hinvanti yātave //
analyzed: yadī vivasvataḥ dhiyaḥ harim hinvanti yātave
translated: When the thoughts of Vivasvan urge the tawny one to go.

original: tam asya marjayāmasi mado ya indrapātamaḥ /
analyzed: tam asya marjayāmasi madaḥ yaḥ indra pātamaḥ
translated: We adorn him, his rapture which is most worthy of Indra's drink,

original: yaṃ gāva āsabhir dadhuḥ purā nūnaṃ ca sūrayaḥ //
analyzed: yam gāvaḥ āsabhiḥ purā nūnam ca sūrayaḥ
translated: Which the cows, the steed, have placed, and the princes of old and now.

original: taṃ gāthayā purāṇyā punānam abhy anūṣata /
analyzed: tam gāthayā purāṇyā punānam abhī anūṣata
translated: The ancient singers have sung forth to him, purifying the ancient ways.

original: uto kṛpanta dhītayo devānāṃ nāma bibhratīḥ //
analyzed: uta u kṛpanta dhītayaḥ devānām nāma bibhratīḥ
translated: And the thoughts of the gods have come forth, bearing the names.

original: tam ukṣamāṇam avyaye vāre punanti dharṇasim /
analyzed: tam ukṣamāṇam avyaye vāre punanti dharṇasim
translated: They purify in the new filter the one who is poured out, the strong one.

original: dūtaṃ na pūrvacittaya ā śāsate manīṣiṇaḥ //
analyzed: dūtam na pūrvacittaye ā śāsate manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The wise ones send forth the messenger, thinking of him first.

original: sa punāno madintamaḥ somaś camūṣu sīdati /
analyzed: sa punānaḥ madintamaḥ somaḥ camūṣu sīdati
translated: He, Soma, the most delightful when purified, sits in the bowls,

original: paśau na reta ādadhat patir vacasyate dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: paśau na retaḥ ādadhat patiḥ vacasyate dhiyaḥ
translated: Placing seed as it were in the animal, the lord of speech, the thoughts.

original: sa mṛjyate sukarmabhir devo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ /🔽vide yad āsu saṃdadir mahīr apo vi gāhate //
analyzed: sa mṛjyate su karmabhiḥ devaḥ devebhyaḥ sutaḥ  vide yat āsu saṃdadiḥ mahīḥ apaḥ vi gāhate
translated: He, the god, is cleansed by the well-doing ones, pressed for the gods,🔽Knowing where the great waters are, he plunges into the waters.

original: suta indo pavitra ā nṛbhir yato vi nīyase /
analyzed: sutaḥ indo pavitre ā nṛbhiḥ yataḥ vi nīyase
translated: O Indu, when thou art pressed on the filter, thou art led forth by the men,

original: indrāya matsarintamaś camūṣv ā ni ṣīdasi //
analyzed: indrāya matsarintamaḥ camūṣu ā ni sīdasi
translated: In the bowls, as the most gladdening juice, thou sittest down for Indra.

original: abhī navante adruhaḥ priyam indrasya kāmyam /
analyzed: abhī navante adruhaḥ priyam indrasya kāmyam
translated: The guileless ones have pressed the dear, the much-desired drink of Indra,

original: vatsaṃ na pūrva āyuni jātaṃ rihanti mātaraḥ //
analyzed: vatsam na pūrve āyuni jātam rihanti mātaraḥ
translated: As the mothers lick the newly-born calf in the first place.

original: punāna indav ā bhara soma dvibarhasaṃ rayim /
analyzed: punānaḥ indo ā bhara soma dvibarhasam rayim
translated: Purified, O Soma, bring thou wealth of two kinds.

original: tvaṃ vasūni puṣyasi viśvāni dāśuṣo gṛhe //
analyzed: tvam vasūni puṣyasi viśvāni dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe
translated: Thou prosperest all treasures in the house of the worshipper.

original: tvaṃ dhiyam manoyujaṃ sṛjā vṛṣṭiṃ na tanyatuḥ /
analyzed: tvam dhiyam manaḥ yujam sṛja vṛṣṭim na tanyatuḥ
translated: Send forth the thought yoked with the mind, like rain from a cloud.

original: tvaṃ vasūni pārthivā divyā ca soma puṣyasi //🔽pari te jigyuṣo yathā dhārā sutasya dhāvati /
analyzed: tvam vasūni pārthivā divyā ca soma puṣyasi  pari te jigyuṣaḥ yathā dhārā sutasya dhāvati
translated: Thou prosperest, O Soma, treasures on earth and in heaven.🔽As for one who would conquer, so flows the stream of the pressed juice around thee.

original: raṃhamāṇā vy avyayaṃ vāraṃ vājīva sānasiḥ //
analyzed: raṃhamāṇā vi avyayam vāram vājī iva sānasiḥ
translated: Rushing along, through the open, like a strong horse, winning (the prize).

original: kratve dakṣāya naḥ kave pavasva soma dhārayā /
analyzed: kratve dakṣāya naḥ kave pavasva soma dhārayā
translated: Flow for our wisdom and skill, O wise Soma, in a stream.

original: indrāya pātave suto mitrāya varuṇāya ca //
analyzed: indrāya pātave sutaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya ca
translated: Pressed, for Indra to drink, for Mitra, for Varuna.

original: pavasva vājasātamaḥ pavitre dhārayā sutaḥ /
analyzed: pavasva vāja sātamaḥ pavitre dhārayā sutaḥ
translated: Flow on, best at winning strength, pressed, in a stream, through the purifying cloth.

original: indrāya soma viṣṇave devebhyo madhumattamaḥ //
analyzed: indrāya soma viṣṇave devebhyaḥ madhumattamaḥ
translated: For Indra, O Soma, for Vishnu, for the gods, most rich in meath.

original: tvāṃ rihanti mātaro harim pavitre adruhaḥ /
analyzed: tvām rihanti mātaraḥ harim pavitre adruhaḥ
translated: The guileless mothers lick thee, the tawny one, on the purifying cloth,

original: vatsaṃ jātaṃ na dhenavaḥ pavamāna vidharmaṇi //
analyzed: vatsam jātam na dhenavaḥ pavamāna vidharmaṇi
translated: As the cows lick the newly-born calf, O Pavamana, in the right way.

original: pavamāna mahi śravaś citrebhir yāsi raśmibhiḥ /
analyzed: pavamāna mahi śravaḥ citrebhiḥ yāsi raśmibhiḥ
translated: O Pavamâna, thou with wondrous rays goest to glory with great might.

original: śardhan tamāṃsi jighnase viśvāni dāśuṣo gṛhe //🔽tvaṃ dyāṃ ca mahivrata pṛthivīṃ cāti jabhriṣe /
analyzed: śardhan tamāṃsi jighnase viśvāni dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe  tvam dyām ca mahi vrata pṛthivīm ca ati jabhriṣe
translated: Thou, impetuous, slayest all the darkness in the worshipper's abode.🔽Thou, of great sway, hast filled the heaven and earth: thou, Pavamâna, hast unloosed the rain

original: prati drāpim amuñcathāḥ pavamāna mahitvanā //🔽purojitī vo andhasaḥ sutāya mādayitnave /
analyzed: prati drāpim amuñcathāḥ pavamāna mahitvanā  purojitī vaḥ andhasaḥ sutāya mādayitnave
translated: By thy great power.🔽Ye who are leaders in the race of Soma, gladden you with the juice that makes you glad.

original: apa śvānaṃ śnathiṣṭana sakhāyo dīrghajihvyam //
analyzed: apa śvānam śnathiṣṭana sakhāyaḥ dīrghajihvyam
translated: Ye friends, unloose the dog of the long tongue.

original: yo dhārayā pāvakayā pariprasyandate sutaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ dhārayā pāvakayā pariprasyandate sutaḥ
translated: He who with flowing stream, effused, goes round,

original: indur aśvo na kṛtvyaḥ //
analyzed: induḥ aśvaḥ na kṛtvyaḥ
translated: Indu, the courser, like a steed to be adorned.

original: taṃ duroṣam abhī naraḥ somaṃ viśvācyā dhiyā /🔽yajñaṃ hinvanty adribhiḥ //
analyzed: tam duroṣam abhī naraḥ somam viśvācyā dhiyā  yajñam hinvanti adribhiḥ
translated: Him, Soma hard to be assailed, the men urge on with thought that looks on all,🔽With stones, for Indra, to the rite.

original: sutāso madhumattamāḥ somā indrāya mandinaḥ /
analyzed: sutāsaḥ madhumattamāḥ somāḥ indrāya mandinaḥ
translated: The Somas, pressed, most rich in sweets, gladden thee, O thou who rejoicest in the juice.

original: pavitravanto akṣaran devān gacchantu vo madāḥ //
analyzed: pavitravantaḥ akṣaran devān gacchantu vaḥ madāḥ
translated: Flowing through the filter, let your gladdening drops go to the Gods.

original: indur indrāya pavata iti devāso abruvan /
analyzed: induḥ indrāya pavate iti devāsaḥ abruvan
translated: The Gods have said, Let Indu be purified for Indra.

original: vācas patir makhasyate viśvasyeśāna ojasā //
analyzed: vācaḥ patiḥ makhasyate viśvasya īśānaḥ ojasā
translated: The Lord of Speech is glorified, the Lord of all by power.

original: sahasradhāraḥ pavate samudro vācamīṅkhayaḥ /
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ pavate samudraḥ vācamīṅkhayaḥ
translated: With a thousand streams the ocean flows, the impeller of the voice,

original: somaḥ patī rayīṇāṃ sakhendrasya divedive //
analyzed: somaḥ patiḥ rayīṇām sakhā indrasya dive dive
translated: Soma, the Lord of wealth, the friend of Indra day by day.

original: ayam pūṣā rayir bhagaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati /
analyzed: ayam pūṣā rayiḥ bhagaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ arṣati
translated: This Pūṣan, this Bhaga, this Soma, while being purified, flows on,

original: patir viśvasya bhūmano vy akhyad rodasī ubhe //
analyzed: patiḥ viśvasya bhūmanaḥ vi akhyat rodasī ubhe
translated: The lord of all the world, hath looked upon both the all-supporting worlds.

original: sam u priyā anūṣata gāvo madāya ghṛṣvayaḥ /
analyzed: sam u priyāḥ anūṣata gāvaḥ madāya ghṛṣvayaḥ
translated: The dear ones have resounded together: the cows for the joy of him who is eager.

original: somāsaḥ kṛṇvate pathaḥ pavamānāsa indavaḥ //🔽ya ojiṣṭhas tam ā bhara pavamāna śravāyyam /
analyzed: somāsaḥ kṛṇvate pathaḥ pavamānāsaḥ indavaḥ  yaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ tam ā bhara pavamāna śravāyyam
translated: The Soma juices, the purifying drops, make the paths.🔽Bring us, O Pavamâna, him who is most strong, worthy of fame,

original: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīr abhi rayiṃ yena vanāmahai //🔽somāḥ pavanta indavo 'smabhyaṃ gātuvittamāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīḥ abhi rayim yena vanāmahai  somāḥ pavante indavaḥ smabhyam gātu vittamāḥ
translated: By whom we may subdue the five peoples and gain riches.🔽The Soma drops are purified, best able to give us room and way.

original: mitrāḥ suvānā arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svarvidaḥ //🔽suṣvāṇāso vy adribhiś citānā gor adhi tvaci /
analyzed: mitrāḥ suvānāḥ arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svar vidaḥ  suṣvāṇāsaḥ vi adribhiḥ citānāḥ goḥ adhi tvaci
translated: The well-pressed juices, free from stain, of their own will, finders of light,🔽The drops, well-squeezed, in the stone, set in the cow's hide,

original: iṣam asmabhyam abhitaḥ sam asvaran vasuvidaḥ //
analyzed: iṣam asmabhyam abhitas sam asvaran vasu vidaḥ
translated: Have all together sent us food, finders of wealth.

original: ete pūtā vipaścitaḥ somāso dadhyāśiraḥ /🔽sūryāso na darśatāso jigatnavo dhruvā ghṛte //
analyzed: ete pūtāḥ vipaścitaḥ somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ  sūryāsaḥ na darśatāsaḥ jigatnavaḥ dhruvāḥ ghṛte
translated: These purified wise Somas, these drops of milk,🔽Like suns, are eager to look forth, firm in the oil.

original: pra sunvānasyāndhaso marto na vṛta tad vacaḥ /
analyzed: pra sunvānasya andhasaḥ martaḥ na vṛta tat vacaḥ
translated: The mortal man must utter this word to him who sheds the juice and pours it forth.

original: apa śvānam arādhasaṃ hatā makhaṃ na bhṛgavaḥ //
analyzed: apa śvānam arādhasam hatāḥ makham na bhṛgavaḥ
translated: Like Bhṛigus slay the dog that howls, the worthless Makha.

original: ā jāmir atke avyata bhuje na putra oṇyoḥ /
analyzed: ā jāmiḥ atke avyata bhuje na putraḥ oṇyoḥ
translated: The kinsman hath been stretched upon the pole, the son upon the two arms of the tree.

original: saraj jāro na yoṣaṇāṃ varo na yonim āsadam //
analyzed: sarat jāraḥ na yoṣaṇām varaḥ na yonim āsadam
translated: Like a lover to his wife, he has sat down in the womb.

original: sa vīro dakṣasādhano vi yas tastambha rodasī /🔽hariḥ pavitre avyata vedhā na yonim āsadam //
analyzed: sa vīraḥ dakṣa sādhanaḥ vi yaḥ tastambha rodasī  hariḥ pavitre avyata vedhāḥ na yonim āsadam
translated: That hero, the fulfiller of strength, who has propped up the two worlds,🔽The golden one has been woven on the purifying sieve, the measurer has sat down in the womb.

original: avyo vārebhiḥ pavate somo gavye adhi tvaci /
analyzed: avyaḥ vārebhiḥ pavate somaḥ gavye adhi tvaci
translated: Soma flows with the waves in the hide of the cow,

original: kanikradad vṛṣā harir indrasyābhy eti niṣkṛtam //
analyzed: kanikradat vṛṣā hariḥ indrasya abhī eti niṣkṛtam
translated: The roaring brown bull goes to Indra's place of worship.

original: krāṇā śiśur mahīnāṃ hinvann ṛtasya dīdhitim /
analyzed: krāṇā śiśuḥ mahīnām hinvan ṛtasya dīdhitim
translated: The infant of the great ones, urging the impulse of truth,

original: viśvā pari priyā bhuvad adha dvitā //
analyzed: viśvā pari priyā bhuvat adha dvitā
translated: Has gone around all dear abodes in two days.

original: upa tritasya pāṣyor abhakta yad guhā padam /
analyzed: upa tritasya pāṣyoḥ abhakta yat guhā padam
translated: When he was hidden in Trita's pot, the place that was not to be shared,

original: yajñasya sapta dhāmabhir adha priyam //
analyzed: yajñasya sapta dhāmabhiḥ adha priyam
translated: He was dear through the seven abodes of the sacrifice.

original: trīṇi tritasya dhārayā pṛṣṭheṣv erayā rayim /
analyzed: trīṇi tritasya dhāraya pṛṣṭheṣu ā iraya rayim
translated: With Trita's support, on the backs (of the cows), he measures out wealth with the three (channels of the sacrificial post).

original: mimīte asya yojanā vi sukratuḥ //
analyzed: mimīte asya yojanā vi sukratuḥ
translated: His wise one measures out his plan.

original: jajñānaṃ sapta mātaro vedhām aśāsata śriye /
analyzed: jajñānam sapta mātaraḥ vedhām aśāsata śriye
translated: The seven mothers have instructed the wise one, born, for glory.

original: ayaṃ dhruvo rayīṇāṃ ciketa yat //
analyzed: ayam dhruvaḥ rayīṇām ciketa yat
translated: This one has thought out the firm (post) of riches, which is that (which is to be done).

original: asya vrate sajoṣaso viśve devāso adruhaḥ /
analyzed: asya vrate sajoṣasaḥ viśve devāsaḥ adruhaḥ
translated: In his rule, the all-gods, of one mind, free from hatred,

original: spārhā bhavanti rantayo juṣanta yat //
analyzed: spārhāḥ bhavanti rantayaḥ juṣanta yat
translated: Are desirable, the delights, when they enjoy (him).

original: yam ī garbham ṛtāvṛdho dṛśe cārum ajījanan /
analyzed: yam ī garbham ṛtāvṛdhaḥ dṛśe cārum ajījanan
translated: Whom the mothers, increasers of truth, have generated as a lovely child to be seen,

original: kavim maṃhiṣṭham adhvare puruspṛham //
analyzed: kavim maṃhiṣṭham adhvare puruspṛham
translated: The most bountiful, the wise one, at the sacrifice, the one desired by many.

original: samīcīne abhi tmanā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā /
analyzed: samīcīne abhi tmanā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
translated: The two young mothers of truth, in unison, with their own nature,

original: tanvānā yajñam ānuṣag yad añjate //
analyzed: tanvānāḥ yajñam ānuṣak yat añjate
translated: Weaving the sacrifice in due order, when they anoint themselves.

original: kratvā śukrebhir akṣabhir ṛṇor apa vrajaṃ divaḥ /
analyzed: kratvā śukrebhiḥ akṣabhiḥ ṛṇoḥ apa vrajam divaḥ
translated: By his wisdom, with his bright eyes, he has opened the stall of the sky.

original: hinvann ṛtasya dīdhitim prādhvare //
analyzed: hinvan ṛtasya dīdhitim pra adhvare
translated: Impelling the impulse of truth, in the great sacrifice.

original: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vaca udyatam /
analyzed: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vacaḥ udyatam
translated: To the purifying, the wise one, Soma, I raise this hymn.

original: bhṛtiṃ na bharā matibhir jujoṣate //
analyzed: bhṛtim na bhara matibhiḥ jujoṣate
translated: I bring him as a gift, with thoughts, he who delights in the oblation.

original: pari vārāṇy avyayā gobhir añjāno arṣati /
analyzed: pari vārāṇi avyayā gobhiḥ añjānaḥ arṣati
translated: He flows along, anointed with milk, around the unchanging vats,

original: trī ṣadhasthā punānaḥ kṛṇute hariḥ //
analyzed: trī sadhasthā punānaḥ kṛṇute hariḥ
translated: The golden one, purifying, makes the three abodes.

original: pari kośam madhuścutam avyaye vāre arṣati /
analyzed: pari kośam madhuścutam avyaye vāre arṣati
translated: He flows around the honey-dripping vat, in the unchanging vessel,

original: abhi vāṇīr ṛṣīṇāṃ sapta nūṣata //
analyzed: abhi vāṇīḥ ṛṣīṇām sapta nūṣata
translated: The seven voices of the seers are sung forth to him.

original: pari ṇetā matīnāṃ viśvadevo adābhyaḥ /
analyzed: pari netā matīnām viśva devaḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: The leader of thoughts, the all-god, the infallible,

original: somaḥ punānaś camvor viśad dhariḥ //
analyzed: somaḥ punānaḥ camvoḥ viśat hariḥ
translated: Soma, being purified, has entered the bowls, the golden one.

original: pari daivīr anu svadhā indreṇa yāhi saratham /🔽punāno vāghad vāghadbhir amartyaḥ //
analyzed: pari daivīḥ anu svadhāḥ indreṇa yāhi sa ratham  punānaḥ vāghat vāghadbhiḥ amartyaḥ
translated: Go around the divine powers, go with Indra in the chariot.🔽Being purified, the immortal one, the priest, with the priests.

original: pari saptir na vājayur devo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: pari saptiḥ na vājayuḥ devaḥ devebhyaḥ sutaḥ
translated: The god, being pressed, like a swift one eager for booty,

original: vyānaśiḥ pavamāno vi dhāvati //
analyzed: vyānaśiḥ pavamānaḥ vi dhāvati
translated: The purifier, Pavamana, runs forth, the all-knower.

original: sakhāya ā ni ṣīdata punānāya pra gāyata /
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ ā ni sīdata punānāya pra gāyata
translated: O friends, sit down together, sing forth to him who is purified.

original: śiśuṃ na yajñaiḥ pari bhūṣata śriye //
analyzed: śiśum na yajñaiḥ pari bhūṣata śriye
translated: Adorn the child with sacrifices for his glory.

original: sam ī vatsaṃ na mātṛbhiḥ sṛjatā gayasādhanam /
analyzed: sam ī vatsam na mātṛbhiḥ sṛjata gaya sādhanam
translated: Let him be loosed like a calf to his mothers, the gainer of wealth,

original: devāvyam madam abhi dviśavasam //
analyzed: devāvyam madam abhi dvi śavasam
translated: The gladdening drink of the gods, the two-fold one.

original: punātā dakṣasādhanaṃ yathā śardhāya vītaye /
analyzed: punāta dakṣa sādhanam yathā śardhāya vītaye
translated: Purify the gainer of strength, as for the host to enjoy,

original: yathā mitrāya varuṇāya śantamaḥ //🔽asmabhyaṃ tvā vasuvidam abhi vāṇīr anūṣata /
analyzed: yathā mitrāya varuṇāya śantamaḥ  asmabhyam tvā vasu vidam abhi vāṇīḥ anūṣata
translated: As most delightful for Mitra and Varuna.🔽To us have the songs sung forth thee, the finder of treasure.

original: gobhiṣ ṭe varṇam abhi vāsayāmasi //
analyzed: gobhiḥ te varṇam abhi vāsayāmasi
translated: With cows we clothe thy form.

original: sa no madānām pata indo devapsarā asi /
analyzed: sa naḥ madānām pate indo deva psarāḥ asi
translated: O Indu, thou art the lord of our delights, the bearer of the gods.

original: sakheva sakhye gātuvittamo bhava //
analyzed: sakhā iva sakhye gātu vittamaḥ bhava
translated: Be thou most ready to go to our friend as a friend.

original: sanemi kṛdhy asmad ā rakṣasaṃ kaṃ cid atriṇam /
analyzed: sanemi kṛdhī asmat ā rakṣasam kam cit atriṇam
translated: Make him ready for us, guard us from every Raksas here.

original: apādevaṃ dvayum aṃho yuyodhi naḥ //
analyzed: dvayum aṃhaḥ yuyodhi naḥ
translated: Keep far from us the two-footed and the four-footed evil.

original: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyo madāya punānam abhi gāyata /
analyzed: tam vaḥ sakhāyaḥ madāya punānam abhi gāyata
translated: Sing ye to him, O friends, as he is purified for your delight,

original: śiśuṃ na yajñaiḥ svadayanta gūrtibhiḥ //
analyzed: śiśum na yajñaiḥ svadayanta gūrtibhiḥ
translated: As with sacrifices they delight the child with their offerings.

original: saṃ vatsa iva mātṛbhir indur hinvāno ajyate /
analyzed: sam vatsaḥ iva mātṛbhiḥ induḥ hinvānaḥ ajyate
translated: Hieing like a calf to his mothers, Indu is made to move.

original: devāvīr mado matibhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ //
analyzed: devāvīḥ madaḥ matibhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The gladdening drink of the gods, purified by the thoughts.

original: ayaṃ dakṣāya sādhano 'yaṃ śardhāya vītaye /
analyzed: ayam dakṣāya sādhanaḥ yam śardhāya vītaye
translated: This one is to be made ready for strength, this one for the host to enjoy,

original: ayaṃ devebhyo madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ //
analyzed: ayam devebhyaḥ madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ
translated: This is the sweetest of the meath pressed out for the Gods.

original: goman na indo aśvavat sutaḥ sudakṣa dhanva /
analyzed: gomat naḥ indo aśvavat sutaḥ su dakṣa dhanva
translated: O Indu, rich in kine and horses, well-milked, with good strength,

original: śuciṃ te varṇam adhi goṣu dīdharam //
analyzed: śucim te varṇam adhi goṣu dīdharam
translated: I place thy pure hue upon the cows.

original: sa no harīṇām pata indo devapsarastamaḥ /🔽sakheva sakhye naryo ruce bhava //
analyzed: sa naḥ harīṇām pate indo deva psarastamaḥ  sakhā iva sakhye naryaḥ ruce bhava
translated: O Indu, lord of tawny coursers, best of the food of Gods,🔽Be thou resplendent to us, O hero, as a friend to his friend.

original: sanemi tvam asmad āṃ adevaṃ kaṃ cid atriṇam /🔽sāhvāṃ indo pari bādho apa dvayum //
analyzed: sanemi tvam asmat ām adevam kam cit atriṇam  sāhvām indo pari bādhaḥ apa dvayum
translated: We will drive away from us every godless fiendish creature.🔽Drive off the Dasyus, O Indu, with thy stream.

original: indram accha sutā ime vṛṣaṇaṃ yantu harayaḥ /
analyzed: indram accha sutāḥ ime vṛṣaṇam yantu harayaḥ
translated: To Indra let these juices go, to the strong God, let the bay steeds go.

original: śruṣṭī jātāsa indavaḥ svarvidaḥ //
analyzed: śruṣṭī jātāsaḥ indavaḥ svar vidaḥ
translated: The drops, born in the sky, have been pressed out, the finders of the light.

original: ayam bharāya sānasir indrāya pavate sutaḥ /
analyzed: ayam bharāya sānasiḥ indrāya pavate sutaḥ
translated: This Soma, winning wealth, is pressed for Indra, for his enjoyment.

original: somo jaitrasya cetati yathā vide //
analyzed: somaḥ jaitrasya cetati yathā vide
translated: The Victor's thought is with him, as he knoweth.

original: asyed indro madeṣv ā grābhaṃ gṛbhṇīta sānasim /
analyzed: asya id indraḥ madeṣu ā grābham gṛbhṇīta sānasim
translated: In his carouse let Indra grasp the strengthening grasp,

original: vajraṃ ca vṛṣaṇam bharat sam apsujit //
analyzed: vajram ca vṛṣaṇam bharat sam apsujit
translated: And bear away the strong thunderbolt, the conqueror of the floods.

original: pra dhanvā soma jāgṛvir indrāyendo pari srava /
analyzed: pra dhanva soma jāgṛviḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: O Soma, flow on for Indra, O thou watchful one, flow on, O Indu, for the strong.

original: dyumantaṃ śuṣmam ā bharā svarvidam //🔽indrāya vṛṣaṇam madam pavasva viśvadarśataḥ /
analyzed: dyumantam śuṣmam ā bhara svar vidam  indrāya vṛṣaṇam madam pavasva viśva darśataḥ
translated: Bring thou the glorious strength that findeth heaven.🔽Flow on for Indra, O thou of a thousand streams, the finder of the path, the all-observing one,

original: sahasrayāmā pathikṛd vicakṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: sahasra yāmā pathikṛt vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: A strong exhilarating drink.

original: asmabhyaṃ gātuvittamo devebhyo madhumattamaḥ /
analyzed: asmabhyam gātu vittamaḥ devebhyaḥ madhumattamaḥ
translated: Most fit for our journey, most sweet to the gods,

original: sahasraṃ yāhi pathibhiḥ kanikradat //
analyzed: sahasram yāhi pathibhiḥ kanikradat
translated: Go with a thousand paths, roaring!

original: pavasva devavītaya indo dhārābhir ojasā /
analyzed: pavasva deva vītaye indo dhārābhiḥ ojasā
translated: Flow, O Indu, for the feast of the gods, with streams of strength,

original: ā kalaśam madhumān soma naḥ sadaḥ //
analyzed: ā kalaśam madhumān soma naḥ sadaḥ
translated: Sweet, O Soma, to our vessel and seat.

original: tava drapsā udapruta indram madāya vāvṛdhuḥ /
analyzed: tava drapsāḥ uda prutaḥ indram madāya vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: Thy drops, O Soma, have flowed forth, to make Indra swell with joy.

original: tvāṃ devāso amṛtāya kam papuḥ //
analyzed: tvām devāsaḥ amṛtāya kam papuḥ
translated: The gods have drunk thee for immortality.

original: ā naḥ sutāsa indavaḥ punānā dhāvatā rayim /
analyzed: ā naḥ sutāsaḥ indavaḥ punānāḥ dhāvata rayim
translated: Our pressed Soma juices, being purified, flow on to wealth,

original: vṛṣṭidyāvo rītyāpaḥ svarvidaḥ //🔽somaḥ punāna ūrmiṇāvyo vāraṃ vi dhāvati /
analyzed: rīti apaḥ svar vidaḥ  somaḥ punānaḥ ūrmiṇā avyaḥ vāram vi dhāvati
translated: The rain-giving waters, finding the light, with the Refrain.🔽Soma, being purified, flows over the fleece with waves,

original: agre vācaḥ pavamānaḥ kanikradat //
analyzed: agre vācaḥ pavamānaḥ kanikradat
translated: The all-conquering Pavamana, roaring in front of the voices.

original: dhībhir hinvanti vājinaṃ vane krīḷantam atyavim /
analyzed: dhībhiḥ hinvanti vājinam vane krīḍantam atyavim
translated: The sages impel the strong one, sporting in the wood, the swift one,

original: abhi tripṛṣṭham matayaḥ sam asvaran //
analyzed: abhi tri pṛṣṭham matayaḥ sam asvaran
translated: The thoughts have resounded together to the three-backed one.

original: asarji kalaśāṃ abhi mīḷhe saptir na vājayuḥ /
analyzed: asarji kalaśām abhi mīḍhe saptiḥ na vājayuḥ
translated: He has been sent forth to the jars, like a horse eager for the prize,

original: punāno vācaṃ janayann asiṣyadat //🔽pavate haryato harir ati hvarāṃsi raṃhyā /
analyzed: punānaḥ vācam janayan asiṣyadat  pavate haryataḥ hariḥ ati hvarāṃsi raṃhyā
translated: Purifying, producing speech, he has flowed.🔽The tawny one, the swift one, flows over the ridges,

original: abhyarṣan stotṛbhyo vīravad yaśaḥ //
analyzed: abhyarṣan stotṛbhyaḥ vīravat yaśaḥ
translated: Pouring upon the praisers glory with heroes.
