original: ayā pavasva devayur madhor dhārā asṛkṣata /
analyzed: ayā pavasva devayuḥ madhoḥ dhārāḥ asṛkṣata
translated: Flowing, O Soma, dear to the gods, the streams of sweetness have flowed forth,

original: rebhan pavitram pary eṣi viśvataḥ //🔽parīto ṣiñcatā sutaṃ somo ya uttamaṃ haviḥ /
analyzed: rebhan pavitram pari eṣi viśvatas  pari itas siñcata sutam somaḥ yaḥ uttamam haviḥ
translated: O Rebha, thou goest round the filter from all sides.🔽Pour out the Soma that is pressed, the best oblation,

original: dadhanvāṃ yo naryo apsv antar ā suṣāva somam adribhiḥ //🔽nūnam punāno 'vibhiḥ pari sravādabdhaḥ surabhintaraḥ /
analyzed: dadhanvām yaḥ naryaḥ apsu antar ā suṣāva somam adribhiḥ  nūnam punānaḥ vibhiḥ pari srava adabdhaḥ surabhintaraḥ
translated: He who flows, who in the waters among men, has pressed out Soma with the stones.🔽Now, being purified, flow around with the drops, more fragrant than the sea.

original: sute cit tvāpsu madāmo andhasā śrīṇanto gobhir uttaram //
analyzed: sute cit tvā apsu madāmaḥ andhasā śrīṇantaḥ gobhiḥ uttaram
translated: Even when pressed, we will rejoice in the waters, in the juice, in the highest,🔽Stirring it with the cows.

original: pari suvānaś cakṣase devamādanaḥ kratur indur vicakṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: pari suvānaḥ cakṣase deva mādanaḥ kratuḥ induḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Flowing around, thou lookest on, delighting the gods, the wise Indu, the sacrifice.

original: punānaḥ soma dhārayāpo vasāno arṣasi /
analyzed: punānaḥ soma dhārayā apaḥ vasānaḥ arṣasi
translated: O Soma, being purified, thou flowest in a stream, clothed in the waters,

original: ā ratnadhā yonim ṛtasya sīdasy utso deva hiraṇyayaḥ //
analyzed: ā ratna dhāḥ yonim ṛtasya sīdasi utsaḥ deva hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: Thou, the giver of treasures, sittest in the womb of holy order, O god, in the golden trough.

original: duhāna ūdhar divyam madhu priyam pratnaṃ sadhastham āsadat /
analyzed: duhānaḥ ūdhar divyam madhu priyam pratnam sadhastham āsadat
translated: Milking the heavenly, dear honey from the udder, he has sat down in the ancient abode.

original: āpṛcchyaṃ dharuṇaṃ vājy arṣati nṛbhir dhūto vicakṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: āpṛcchyam dharuṇam vājī arṣati nṛbhiḥ dhūtaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The strong steed, to be asked about, the support, flows, being churned by men, the wise one.

original: punānaḥ soma jāgṛvir avyo vāre pari priyaḥ /
analyzed: punānaḥ soma jāgṛviḥ avyaḥ vāre pari priyaḥ
translated: Being purified, O Soma, watchful, dear in the wool, O thou of pure streams,

original: tvaṃ vipro abhavo 'ṅgirastamo madhvā yajñam mimikṣa naḥ //
analyzed: tvam vipraḥ abhavaḥ ṅgirastamaḥ madhvā yajñam mimikṣa naḥ
translated: Thou hast become the most Angiras-like sage. Mix our sacrifice with sweetness.

original: somo mīḍhvān pavate gātuvittama ṛṣir vipro vicakṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ mīḍhvān pavate gātu vittamaḥ ṛṣiḥ vipraḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Soma, the bountiful, flows on, best finder of paths, the sage, the priest, the wise one.

original: tvaṃ kavir abhavo devavītama ā sūryaṃ rohayo divi //
analyzed: tvam kaviḥ abhavaḥ deva vītamaḥ ā sūryam rohayaḥ divi
translated: You have become the wise one, O god, at the assembly of the gods, you have raised the sun to the sky.

original: soma u ṣuvāṇaḥ sotṛbhir adhi ṣṇubhir avīnām /
analyzed: somaḥ u suvānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ adhi snubhiḥ avīnām
translated: Soma, being pressed, with the pressing-stones, on the well-smeared (stones),

original: aśvayeva haritā yāti dhārayā mandrayā yāti dhārayā //
analyzed: aśvayā iva haritā yāti dhārayā mandrayā yāti dhārayā
translated: He goes with a stream like a horse, with a tawny stream, he goes with a delightful stream.

original: anūpe gomān gobhir akṣāḥ somo dugdhābhir akṣāḥ /
analyzed: anūpe gomān gobhiḥ akṣāḥ somaḥ dugdhābhiḥ akṣāḥ
translated: In the marsh, rich in cattle, with the milch cows, Soma, with the milkers,

original: samudraṃ na saṃvaraṇāny agman mandī madāya tośate //
analyzed: samudram na saṃvaraṇāni agman mandī madāya tośate
translated: They have come to the ocean, to the coverings, the strong one, for the gladdening of the feast.

original: ā soma suvāno adribhis tiro vārāṇy avyayā /
analyzed: ā soma suvānaḥ adribhiḥ tiras vārāṇi avyayā
translated: O Soma, being pressed, with the stones, through the fleecy (filter),

original: jano na puri camvor viśad dhariḥ sado vaneṣu dadhiṣe //🔽sa māmṛje tiro aṇvāni meṣyo mīḷhe saptir na vājayuḥ /
analyzed: janaḥ na puri camvoḥ viśat hariḥ sadaḥ vaneṣu dadhiṣe  sa māmṛje tiras aṇvāni meṣyaḥ mīḍhe saptiḥ na vājayuḥ
translated: The tawny one has entered the bowls, as a man (enters) his house, you have taken your seat in the woods.🔽He has been anointed, passing through the small openings, the ram, like a swift horse, eager for the prize,

original: anumādyaḥ pavamāno manīṣibhiḥ somo viprebhir ṛkvabhiḥ //
analyzed: anumādyaḥ pavamānaḥ manīṣibhiḥ somaḥ viprebhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ
translated: To be praised by the wise, Soma by the sages, by the singers of hymns.

original: pra soma devavītaye sindhur na pipye arṇasā /🔽aṃśoḥ payasā madiro na jāgṛvir acchā kośam madhuścutam //
analyzed: pra soma deva vītaye sindhuḥ na pipye arṇasā  aṃśoḥ payasā madiraḥ na jāgṛviḥ acchā kośam madhuścutam
translated: O Soma, for the feast of the gods, I am swollen, like a river, with waves,🔽Delightful with the milk of the Ançu, like a watchful one, to the vat which drips with honey.

original: ā haryato arjune atke avyata priyaḥ sūnur na marjyaḥ /
analyzed: ā haryataḥ arjune atke avyata priyaḥ sūnuḥ na marjyaḥ
translated: The tawny one has been woven on the blue-green (mountain), the dear son, to be anointed,

original: tam īṃ hinvanty apaso yathā rathaṃ nadīṣv ā gabhastyoḥ //
analyzed: tam īm hinvanti apasaḥ yathā ratham nadīṣu ā gabhastyoḥ
translated: He is urged on by the priests, like a chariot, in the two streams of the river, in the two hands (of the presser).

original: abhi somāsa āyavaḥ pavante madyam madam /
analyzed: abhi somāsaḥ āyavaḥ pavante madyam madam
translated: The living Soma juices are being purified, the gladdening drink of joy,

original: samudrasyādhi viṣṭapi manīṣiṇo matsarāsaḥ svarvidaḥ //
analyzed: samudrasya adhi viṣṭapi manīṣiṇaḥ matsarāsaḥ svar vidaḥ
translated: In the wide place of the ocean, the wise, the joyous, finding the light.

original: tarat samudram pavamāna ūrmiṇā rājā deva ṛtam bṛhat /
analyzed: tarat samudram pavamānaḥ ūrmiṇā rājā devaḥ ṛtam bṛhat
translated: Pavamana, crossing the ocean in a wave, the king, the great law of the gods,

original: arṣan mitrasya varuṇasya dharmaṇā pra hinvāna ṛtam bṛhat //
analyzed: arṣat mitrasya varuṇasya dharmaṇā pra hinvānaḥ ṛtam bṛhat
translated: Flows with the law of Mitra and Varuna, impelling the great law.

original: nṛbhir yemāno haryato vicakṣaṇo rājā devaḥ samudriyaḥ //
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ yemānaḥ haryataḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ rājā devaḥ samudriyaḥ
translated: The wise, the tawny one, the all-seeing one, the king, the god of the ocean, is being led by men.

original: indrāya pavate madaḥ somo marutvate sutaḥ /
analyzed: indrāya pavate madaḥ somaḥ marutvate sutaḥ
translated: The joy, the Soma, is being purified for Indra, the Marut-attended one, when pressed.

original: sahasradhāro aty avyam arṣati tam ī mṛjanty āyavaḥ //
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ ati avyam arṣati tam ī mṛjanti āyavaḥ
translated: He flows over the fleece with a thousand streams; the living ones cleanse him.

original: punānaś camū janayan matiṃ kaviḥ somo deveṣu raṇyati /
analyzed: punānaḥ camū janayan matim kaviḥ somaḥ deveṣu raṇyati
translated: The wise Soma, being purified, generates thought; he delights among the gods.

original: apo vasānaḥ pari gobhir uttaraḥ sīdan vaneṣv avyata //
analyzed: apaḥ vasānaḥ pari gobhiḥ uttaraḥ sīdan vaneṣu avyata
translated: Clad in the waters, surrounded by the cows, he sits in the woods, in the fleece.

original: tavāhaṃ soma rāraṇa sakhya indo divedive /
analyzed: tava aham soma rāraṇa sakhye indo dive dive
translated: I, O Soma, have rejoiced in your friendship, O Indu, day by day.

original: purūṇi babhro ni caranti mām ava paridhīṃr ati tāṃ ihi //
analyzed: purūṇi babhro ni caranti mām ava paridhīn ati tām ihi
translated: Many, O tawny one, have come to me; pass over the enclosing sticks.

original: utāhaṃ naktam uta soma te divā sakhyāya babhra ūdhani /
analyzed: uta aham naktam uta soma te divā sakhyāya babhro ūdhani
translated: And I, O Soma, by night and by day, O tawny one, on your udder, for friendship,

original: ghṛṇā tapantam ati sūryam paraḥ śakunā iva paptima //
analyzed: ghṛṇā tapantam ati sūryam paras śakunāḥ iva paptima
translated: I have flown over the burning heat, over the sun, like birds, from afar.

original: mṛjyamānaḥ suhastya samudre vācam invasi /
analyzed: mṛjyamānaḥ su hastya samudre vācam invasi
translated: Being cleansed by the skilful one in the ocean, you send forth speech.

original: rayim piśaṅgam bahulam puruspṛham pavamānābhy arṣasi //
analyzed: rayim piśaṅgam bahulam puruspṛham pavamāna abhi arṣasi
translated: You, O Pavamana, flow for wealth, tawny, abundant, desired by many.

original: mṛjāno vāre pavamāno avyaye vṛṣāva cakrado vane /
analyzed: mṛjānaḥ vāre pavamānaḥ avyaye vṛṣā ava cakradaḥ vane
translated: Being cleansed in the woolen filter, O Pavamana, in the spotless one, the bull, in the wood,

original: devānāṃ soma pavamāna niṣkṛtaṃ gobhir añjāno arṣasi //
analyzed: devānām soma pavamāna niṣkṛtam gobhiḥ añjānaḥ arṣasi
translated: You, O Soma Pavamana, flow, anointed with milk, to the rite of the gods.

original: pavasva vājasātaye 'bhi viśvāni kāvyā /🔽tvaṃ samudram prathamo vi dhārayo devebhyaḥ soma matsaraḥ //
analyzed: pavasva vājasātaye bhi viśvāni kāvyā  tvam samudram prathamaḥ vi dhārayaḥ devebhyaḥ soma matsaraḥ
translated: Flow for the winning of strength, to all the treasures of the wise.🔽You, O Soma, first set the ocean in motion, a gladdener for the gods, through the laws.

original: sa tū pavasva pari pārthivaṃ rajo divyā ca soma dharmabhiḥ /
analyzed: sa tu pavasva pari pārthivam rajaḥ divyā ca soma dharmabhiḥ
translated: Flow on, O Soma, through the earthly realm and through the heavenly through the laws.

original: tvāṃ viprāso matibhir vicakṣaṇa śubhraṃ hinvanti dhītibhiḥ //
analyzed: tvām viprāsaḥ matibhiḥ vicakṣaṇa śubhram hinvanti dhītibhiḥ
translated: You, O all-seeing one, the sages impel with thoughts, with hymns, the bright one.

original: pavamānā asṛkṣata pavitram ati dhārayā /
analyzed: pavamānāḥ asṛkṣata pavitram ati dhārayā
translated: The Pavamanas have flowed forth over the filter with a stream.

original: marutvanto matsarā indriyā hayā medhām abhi prayāṃsi ca //🔽apo vasānaḥ pari kośam arṣatīndur hiyānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: marutvantaḥ matsarāḥ indriyāḥ hayāḥ medhām abhi prayāṃsi ca  apaḥ vasānaḥ pari kośam arṣati induḥ hiyānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ
translated: The impetuous ones, accompanied by the Maruts, the horses of Indra, the mind, and the thoughts.🔽Clad in the waters, flow around the vat, O Indu, being pressed by the pressers.

original: janayañ jyotir mandanā avīvaśad gāḥ kṛṇvāno na nirṇijam //
analyzed: janayam jyotiḥ mandanāḥ avīvaśat gāḥ kṛṇvānaḥ na nirṇijam
translated: Generating light, rejoicing, he has shone forth, making the cows, as it were, his garment.

original: pavasva madhumattama indrāya soma kratuvittamo madaḥ /
analyzed: pavasva madhumattamaḥ indrāya soma kratu vittamaḥ madaḥ
translated: Flow on, O most rich in sweets, O Soma, as the most wise gladdener for Indra.

original: mahi dyukṣatamo madaḥ //
analyzed: mahi dyukṣatamaḥ madaḥ
translated: The most glorious and most delightful rapture.

original: yasya te pītvā vṛṣabho vṛṣāyate 'sya pītā svarvidaḥ /
analyzed: yasya te pītvā vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣāyate sya pītā svar vidaḥ
translated: Through whom, having drunk, the bull becomes strong, through whom, having drunk, he finds heaven,

original: sa supraketo abhy akramīd iṣo 'cchā vājaṃ naitaśaḥ //
analyzed: sa su praketaḥ abhī akramīt iṣā u ccha vājam na etaśaḥ
translated: He, well-directed, has stepped up to the food, like a swift steed to the prize.

original: tvaṃ hy aṅga daivyā pavamāna janimāni dyumattamaḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi aṅga daivyā pavamāna janimāni dyumattamaḥ
translated: For you, indeed, O divine Pavamâna, are the most glorious in generating (the gods),

original: amṛtatvāya ghoṣayaḥ //
analyzed: amṛta tvāya ghoṣayaḥ
translated: You who proclaim (them) for immortality.

original: yenā navagvo dadhyaṅṅ aporṇute yena viprāsa āpire /
analyzed: yena navagvaḥ dadhyaṅ aporṇute yena viprāsaḥ āpire
translated: Through whom Dadhyach Navagva is unloosed, through whom the sages have attained,

original: devānāṃ sumne amṛtasya cāruṇo yena śravāṃsy ānaśuḥ //
analyzed: devānām sumne amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ yena śravāṃsi ānaśuḥ
translated: Through whom they have won the glories of the gods, the fair ones of immortal bliss.

original: eṣa sya dhārayā suto 'vyo vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa sya dhārayā sutaḥ vyaḥ vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ
translated: This one, poured out with its stream, is purified with woollen cloths, the most delightful,

original: krīḷann ūrmir apām iva //
analyzed: krīḍan ūrmiḥ apām iva
translated: Playing like a wave of the waters.

original: ya usriyā apyā antar aśmano nir gā akṛntad ojasā /🔽abhi vrajaṃ tatniṣe gavyam aśvyaṃ varmīva dhṛṣṇav ā ruja //
analyzed: yaḥ usriyāḥ apyāḥ antar aśmanaḥ niḥ gāḥ akṛntat ojasā  abhi vrajam tatniṣe gavyam aśvyam varmī iva dhṛṣṇo ā ruja
translated: He who with his strength has split the enclosing stones of the milch-kine, and has let loose the cows,🔽He has filled the stall with cattle and horses, like a warrior, O bold one, he has broken (the stalls).

original: ā sotā pari ṣiñcatāśvaṃ na stomam apturaṃ rajasturam /
analyzed: ā sotā pari siñcata aśvam na stomam ap turam rajaḥ turam
translated: Let the pressers pour him in, the steed, the praise, the swift in the region,

original: vanakrakṣam udaprutam //
analyzed: vana krakṣam uda prutam
translated: The wild bull, the swift over the waters.

original: sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabham payovṛdham priyaṃ devāya janmane /
analyzed: sahasra dhāram vṛṣabham payaḥ vṛdham priyam devāya janmane
translated: The thousand-streamed bull, the strength-increasing, dear to the god, to the race (of the gods),

original: ṛtena ya ṛtajāto vivāvṛdhe rājā deva ṛtam bṛhat //
analyzed: ṛtena yaḥ ṛta jātaḥ vivāvṛdhe rājā devaḥ ṛtam bṛhat
translated: He who, born of truth, has grown by truth, the king, the god, the great truth.

original: abhi dyumnam bṛhad yaśa iṣas pate didīhi deva devayuḥ /
analyzed: abhi dyumnam bṛhat yaśaḥ iṣaḥ pate didīhi deva devayuḥ
translated: O Lord of food, shine forth with great glory and fame, O God, for the sake of the worshipper.

original: vi kośam madhyamaṃ yuva //
analyzed: vi kośam madhyamam yuva
translated: Open the middle vault, O God, for the sake of the worshipper.

original: ā vacyasva sudakṣa camvoḥ suto viśāṃ vahnir na viśpatiḥ /
analyzed: ā vacyasva su dakṣa camvoḥ sutaḥ viśām vahniḥ na viśpatiḥ
translated: Be pressed, O very skilful one, in the bowls, as the bearer of the people, like the lord of the people.

original: vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ pavasva rītim apāṃ jinvā gaviṣṭaye dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣṭim divaḥ pavasva rītim apām jinva gaviṣṭaye dhiyaḥ
translated: Flow, O God, from heaven, with the stream of the waters, and stimulate the thoughts for the winning of the cow.

original: etam u tyam madacyutaṃ sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ divo duhuḥ /
analyzed: etam u tyam mada cyutam sahasra dhāram vṛṣabham divaḥ duhuḥ
translated: They have milked this bull, the gladdener, of a thousand streams, from the heaven,

original: viśvā vasūni bibhratam //
analyzed: viśvā vasūni bibhratam
translated: bearing all treasures.

original: vṛṣā vi jajñe janayann amartyaḥ pratapañ jyotiṣā tamaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā vi jajñe janayan amartyaḥ pratapam jyotiṣā tamaḥ
translated: The bull was born, begetting the immortal, dispelling the darkness with his light.

original: sa suṣṭutaḥ kavibhir nirṇijaṃ dadhe tridhātv asya daṃsasā //
analyzed: sa suṣṭutaḥ kavibhiḥ nirṇijam dadhe tri dhātu asya daṃsasā
translated: Well-praised, he has taken the purifying robe, with the threefold form of his appearance.

original: sa sunve yo vasūnāṃ yo rāyām ānetā ya iḷānām /
analyzed: sa sunve yaḥ vasūnām yaḥ rāyām ānetā yaḥ iḷānām
translated: He is to be pressed, he who is the bringer of treasures, of wealth, and of food.

original: somo yaḥ sukṣitīnām //
analyzed: somaḥ yaḥ su kṣitīnām
translated: Soma is he who is the bringer of good abodes.

original: yasya na indraḥ pibād yasya maruto yasya vāryamaṇā bhagaḥ /
analyzed: yasya naḥ indraḥ pibāt yasya marutaḥ yasya vā aryamaṇā bhagaḥ
translated: Whose (Soma) may Indra drink, whose the Maruts, whose the bounteous ones, Bhaga,

original: ā yena mitrāvaruṇā karāmaha endram avase mahe //
analyzed: ā yena mitrāvaruṇā karāmahe ā indram avase mahe
translated: By whom we may win Mitra, Varuna, Indra for help, for the great (help).

original: indrāya soma pātave nṛbhir yataḥ svāyudho madintamaḥ /
analyzed: indrāya soma pātave nṛbhiḥ yataḥ su āyudhaḥ madintamaḥ
translated: To Indra, O Soma, to drink, urged on by the men, the well-armed, most gladdening one,

original: pavasva madhumattamaḥ //
analyzed: pavasva madhumattamaḥ
translated: Flow on, O most sweet with honey.

original: indrasya hārdi somadhānam ā viśa samudram iva sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: indrasya hārdi soma dhānam ā viśa samudram iva sindhavaḥ
translated: Enter the heart of Indra, the Soma-holder, like rivers into the ocean.

original: juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave divo viṣṭambha uttamaḥ //
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave divaḥ viṣṭambhaḥ uttamaḥ
translated: Beloved by Mitra, Varuna, and Vayu, the highest support of the sky.

original: pari pra dhanvendrāya soma svādur mitrāya pūṣṇe bhagāya //
analyzed: pari pra dhanva indrāya soma svāduḥ mitrāya pūṣṇe bhagāya
translated: Flow on, O Soma, to Indra, sweet, to Mitra, to Pushan, to Bhaga.

original: indras te soma sutasya peyāḥ kratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ te soma sutasya peyāḥ kratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ
translated: Indra is the drinker of thy Soma, O Soma, for wisdom and power, and all the gods.

original: evāmṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukro arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ //🔽pavasva soma mahān samudraḥ pitā devānāṃ viśvābhi dhāma //
analyzed: eva amṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukraḥ arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ  pavasva soma mahān samudraḥ pitā devānām viśva abhi dhāma
translated: So to the great abode of immortality, flow thou on, bright, divine, purifying.🔽Flow on, O Soma, as a great ocean, the father of the gods, to all the worlds.

original: śukraḥ pavasva devebhyaḥ soma dive pṛthivyai śaṃ ca prajāyai //
analyzed: śukraḥ pavasva devebhyaḥ soma dive pṛthivyai śam ca prajāyai
translated: Flow on, O Soma, bright, purifying, to the gods, to heaven, to earth, and to all living beings.

original: divo dhartāsi śukraḥ pīyūṣaḥ satye vidharman vājī pavasva //
analyzed: divaḥ dhartā asi śukraḥ pīyūṣaḥ satye vidharman vājī pavasva
translated: Thou art the supporter of heaven, bright, purifying, a strong steed, flowing on the true path.

original: pavasva soma dyumnī sudhāro mahām avīnām anu pūrvyaḥ //
analyzed: pavasva soma dyumnī su dhāraḥ mahām avīnām anu pūrvyaḥ
translated: Flow on, O Soma, as a glorious, sweet-flowing, great, ancient one among the mighty.

original: nṛbhir yemāno jajñānaḥ pūtaḥ kṣarad viśvāni mandraḥ svarvit //🔽induḥ punānaḥ prajām urāṇaḥ karad viśvāni draviṇāni naḥ //
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ yemānaḥ jajñānaḥ pūtaḥ kṣarat viśvāni mandraḥ svar vid  induḥ punānaḥ prajām urāṇaḥ karat viśvāni draviṇāni naḥ
translated: Urged by men, born, purified, flowing, all things, delightful, finding the light.🔽The moon, purifying, supporting creatures, will bring us all kinds of wealth.

original: pavasva soma kratve dakṣāyāśvo na nikto vājī dhanāya //
analyzed: pavasva soma kratve dakṣāya aśvaḥ na niktaḥ vājī dhanāya
translated: Flow on, O Soma, for wisdom and power, like a bathed steed, a strong horse, for the prize.

original: taṃ te sotāro rasam madāya punanti somam mahe dyumnāya //
analyzed: tam te sotāraḥ rasam madāya punanti somam mahe dyumnāya
translated: Your pressers purify that juice for your rapture, the Soma for great glory.

original: śiśuṃ jajñānaṃ harim mṛjanti pavitre somaṃ devebhya indum //
analyzed: śiśum jajñānam harim mṛjanti pavitre somam devebhyaḥ indum
translated: They cleanse the tawny child, the newly-born, the Soma, Indu, on the filter, for the gods.

original: induḥ paviṣṭa cārur madāyāpām upasthe kavir bhagāya //
analyzed: induḥ paviṣṭa cāruḥ madāya apām upasthe kaviḥ bhagāya
translated: Indu has entered to delight in the beautiful, the sage in the waters' lap for Bhaga.

original: bibharti cārv indrasya nāma yena viśvāni vṛtrā jaghāna //
analyzed: bibharti cāru indrasya nāma yena viśvāni vṛtrā jaghāna
translated: He bears the beautiful name of Indra, by which he slew all the Vr̥itras.

original: pibanty asya viśve devāso gobhiḥ śrītasya nṛbhiḥ sutasya //🔽pra suvāno akṣāḥ sahasradhāras tiraḥ pavitraṃ vi vāram avyam //
analyzed: pibanti asya viśve devāsaḥ gobhiḥ śrītasya nṛbhiḥ sutasya  pra suvānaḥ akṣār sahasra dhāraḥ tiras pavitram vi vāram avyam
translated: All the gods drink of him, of him who is made beautiful with milk, pressed out by men.🔽The juice, flowing in a thousand streams, passes through the filter, through the woollen cloth.

original: sa vājy akṣāḥ sahasraretā adbhir mṛjāno gobhiḥ śrīṇānaḥ //
analyzed: sa vājī akṣār sahasra retāḥ adbhiḥ mṛjānaḥ gobhiḥ śrīṇānaḥ
translated: The strong juice, with a thousand powers, purified with water, made beautiful with milk,

original: pra soma yāhīndrasya kukṣā nṛbhir yemāno adribhiḥ sutaḥ //
analyzed: pra soma yāhi indrasya kukṣā nṛbhiḥ yemānaḥ adribhiḥ sutaḥ
translated: Soma, flow onward to Indra's flanks, urged by the men, pressed out with stones.

original: asarji vājī tiraḥ pavitram indrāya somaḥ sahasradhāraḥ //
analyzed: asarji vājī tiras pavitram indrāya somaḥ sahasra dhāraḥ
translated: The strong steed has been sent forth through the filter, the Soma for Indra, with a thousand streams.

original: añjanty enam madhvo rasenendrāya vṛṣṇa indum madāya //
analyzed: añjanti enam madhvaḥ rasena indrāya vṛṣṇe indum madāya
translated: They anoint him with the essence of the mead, the Indu for Indra, the strong, for rapture.

original: devebhyas tvā vṛthā pājase 'po vasānaṃ harim mṛjanti //
analyzed: devebhyaḥ tvā vṛthā pājase po vasānam harim mṛjanti
translated: For the free-giving gods they cleanse the tawny one, the guest of the waters, with the milk.

original: indur indrāya tośate ni tośate śrīṇann ugro riṇann apaḥ //
analyzed: induḥ indrāya tośate ni tośate śrīṇan ugraḥ riṇan apaḥ
translated: Indu delights Indra, delights him, the strong one, mixing, sending away the waters.

original: pary ū ṣu pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ /🔽dviṣas taradhyā ṛṇayā na īyase //🔽anu hi tvā sutaṃ soma madāmasi mahe samaryarājye /
analyzed: pari u su pra dhanva vāja sātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ  dviṣaḥ taradhyai ṛṇayāḥ naḥ īyase  anu hi tvā sutam soma madāmasi mahe samarya rājye
translated: For the winning of booty, O dart, do thou speed forward, overcoming the foes.🔽Thou goest, O Pavamâna, with a debt against the spiteful man who stays the gift.

original: vājāṃ abhi pavamāna pra gāhase //🔽ajījano hi pavamāna sūryaṃ vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ /
analyzed: vājān abhi pavamāna pra gāhase  ajījanaḥ hi pavamāna sūryam vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ
translated: For we, O Pavamâna, make thee glad with the pressed Soma juice, for the great lordship of battle.🔽O Pavamâna, thou hast generated the Sun, the supporter, the milk,

original: gojīrayā raṃhamāṇaḥ purandhyā //
analyzed: go jīrayā raṃhamāṇaḥ purandhyā
translated: With the swift-moving, longing, tawny-coloured one.

original: ajījano amṛta martyeṣv āṃ ṛtasya dharmann amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ /
analyzed: ajījanaḥ amṛta martyeṣu ām ṛtasya dharman amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ
translated: Thou hast generated the immortal among mortals, the lovely one of the law of the immortal.

original: sadāsaro vājam acchā saniṣyadat //
analyzed: sadā saraḥ vājam acchā saniṣyadat
translated: The ever-youthful one shall win the booty.

original: abhyabhi hi śravasā tatardithotsaṃ na kaṃ cij janapānam akṣitam /
analyzed: abhi abhi hi śravasā tatarditha utsam na kam cit jana pānam akṣitam
translated: For thou hast swollen with fame, as with water, the inexhaustible drinking place of men.

original: śaryābhir na bharamāṇo gabhastyoḥ //
analyzed: śaryābhiḥ na bharamāṇaḥ gabhastyoḥ
translated: As one bearing with his arms the streams of milk.

original: ād īṃ ke cit paśyamānāsa āpyaṃ vasuruco divyā abhy anūṣata /
analyzed: āt īm ke cit paśyamānāsaḥ āpyam vasu rucaḥ divyāḥ abhī anūṣata
translated: Even him, the immortal, whom the bright ones, the divine ones, the Vasus, have sung,

original: vāraṃ na devaḥ savitā vy ūrṇute //
analyzed: vāram na devaḥ savitā vi ūrṇute
translated: The God Savitar unlooses as a bond.

original: tve soma prathamā vṛktabarhiṣo mahe vājāya śravase dhiyaṃ dadhuḥ /
analyzed: tve soma prathamāḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ mahe vājāya śravase dhiyam
translated: O Soma, those who first spread out the sacrificial grass have set their thought on thee, O mighty one, for strength and glory.

original: sa tvaṃ no vīra vīryāya codaya //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ vīra vīryāya codaya
translated: So urge thou us, O hero, to hero deeds.

original: divaḥ pīyūṣam pūrvyaṃ yad ukthyam maho gāhād diva ā nir adhukṣata /
analyzed: divaḥ pīyūṣam pūrvyam yat ukthyam mahaḥ gāhāt divaḥ ā niḥ adhukṣata
translated: The heavenly nectar, the ancient worthy of praise, they have churned out from the great grasp of heaven.

original: indram abhi jāyamānaṃ sam asvaran //
analyzed: indram abhi jāyamānam sam asvaran
translated: They have all sung to Indra as he is born.

original: adha yad ime pavamāna rodasī imā ca viśvā bhuvanābhi majmanā /
analyzed: adha yat ime pavamāna rodasī imā ca viśvā bhuvanā abhi majmanā
translated: And when, O Pavamâna, these two worlds, and all these living things, by thy might,

original: yūthe na niṣṭhā vṛṣabho vi tiṣṭhase //
analyzed: yūthe na niṣṭhāḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vi tiṣṭhase
translated: Thou standest in the herd like a bull to be loosed.

original: somaḥ punāno avyaye vāre śiśur na krīḷan pavamāno akṣāḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ punānaḥ avyaye vāre śiśuḥ na krīḍan pavamānaḥ akṣār
translated: Soma, being purified in the spotless sieve, Pavamâna, as a sporting boy, hath flowed to the beakers.

original: sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja induḥ //
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ śata vājaḥ induḥ
translated: Indu hath a thousand streams, a hundred powers.

original: eṣa punāno madhumāṃ ṛtāvendrāyenduḥ pavate svādur ūrmiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa punānaḥ madhumān ṛtāvā indrāya induḥ pavate svāduḥ ūrmiḥ
translated: This Indu, being purified, full of sweetness, for Indra flows on, a wave of pleasant drink,

original: vājasanir varivovid vayodhāḥ //
analyzed: vāja saniḥ varivaḥ vid vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Winning booty, finding room, bestowing life.

original: sa pavasva sahamānaḥ pṛtanyūn sedhan rakṣāṃsy apa durgahāṇi /
analyzed: sa pavasva sahamānaḥ pṛtanyūn sedhan rakṣāṃsi apa durgahāṇi
translated: Flowing, O Soma, overcoming foes, driving away the Rakshas, passing over the hard to pass,

original: svāyudhaḥ sāsahvān soma śatrūn //🔽ayā rucā hariṇyā punāno viśvā dveṣāṃsi tarati svayugvabhiḥ sūro na svayugvabhiḥ /
analyzed: su āyudhaḥ sāsahvān soma śatrūn  ayā rucā hariṇyā punānaḥ viśvā dveṣāṃsi tarati svayugvabhiḥ sūraḥ na svayugvabhiḥ
translated: O Soma, with thy weapon overcoming the foes.🔽This one, being purified with tawny lustre, with his own powers passes over all enmities, as the sun with his own powers.

original: dhārā sutasya rocate punāno aruṣo hariḥ /
analyzed: dhārā sutasya rocate punānaḥ aruṣaḥ hariḥ
translated: The stream of the juice shines forth, being purified, the red one, the tawny one.

original: viśvā yad rūpā pariyāty ṛkvabhiḥ saptāsyebhir ṛkvabhiḥ //
analyzed: viśvā yat rūpā pariyāti ṛkvabhiḥ sapta āsyebhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ
translated: When he passes through all forms with the Rkv-s, with the seven-mouthed Rkv-s.

original: tvaṃ tyat paṇīnāṃ vido vasu sam mātṛbhir marjayasi sva ā dama ṛtasya dhītibhir dame /
analyzed: tvam tyad paṇīnām vidaḥ vasu sam mātṛbhiḥ marjayasi sve ā dame ṛtasya dhītibhiḥ dame
translated: Thou art that finder of treasures of the Paṇis; thou art purified with the mothers in thy own abode by the thoughts of holy order in the abode.

original: parāvato na sāma tad yatrā raṇanti dhītayaḥ /
analyzed: parāvataḥ na sāma tat yatra raṇanti dhītayaḥ
translated: Far away is that song, where the thoughts resound.

original: tridhātubhir aruṣībhir vayo dadhe rocamāno vayo dadhe //
analyzed: tri dhātubhiḥ aruṣībhiḥ vayaḥ dadhe rocamānaḥ vayaḥ dadhe
translated: With the three-forked, ruddy ones he places the life, shining he places the life.

original: pūrvām anu pradiśaṃ yāti cekitat saṃ raśmibhir yatate darśato ratho daivyo darśato rathaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvām anu pradiśam yāti cekitat sam raśmibhiḥ yatate darśataḥ rathaḥ daivyaḥ darśataḥ rathaḥ
translated: He goes forth, looking around, to the eastern quarter; the beautiful chariot is yoked with the rays, the beautiful chariot of the gods.

original: agmann ukthāni pauṃsyendraṃ jaitrāya harṣayan /
analyzed: agman ukthāni pauṃsyā indram jaitrāya harṣayan
translated: The hymns have come to Indra for victory, gladdening him for conquest,

original: vajraś ca yad bhavatho anapacyutā samatsv anapacyutā //
analyzed: vajraḥ ca yat bhavathaḥ an apacyutā samatsu an apacyutā
translated: When ye become the thunderbolt, never to be turned aside, never to be turned aside in battles.

original: nānānaṃ vā u no dhiyo vi vratāni janānām /
analyzed: nānānam vai u naḥ dhiyaḥ vi vratāni janānām
translated: Our thoughts are many, and the vows of the people are various.

original: takṣā riṣṭaṃ rutam bhiṣag brahmā sunvantam icchatīndrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: takṣā riṣṭam rutam bhiṣaj brahmā sunvantam icchati indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The carpenter desires the wounded with his tools, the priest desires the Soma-presser. Flow around, O Indu, to Indra.

original: jaratībhir oṣadhībhiḥ parṇebhiḥ śakunānām /
analyzed: jaratībhiḥ oṣadhībhiḥ parṇebhiḥ śakunānām
translated: With the old plants, with the feathers of birds,

original: kārmāro aśmabhir dyubhir hiraṇyavantam icchatīndrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: kārmāraḥ aśmabhiḥ dyubhiḥ hiraṇyavantam icchati indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The smith with the stones that shine desires him who has gold. Flow around, O Indu, to Indra.

original: kārur ahaṃ tato bhiṣag upalaprakṣiṇī nanā /
analyzed: kāruḥ aham tatas bhiṣaj upala prakṣiṇī nanā
translated: I am the physician from there, the one who removes the stone.

original: nānādhiyo vasūyavo 'nu gā iva tasthimendrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: nānā dhiyaḥ vasūyavaḥ nu gāḥ iva tasthima indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The various thoughts, seeking wealth, stand firm like cows. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: aśvo voḷhā sukhaṃ rathaṃ hasanām upamantriṇaḥ /🔽śepo romaṇvantau bhedau vār in maṇḍūka icchatīndrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: aśvaḥ voḍhā sukham ratham hasanām upamantriṇaḥ  śepaḥ romaṇvantau bhedau vār id maṇḍūkaḥ icchati indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The horse, the cart, the pleasant chariot, the laughters, the advisers,🔽the penis, the hairy ones, the two clefts, the water, the frog desires. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: śaryaṇāvati somam indraḥ pibatu vṛtrahā /
analyzed: śaryaṇāvati somam indraḥ pibatu vṛtrahā
translated: In the Saranyûvati (river) may Indra, the Vrtra-killer, drink the Soma.

original: balaṃ dadhāna ātmani kariṣyan vīryam mahad indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: balam dadhānaḥ ātmani kariṣyan vīryam mahat indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Placing strength in himself, about to perform great deeds, flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: ā pavasva diśām pata ārjīkāt soma mīḍhvaḥ /
analyzed: ā pavasva diśām pate ārjīkāt soma mīḍhvaḥ
translated: Flow on, O lord of the quarters, from the Ârjîka, O Soma, the bountiful,

original: ṛtavākena satyena śraddhayā tapasā suta indrāyendo pari srava //🔽parjanyavṛddham mahiṣaṃ taṃ sūryasya duhitābharat /
analyzed: ṛtavākena satyena śraddhayā tapasā sutaḥ indrāya indo pari srava  parjanya vṛddham mahiṣam tam sūryasya duhitā abharat
translated: with the truth of holy order, with faith, with penance, pressed out. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: taṃ gandharvāḥ praty agṛbhṇan taṃ some rasam ādadhur indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: tam gandharvāḥ prati agṛbhṇan tam some rasam ādadhuḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The Gandharvas have seized him, they have placed that essence in the Soma. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: ṛtaṃ vadann ṛtadyumna satyaṃ vadan satyakarman /
analyzed: ṛtam vadan ṛta dyumna satyam vadan satya karman
translated: Speaking truth, having the splendour of truth, speaking truth, performing true rites,

original: śraddhāṃ vadan soma rājan dhātrā soma pariṣkṛta indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: śraddhām vadan soma rājan dhātrā soma pariṣkṛtaḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: speaking faith, O Soma, O king, purified by the creator, flow around, O Soma, for Indra.

original: satyamugrasya bṛhataḥ saṃ sravanti saṃsravāḥ /
analyzed: satyam ugrasya bṛhataḥ sam sravanti saṃsravāḥ
translated: The outpourings of the mighty and terrible one flow together.

original: saṃ yanti rasino rasāḥ punāno brahmaṇā hara indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: sam yanti rasinaḥ rasāḥ punānaḥ brahmaṇā haraḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The juices of the juices flow together. Purified by prayer, O impetuous one, O Indu, flow to Indra.

original: yatra brahmā pavamāna chandasyāṃ vācaṃ vadan /
analyzed: yatra brahmā pavamāna chandasyām vācam vadan
translated: Where, O Pavamâna, the Brahman, speaking the metre-formed speech,

original: grāvṇā some mahīyate somenānandaṃ janayann indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: grāvṇā some mahīyate somena ānandam janayan indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Is magnified with the stone in the Soma, causing joy in the Soma, O Indu, flow to Indra.

original: yatra jyotir ajasraṃ yasmiṃl loke svar hitam /
analyzed: yatra jyotiḥ ajasram yasmin loke svar hitam
translated: Where the imperishable light is, in that world where heaven is set,

original: tasmin māṃ dhehi pavamānāmṛte loke akṣita indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: tasmin mām dhehi pavamāna amṛte loke akṣite indrāya indo pari srava
translated: There place me, O Pavamâna, in the undecaying world, O Indu, flow to Indra.

original: yatra rājā vaivasvato yatrāvarodhanaṃ divaḥ /
analyzed: yatra rājā vaivasvataḥ yatra avarodhanam divaḥ
translated: Where the king Vivasvan is, where is the enclosure of the sky,

original: yatrāmūr yahvatīr āpas tatra mām amṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: yatra amūḥ yahvatīḥ āpaḥ tatra mām amṛtam kṛdhi indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Where the mighty waters are, there make me immortal, O Indu, flow to Indra.

original: yatrānukāmaṃ caraṇaṃ trināke tridive divaḥ /
analyzed: yatra anukāmam caraṇam trināke tridive divaḥ
translated: Where the course of desire is, in the three-peaked, three-fold heaven of the sky,

original: lokā yatra jyotiṣmantas tatra mām amṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: lokāḥ yatra jyotiṣmantaḥ tatra mām amṛtam kṛdhi indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Where the luminous worlds are, there make me immortal, O Indu, flow to Indra.

original: yatra kāmā nikāmāś ca yatra bradhnasya viṣṭapam /
analyzed: yatra kāmāḥ nikāmāḥ ca yatra bradhnasya viṣṭapam
translated: Where desires and fulfilled desires are, where is the expanse of the sun,

original: svadhā ca yatra tṛptiś ca tatra mām amṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: svadhā ca yatra tṛptiḥ ca tatra mām amṛtam kṛdhi indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Where is the oblation and satisfaction, there make me immortal, O Indu, flow to Indra.

original: yatrānandāś ca modāś ca mudaḥ pramuda āsate /
analyzed: yatra ānandāḥ ca modāḥ ca mudaḥ pramudaḥ āsate
translated: Where joys and raptures and delights and great delights are seated,

original: kāmasya yatrāptāḥ kāmās tatra mām amṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava //🔽ya indoḥ pavamānasyānu dhāmāny akramīt /
analyzed: kāmasya yatra āptāḥ kāmāḥ tatra mām amṛtam kṛdhi indrāya indo pari srava  yaḥ indoḥ pavamānasya anu dhāmāni akramīt
translated: Where desires are fulfilled, make me immortal there. Flow on, O Indu, to Indra.🔽He who has followed the forms of Soma Pavamana,

original: tam āhuḥ suprajā iti yas te somāvidhan mana indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: tam āhuḥ suprajāḥ iti yaḥ te soma avidhat manaḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: him they call well-born. O Soma, he whose mind is inclined to you, flow on, O Indu, to Indra.

original: ṛṣe mantrakṛtāṃ stomaiḥ kaśyapodvardhayan giraḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣe mantra kṛtām stomaiḥ kaśyapa udvardhayan giraḥ
translated: O Rishi, with the hymns composed by the sages, Kashyapa, exalting the songs,

original: somaṃ namasya rājānaṃ yo jajñe vīrudhām patir indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: somam namasya rājānam yaḥ jajñe vīrudhām patiḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: reverencing Soma the king, who was born as the lord of the plants, flow on, O Indu, to Indra.

original: sapta diśo nānāsūryāḥ sapta hotāra ṛtvijaḥ /
analyzed: sapta diśaḥ nānā sūryāḥ sapta hotāraḥ ṛtvijaḥ
translated: The seven directions with different suns, the seven priests the Hotars,

original: devā ādityā ye sapta tebhiḥ somābhi rakṣa na indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: devāḥ ādityāḥ ye sapta tebhiḥ soma abhi rakṣa naḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: the seven Adityas, the gods, by them, O Soma, protect us. Flow on, O Indu, to Indra.

original: yat te rājañ chṛtaṃ havis tena somābhi rakṣa naḥ /
analyzed: yat te rājam śṛtam haviḥ tena soma abhi rakṣa naḥ
translated: Whatever oblation has been prepared for you, O king, by that, O Soma, protect us.

original: arātīvā mā nas tārīn mo ca naḥ kiṃ canāmamad indrāyendo pari srava //
analyzed: arātīvā mā naḥ tārīt mā u ca naḥ kim cana amamat indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Do not lead us to misfortune, nor let anything be wanting to us. Flow on, O Indu, to Indra.
